loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 28-year-old Palestinian refugee who is the sole breadwinner for his 6 other family members.

Ahmad opened his current grocery store in 2013. He has been working hard to increase its capital and diversify his products so he can not only provide himself with a good income but also develop his family's social and financial well-being.

For this reason, Ahmad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with special spring and summer beverages as well as special-offer products.

Ahmad hopes that in the future he can manage to turn his small grocery store into a wide supermarket, where he can fulfill most of his customers' needs and his family's requests.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special spring and summer beverages as well as to special-offer products.

loans.name: Tarez

texts.en:
Tarez is a 19-year-old, single, young lady from Bethlehem city. She lives with her mother in a simple house. Her father died when she was very young. 

Tarez is a student in a beauty center. She wants to complete her studies and open her own business in the future and specialize in nail art.
 
Tarez took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the training expenses in the beauty center. This will help her to finish her studies faster and open her own business. 

Tarez appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the training expenses in the beauty center

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 24 years old and is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Angeline has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She has requested a 11,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy more inventory of ready-to-wear to sell.

Angeline has been in this business for 2 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 38 years old and married with four children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

He used the previous loan to buy sand and cement for renovating his house. Due to the increase in prices of building materials, the money was not enough to complete the construction. Emmanuel needs another loan to buy iron sheets to roof his house. He will be supplementing it with the proceeds from crop production such as cabbages, tomatoes, sweet potatoes and many others.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets to roof his house

loans.name: Bonus

texts.en: Bonus is a 23-year-old hard working, single man. He has no children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling crude salt for the last four years. He also owns a motorcycle transportation business to earn additional income. He has a dream of becoming rich. However, Bonus has complained of limited capital and unpredictable weather changes, limiting his business growth. Bonus has requested a loan to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.name: Najea

texts.en:
Najea continues to maintain her business. She has expanded her area in the shuk (open air market)  and continues to sell a variety of clothing and additional products.

She needed this loan to introduce new stock and improve the area of her stand.

Najea has personal and business goals for her future. First, she wants to finish preparations for her son’s marriage and prepare items for her daughter’s wedding. For her business, she wants to develop a boutique store at the shuk that one day that will have customers from all over her city.

loans.use: to introduce new stock and improve the area of her stand.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aida es una mujer humilde 46 años de edad, dedicada a fabricar billeteras artesanales muy hermosas, en la foto podemos ver como sostiene su producto, con esta actividad apoya a su marido en el sostenimiento de su hogar, vive en una casa hecha con madera, junto con sus 5 hijos  de 10, 8, 15, 16, 18 años de edad.

Aida aprendió del negocio gracias a su madre y desde el año 2006 viene realizando esta actividad, buscando una mejor condiciones de vida, darle estudio a sus hijos, reformar su casa, quiere que ese rancho un día se reconstruya en material (concreto), progresar, tener un almacén, clientes mayoristas.

Solicita el préstamo el cual invertirá en materiales para la fabricación de sus billeteras, este préstamo será un gran impulso ya que Aida podrá fabricar un mayor número de billeteras y para ello esto significa aumento en ventas, posibilidad de tener nuevos clientes, ser un poco más competitiva y darle sostenibilidad a su negocio
texts.en:
Aida is a humble 46 year old woman who works making very pretty craft purses. In the photos we can see examples of her products. She supports her husband and the upkeep of her home with this work. She lives in a house made of wood along with her 5 children who are 10, 8, 15, 16 and 18 years old. 
Aida learned this business from her mother and has been doing this since 2006. She is seeking a better quality of life, and education for her children, and home renovations - she hopes that her house will one day be reconstructed in concrete. She also wants to have a storehouse and wholesale customers. 
She is requesting the loan to invest in materials for making her wallets. This loan will be a great help as Aida will be able to make a greater number of wallets and this will enable her to increase her sales and possibly to gain new customers, to be a little more competitive, and to make her business sustainable.

loans.use: to buy materials to make the purses shown in the photo.

loans.name: Carlos Florentin

texts.es:
Carlos, de 54 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañado y su pareja trabaja en los oficios domésticos y hace tamales de elote para vender; tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales solo tres viven con él.

Carlos, trabaja con ganado bovino desde hace más de 20 años y lo aprendió de su padre; decidió hacerlo para buscar un ingreso económico extra para su familia.- El ganado lo utilizaban también para transportar agua para el consumo, porque no tenía agua potable.- Carlos, también trabaja la agricultura.

Carlos, necesita el crédito para comprar ganado de doble propósito, con está adquisición mejorará mucho su negocio y le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos para su familia.

Sus sueños son, seguir trabajando lo mejor que se pueda, para buscar un mejor futuro para su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
45 year old Carlos did not go to school. He has a partner who is a domestic worker and makes corn tamales to sell. He has 5 children, of whom only 3 live with him. 
Carlos has been working with cattle for 20 years and he learned this work from his father. He decided to do this to earn extra income for his family. He also uses the cattle to transport drinking water, as he doesn't have piped water in his home. Carlos also works as a farmer. 
Carlos needs the loan to buy dual purpose cattle. With this purchase, he will significantly improve his business and it will enable him to get greater income for his family.
His dreams are to keep working the best that he can, to seek a better future for his family, and to give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy dual purpose cattle.

loans.name: Marlene Elisa

texts.es: Marlene tiene 52 años de edad, Marlene tiene 3 hijos de 15, 27 y 30 años de edad, Marlene vive con su hija que tiene 15 años y asiste al colegio, Marlene  vive en el campo junto a sus hija y su esposo que es agricultor, Marlene se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y el dinero del crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para mejorar su negocio por ende sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su hija.
texts.en: Marlene is 52 years old. She has 3 children of 15, 27, and 30 years old. Marlene lives with her daughter who is 15 years old and attends school. Marlene lives in the country with her daughter and her husband who is a farmer. Marlene makes a living raising small animals and she will invest the loan's money in the purchase of chickens to improve her business, therefore her income, and to get her daughter ahead.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Manchester United Grp Musoma Group

texts.en:
Simion, who is in his early 30s, is married with two kids who are still in school.  He has been running a business of taking video and still photos at functions, and also still photos door-to-door, for six years now. He works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Simion's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy another up-to-date camera for better photos and clear videos. He dreams of having his own company.

Simion will share this loan with his group Manchester United Grp Musoma, which consists of 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy an up-to-date camera for better photos and clear videos.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Las Margaritas” La cual  está constituida por 05 socias emprendedoras y entusiastas. Lady de 30 años de edad es separada y tiene 2 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa lo cual lo realiza por pedido. El deseo de Lady es seguir surgiendo en su negocio para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de polos faldas y pantalones. El grupo “Las Margaritas” agradece a todas las personas que facilitaron este crédito. Lady es la segunda del lado derecho viste polo negro y pantalón celeste.
texts.en:
This is “Las Margaritas” group, which is made up of 5 enterprising and enthusiastic members. Lady is 30 years old. She is separated and has 2 dependent children. She is dedicated to selling clothing, which she does by order. Lady’s dream is to continue growing her business to give her children a better quality of life. 

She requested the loan to buy polo shirts, skirts, and pants. 

The “Las Margaritas” group is thankful to all the people who facilitate this loan. Lady is the second person from the right; she is wearing a black shirt and light blue pants.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts, skirts, and pants.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es: Don Oswaldo se dedica a la agricultura siembra tomate, maíz, frijol y café. Ya ha tenido varios créditos y ha sido bien responsable en sus pagos el sueño de él es tener algún día su invernadero y por ello es que lucha. Sus pagos los ha hecho puntuales,  Ahora ha implementado crianza de cerdos y para ello solicita el crédito para comprar concentrado, cerdos y vitaminas.les agradece por su ayuda ya que poco a poco ha crecido y gracias a los creditos que a recibido de kiva.
texts.en:
Mr. Oswaldo is dedicated to agriculture. He grows tomatoes, corn, beans, and coffee. He has already had many loans and has been responsible in his repayments. 

His dream is to someday have a greenhouse, and it is for this that he fights. His payments have been made punctually. 

Now, he has starting raising pigs, and for this, he requests a loan to buy pellets, pigs, and vitamins. He is thankful for the help, since little by little he has grown thanks to the loans he has received from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy pigs, pellets, and vitamins.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 50 years old and is married with 4 children. With one child still in school, she works very hard to provide for all of them.

Marivic runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional items to sell such as toothpaste, canned goods, biscuits, milk, juice, candies, vinegar, etc.

Marivic has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as toothpaste, canned goods, biscuits, milk, juice, candies, vinegar, etc. 

Marivic would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as toothpaste, canned goods, biscuits, milk, juice, candies, vinegar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her own school fees.

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Costeñas Group

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer de 28 años de edad, está  unida con su esposo con el que tiene cuatro hijos de las edades entre  4 y 11 años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuela (es la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de blusa color gris) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la elaboración de  ropa típica de su región, ella tiene cuatro años de realizar esta labor  en el lugar de su domicilio.
Manuela gracias a la creatividad con la que elabora los trajes, mucha gente de su comunidad lo busca, ella es una mujer muy optimista que le gusta superar con esfuerzo y dedicación, entonces desde hace algún tiempo había decidido comprar más materiales para poder seguir elaborando trajes que ahora se encuentra de moda, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder comprar sus materiales, pero ella es una mujer que a pesar de ser madre es una líder en su comunidad y ahora ha organizado a un grupo de personas para solicitar juntos un crédito que lo invertirán comprando hilos, de tipo seda,  alemán lustrina.
El gran sueño de Manuela es poder conseguir el crédito para poder mejorar la calidad de sus productos para poder obtener mejores ingresos y construir una casa de block.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 28-year-old woman. She is married to a husband, with whom she has four children, who are aged between 4 and 11 years old. This beautiful family lives in the community of Sololá.

Manuela (who is the first from the left in the photograph, with the gray shirt) has the desire to earn her income and support her husband with the household expenses. She is dedicated to making traditional clothing from her region. She has four years of experience in this work, which she does in her home. 

Thanks to the creativity with which she makes her outfits, many people in her community seek her out. She is a very optimistic woman, who likes to improve with her strength and dedication. Thus, some time ago, she had decided to buy more materials so that she can continue making her clothing, which is now in fashion. However, one of the difficulties she has is that she does not have enough capital to be able to buy her materials. She is a woman, who—despite being a mother—is a leader in her community and now has organized a group of people to request a loan. They will invest in buying German silk thread. 

Manuela’s biggest dream is to be able to get the loan to be able to improve the quality of her products to be able to earn a better income and build a block house.

loans.use: to buy German silk thread to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is married and works hard to support her family. She has been operating a general store business in the Philippines for five years now.

Norma is requesting a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Kifah

texts.en:
Kifah is a 45-year-old Palestinian refugee and is married with four children. He works hard, since he is his family's sole breadwinner to provide them with the necessary living needs, in addition to educational expenses.

Kifah dreams of a better future for his family members, but unfortunately, Palestinian refugees have certain limits they can't cross in Lebanon so that they won't conflict with the Lebanese population rights. Thus, developing his business is the most important thing for him to stay capable of providing his family with the necessary living needs.

Today, Kifah is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with necessary raw materials, such as flour, oil, thyme and cheese, necessary for his business development.

He is very anxious and optimistic about this loan, although it is his tenth loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. Kifah describes his relationship with Al Majmoua as the Godfather; he believes that Al Majmoua is his business companion who supports him in every step he takes forward.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with necessary raw materials, such as flour, oil, thyme and cheese, necessary for his business development.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is from Mahayag, in the Philippines. She and her husband have agricultural land and earn a living through farming. They have had also cultivated  rice land near their home. 

Conchita makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. She recently needed a loan from Paglaum MPC to finance farming activities such as clearing, holing and planting on her land. She wishes to sustain her business and to be able to supply more crops in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to finance farming activities such as clearing, holing and planting on her land

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 55 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Rizalina has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rizalina has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jacent

texts.en:
Jacent is 45 years old. He lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. He deals in cocoa farming and selling. Jacent started the business to raise income for his family and supplement the salary he earns as a primary school teacher. 

Jacent's clients are mainly cocoa companies and dealers. He hopes to expand the cocoa business and be able to make more money to complete construction of his house. He has asked for a loan to buy building materials like cement and iron sheets to construct his house.

loans.use: To buy building materials like cement and iron sheets to construct his house.

loans.name: Equator School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Denis. He is the Head teacher of Equator College, a mixed school in the urban area of Lugazi in Buikwe with 740 students. 

Equator College has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Equator College will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Denis ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Gurali

texts.en:
Gurali is in his sixties and is a married father of a 25-year-old son. He lives in a very rural village where he has been practicing selling snacks to the kids. He sells from a ‘kiosk’, as it is called locally, or a small booth, in English, in the village school.

The family income is approximately $60/month from some retirement pension of an elderly parent who lives with them, enough for medication of the parent. Thus, whatever, Gurali makes from selling the snacks is the only income for the family.

The village where Gurali and his family live is situated just in the midst of mountains and as such, it suffers from bitter winters. This makes it impossible for villagers to focus on agriculture because there is no land to practice this activity, neither to plant nor to have animals. Due to such difficulties, some young people have abandoned the village, leaving behind their parents.

loans.use: to stock up the kiosk he operates with snacks and other items.

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Zainab is 38 years old and is often described as a very resourceful person. She has three children and is married. As a group leader, Zainab is representing her group of ten farmers in Butere District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Zainab's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

Zainab and her group will receive a total of nine solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Julio Enrique

texts.es:
Julio, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos que aún viven en casa y uno estudia, también vive con ellos una sobrina, pero no depende económicamente de él.

Julio, trabaja con ganado bovino de repasto desde hace un año y lo aprendió de un hermano y decidió continuar haciéndolo, para obtener ingresos económicos para su familia; también trabaja en una planta de gas propano, la distancia que viaja en bicicleta hasta donde está su ganado es de 3 kilómetros de su casa.

Julio, solicita el crédito para comprar ganado de repasto bovino, con esto continuará trabajando con ganado y tendrá que abandonar su empleo en la planta de gas, por lo tanto le permitirá tener mejor calidad de vida.

Sus sueños son, incrementar su hato de ganado bovino y mejorar día a día las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Julio is 31 years old and studied up to the ninth grade. He is married and his wife is dedicated to domestic chores. They have two children who still live at home, one of whom is in school. Also, a niece lives with them but does not depend on them economically.

Julio has worked with cattle in his own pasture for the past year, a skill he learned from his brother. He has decided to continue doing so, in order to gain income for his family.  In addition, he works in a propane gas plant. The distance he travels from his house via bicycle to where his cattle are is some three kilometers.

Julio is requesting a loan to purchase additional cattle for his pasture. With this effort, he will continue working with cattle and will have to abandon his job in the gas plant. This will permit him to have a better quality of life.

His dreams are to increase his herd of cattle and improve, day to day, the conditions of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise in his pasture.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is a 22-year-old single lady, who decided in 2010 to start her own souvenirs and special occasions business.

Mira loves her work a lot. Since childhood she watched others working on special occasions themes and souvenirs, and she worked hard on developing her own talents in this domain, until she established her own business. Her business is going on just fine, but just like most business, it needs to be supported with good business capital so that it can generate good income.

Mira currently can't develop her business from its income due to certain engagements that limit her from diversifying her business needs properly. For this reason, she is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special occasions themes and items that will attract customers' attention and diversify her creations.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special occassions themes and items that will attract customers' attention and diversify her creations

loans.name: Pilarina

texts.en:
Pilarina is 44 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Pilarina works very hard to provide for them.

Pilarina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Pilarina has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, sugar, candies, canned goods, soft drinks, detergent soap, etc.

Pilarina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia is 43 years old and married with four children. With one of her children currently in school, Rogelia works very hard to provide for them.

Rogelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock, such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, cereals, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioners, etc., to sell.

Rogelia has been in this business for twelve years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, cereals, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioners, etc.

Rogelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock, such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, cereals, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioners, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Ruby is 52 years old, married, and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Ruby runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries, including biscuits, candies, soft drinks, canned goods, noodles and eggs, to sell. Ruby has been in this business for five years and sells a great variety of items. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries, including biscuits, candies, soft drinks, canned goods, noodles and eggs, to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is 53 years old and has four children. She is married, and one of her children is still in school. Wilma raises livestock in the Philippines. She applied for a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to use in raising her livestock. Wilma has been raising livestock for 30 years, and she has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. Wilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to use in raising her livestock.

loans.name: Kihondo Abagambakamu Group

texts.en:
Gloria is a member of Kihondo Abagambakamu, where members guarantee each other, and is involved in running a bar and also does agriculture. 

She is faced with challenges of competition and low capital that make her lag behind in her business. However, she is working very hard to expand her business to new areas in order to obtain more profits. Gloria has asked for a loan to add stock of beers and sodas for sale.

loans.use: to add stock of beers and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cocoa for resale

loans.name: Francis's Group

texts.en: Featured in the above picture is Francis, who has been a farmer for nine years. Although he is pictured alone, he is actually representing his group of nine farmers in Butere District, Kenya. Francis has always been described as a very reliable person, which is the main reason he was selected to be the group leader. Francis started working with One Acre Fund for the first time in 2013. This year he has decided to get not only farming inputs but also a solar lamp with his loan. He is very excited about this new addition, as now he will be able to have light during the night and also have a place to charge his phone. He can’t wait to send his children to school with the profits he earns in the coming season. Francis’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.25 acres using the farming inputs obtained with this loan, and they will also receive a total of 5 solar lamps.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his maize harvests.

loans.name: Bundimasoli Kweyamba Group

texts.en: Tereza, whose hand is raised, is a member of Bundimasoli Kweyamba Group, where the members guarantee each other’s loan obligations. She is married, has five children, and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Tereza is a hardworking woman who sells foodstuffs and earns additional income by growing cocoa. She is involved in these businesses to earn income and meet her family’s increasing needs. She is adversely affected by bad weather, competition, and limited capital, which poses challenges for expanding her business and building a good house for her family. Tereza has applied for a loan to buy more foodstuffs, such as beans, cassava flour, groundnuts, cabbages and tomatoes, for resale. The three extra people in the photo are group members who have guaranteed the loans of their fellow members in accordance with the policy but have not taken out loans themselves.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Bundinyama Commercial Farmers Group

texts.en:
Melida is married with seven children; and lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. She deals in the cocoa business - mainly growing, buying and selling in markets. 

She started the business to raise income for the family and school fees for the children. Her main challenge to attaining hopes of expanding the business, educating her children all the way to university, and supporting her family members is limited capital. 

Melida has asked for a loan to buy more cocoa for selling. She is a member of Bundinyama commercial farmers group where members guarantee one another for a loan.

loans.use: To buy cocoa for resale to her customers

loans.name: Dusia

texts.en:
Dusia is 57 years old. She lives with her pensioner parents in Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. Dusia is unemployed, and she decided to start her own business and increase her family’s income.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,200 USD. With the received credit, she will purchase a stock of clothes and will start a trading business. This will give her a chance to get a monthly income and improve the living conditions of her parents.

loans.use: to begin a trade in clothes.

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine is 42 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has 3 children and is married. As a group leader, Catherine is representing her group of 16 farmers in Butere District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Catherine's desire to earn enough to feed her family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to rent more land to cultivate in.

Catherine and her group will receive a total of 13 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 9.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Zura's Group

texts.en:
Zura, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Zura is representing her group of eleven farmers in Butere District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Zura has been a farmer for fourteen years and, in order to earn enough to feed her family, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs, but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Zura is planning to save more money for the future.

A total of 6.75 acres will be planted by Zura's Group, and between them they will receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Reimis

texts.en:
For the past year, Reimis has been operating a tire changing auto shop in the city of Korca where he resides. He is 28 years old and single, yet like the majority of youngsters in Albania, and being the only child to his parents, he lives with them. They are retirees who receive a monthly pension of approximately $270.

“My parents’ pension is not enough to cover their medical expenses, let alone to pay for food and other things they need for themselves. Running this little shop has been good overall; the little income I have been generating from it obviously has helped us. I see a steady growth in clientele, and this makes me believe that down the road it will be a good activity to have,” said Reimis to the loan officer who interviewed him.

Reimis is applying for this loan to stock up on new tires that will be used to replace the damaged tires of clients.

loans.use: to buy new tires that he will use to replace the damaged tires of his clients.

loans.name: Karibea Group

texts.en:
Tetula, who is in her early 40s, is married with one child who is still in school. She has been selling cosmetics for five years now. She works from 9:00 am to 6:30 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Tetula's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing her cosmetics stock and has been able to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a desktop, loan repayments and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy different types of up-to-date cosmetics to meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of buying a shamba (a cultivated plot of land), for raising chickens.

Tetula will share this loan with her loan group Karibea, which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy different types of up-to-date cosmetics to meet her customers' requirements

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en:
Marcia is 51 years old and has three children. Marcia is married, and one of her children is still in school.

Marcia is in the agricultural business of raising livestock in the Philippines. Marcia requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marcia has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Marcia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a pottery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Josephine is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 45 years old and has two children. She is married, and her two children are in school.

Imelda is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Imelda has been in pig-fattening for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Leonita works hard to support her family.

She has a pottery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Leonita is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials needed for her pottery business.

Leonita has been sustaining her business activities through her past fifteen loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for her pottery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda, is a hardworking woman dealing in cocoa buying and selling. She got involved in the businesses to earn income and meet the increasing family demands. She has a cocoa garden where she gets additional income. She is challenged by bad weather and limited capital that hinder expansion of her cocoa business.  

Beatrice has asked for a loan to buy more cocoa for selling.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent cocoa gardens for future harvesting and resale to her customers.

loans.name: Janeth Rocio

texts.es: Janeth es una mujer casada, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, ella siempre se había desempeñado como ama de casa a servirle a su esposo y a sus hijos, pero esto cambio en enero del año 2013 cuando motivada por generar recursos decidió convertirse en emprendedora montando un Cibercafé, para ella ha sido una gran experiencia pues le da la satisfacción de sentirse útil, de generar ingresos y ahora quiere que la ayudes a crecer, a ser mejor empresaria, a que su negocio salga a flote y lo puedes hacer apoyándola en un préstamo el cual invertirá en equipos de cómputo para que más personas se beneficien de sus servicios puesto que ha tenido buen aceptación en su zona.
texts.en: Janeth is a married woman. She has three older children. She has always been a homemaker tending to her husband and children, but this changed in 2013. She was motivated by generating income and decided to become an entrepreneur by opening a cyber cafe. It's been a great experience for her because it allows her to feel useful and make money. Now she wants you to help her grow and become a better business woman. Her loan will be invested in computer equipment so that more people can benefit from her services since she has had good acceptance in her community.

loans.use: purchase computer equipment so she can serve more people.

loans.name: Butembe School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Deogratias. He is the head teacher of Butembe Secondary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Mafubira with 400 students.

Butembe School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Butembe School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Deogratias ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Mukono High School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Harriet. She is the head teacher of Mukono High School, a mixed school in the urban area of Mukono with 2,000 students. 

Mukono High School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water, and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water-filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water-treatment system with a 450 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mukono High School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Harriet ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en: Rose is 44, the proud mother of five children. She is the group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing 14 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Rose has observed that she has had increased profits from each harvest. Rose described her harvest as excellent last year, but she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited because she is also buying two solar lamps, in addition to fertilizer and maize seed, so that she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy more land to cultivate. With this loan, Rose’s Group will be able to plant a total of 9 acres of land and buy a total of 20 solar lamps.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lamps and gain access to cost-effective hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Namiryango School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Deborah. She is the head teacher of Namiryango Secondary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Seeta in Mukono with 750 students. 

Namiryango School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water, and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water-filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water-treatment system with a 750-liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Namiryango School will repay its loan from its school fees, which it collects each term. Deborah ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen vive con sus padres y hermanos, y comenta que a la vez que estudia también trabaja como cajera en un supermercado está cursando el segundo año de la carrera de Administración de Empresas, y va a la universidad de noche.
Ella tiene como meta terminar la carrera y encontrar un  trabajo donde pueda poner en práctica sus conocimientos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de los gastos de su tesis, ya que con ello podrá cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Karen lives with her parents and siblings. She says that she is studying while holding down a job as a cashier at a supermarket. Karen is in her second year of study toward a degree in Business Administration. She attends the university at night.

Karen’s goal is to finish her degree so that she can secure a job where she can utilize her knowledge. She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in her thesis expenses. The loan will allow her to cover this outstanding expense.

loans.use: to pay her thesis expenses.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 27-year-old married mother of two children, who decided in August 2014 to start her own business from her house to support her husband in covering their increasing living needs.

Mariam started selling beauty cosmetics, perfumes, and shampoo from her house, because at present she can't afford opening her own shop.  In the future, she hopes that she can take this step forward towards business expansion.

Mariam is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with the special Spring and Summer newly released collection items that are highly requested by her customers.

This is Mariam's first loan cycle as Al Majmoua borrower, she hopes that through her experiences she can open her own shop.

loans.use: buy business merchandise from the special Spring and Summer newly released collection items highly requested by her customers

loans.name: Zeyad

texts.en:
Zeyad is a 29-year-old married man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his wife and four kids, three sons and one daughter.

Zeyad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely covering all the family's needs. He decided to find an additional job which is distributing goods using a rickshaw.

Zeyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy products from the wholesalers and distribute them to the local traders. This will increase his income and also his family's living conditions. 

Zeyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy products from the wholesalers and distribute them to the local traders

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen del Rosario está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres. Esta ubicado en la Ciudad de Caacupé, donde las 15 integrantes del comité realizan muchos esfuerzos para así poder salir adelante junto con sus familias. 
Entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Estanislada quien posee una gallinería, gracias a esa actividad mantiene a su familia y cada día va mejorando su calidad de vida.
El  fin de este préstamo es que ella pueda comprar insumos para poder comprar materiales de construcción para agrandar su gallinería, también para la compra de más gallinas y sus alimentos. Ella es una persona muy luchadora y por sobre todo trabajadora que se esfuerza cada día para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group named “Virgen del Rosario” is in its sixth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. This group is from the city of Caacupé and has 15 committee members who are working hard so that they can move forward along with their families.

One member who stands out is Sra. Estanislada, who has a poultry farm. Thanks to this business, she is able to sustain her family and improve their quality of life each day. With her loan, Estanislada will buy supplies such as construction materials for expanding a chicken coop. She will also acquire more chickens and feed. Estanislada is a very determined individual, but most importantly she is a hard worker who strives each day to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for enlarging a chicken coop and to acquire chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorna is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lorna has a pottery business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

Lorna has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money to renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery business

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a married 35-year-old woman and mother of two children. One of her children is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Amelita has a repair shop business in the Philippines. 

Amelita requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and tools for her business.

Amelita has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Amelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Gelyn

texts.en:
Gelyn is 47 years old, married with three children, and one of her children is in school.

Gelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gelyn has borrowed and repaid twelve loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

Gelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married mother of six, Alicia works hard to support her family. She has a food production business in the Philippines, and also earns income from rice retailing.  

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF.  She is now borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Alicia hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Gelita

texts.en:
Gelita is 43 years old and married with 10 children. With six of her children currently in school, Gelita works very hard to provide for them.

Gelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Gelita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as bath soap, eggs, sugar, cereals, sanitary pads, etc. 

In the future, Gelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Ginalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a pottery business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Ginalyn is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

Ginalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 49 years old and married with four children. 

Roselyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Roselyn has been in pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the buiness.

Roselyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Peter is a 53-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 13 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Peter has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Peter described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Peter’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Gladys's Group

texts.en:
"Pictured above is Gladys, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 61 years old, and as a group leader, she is representing her group of 14 farmers in Butere District, Kenya.  She is married and has 3 children.

Gladys is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Gladys says that she is happy to have made that decision because since she first joined in 2013, she has had more profits from each harvest, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Gladys will use the profits from this season to buy more land to cultivate in.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 8.25 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 14 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah's Group is formed by 7 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Sarah, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 54 years old, is married and has 4 children. Sarah has been a farmer for 15 years and is often referred to as a very reliable person.

Sarah isn’t new to One Acre Fund, as she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since.

This year, Sarah will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Sarah's Group will purchase a total of 5 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is a 54-year-old married mother of three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marlene has been operating a general store in the Philippines for 15 years, selling a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Marlene would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Majlinda

texts.en: Majlinda's husband passed away some months back due to a tragic accident and since then, she hasn't been feeling well. She is applying for this loan because she needs to go to a clinic for a medical checkup.

loans.use: To cover medical checkups since she's been feeling unwell due to the grief caused by the sudden death of her husband

loans.name: Hill Land K. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Grace, the Head teacher of Hill Land Junior Kajjansi School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kajjansi with 180 students. Hill Land K. School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. 

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as expenditures on firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Hill Land K. School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Grace ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students attending the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Faith Trust School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Joelia. She is the Head teacher of Faith Trust Primary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Kajjansi with 470 students.

Faith Trust Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced.

The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Faith Trust Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Joelia ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo trabaja con su padre en su negocio y vive con su madre quien es empleada de una empresa. Está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería en informática, y por medio de los conocimientos que vaya adquiriendo quiere ir abriéndose camino.
Es un joven que está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para el pago de las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Pablo works at his father’s business. He lives with his mother who is employed at a company. Pablo is studying for a degree in Information Systems Engineering. With the knowledge he will acquire, he will be able to open doors for himself. This young man is doing everything he can to grow and move forward.

Pablo is requesting this loan so that he can pay his degree fees. As a result, he will be able to continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Oñondivepa es de la ciudad de Itá,  está en su ciclo número 9, además de ello se encuentran dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde  una de las integrantes es la Sra.Liz.
Ella es actualmente presidenta del comité se dedica a la mercería dentro de su comunidad obteniendo su propio ingreso. Vende todo tipo de productos, es por ello que siempre tiene muchos clientes. Comenta que por medio de su venta tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y otros seres queridos que tiene.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas, calzados, artículos de bazar y otros, y con ello poder tener una buena variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group “Oñondivepa” is from the city of Itá. The members are in their ninth loan cycle and are also participating in the poverty elimination program.

One of the members is Sra. Liz, who currently serves as the committee president. She sells merchandise in her community in order to generate her own income. Liz sells all types of products, which is why she always has several customers. She says that through her sales, she is able to have the means to help her family and other loved ones.

Liz is requesting a loan in order to buy clothes, shoes, bazaar products, and other items so that she can have a good variety to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, bazaar products, and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Super Chicas Group

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 37 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 21, 19 y 3 años, y su negocio es la venta de refrescos. 
Ella es buena madre, amable, solidaria, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el ‘plan 3000’ barrio Aymará, Quechua y Guaraní, ubicado al sur de la ciudad, migrantes del todo el país se reunieron y formaron un gran comercio, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-36 grados centígrados. 
Sonia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, Su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la primera de la izquierda, viste polera roja y calza negra). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores trabajan y estudian y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en un cuaro alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; elaboración de empanadas, venta de material escolar, venta de prendas de policía, servicio de limpieza, venta de cereales, venta de polainas, venta de pañales y venta de candelabros, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta ambulante de refrescos hervidos, como; Mocochinchi (preparado con duraznos secos hervidos), Chicha (preparada en base a maíz), Somó (similar a la Chicha pero incluye el hervido del maíz) y otros, que son refrescos tradicionales y muy populares. “inicié mi negocio porque conocía la demanda de refrescos fríos en la zona y porque conocía su consumo popular…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los clientes son constantes y las ventas continuas, la desventaja es la distancia que debe recorrer cargando bidones de refresco y bolsas de hielo. Su sueño es abrir un puesto de venta fijo de refresco, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de ollas para hervir refresco y vender mayor cantidad. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Sonia solicita un préstamo para la compra de ollas e utensilios de cocina para la elaboración de refrescos tradicionales para abrir un puesto fijo de venta.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 37 year old woman. She is married and has 3 children, aged 21, 19 and 3. Her business is selling beverages. She is a good mother who is kind, supportive, responsible and hardworking. She runs her business in the ‘Plan 3000’ neighborhood, where Aymará, Quechua and Guaraní migrants from all over the country got together and made a great commerce center. It has a warm, tropical climate with a temperature that varies between 18-36 degrees celsius.  
 
Sonia has dark skin, long, black hair she ties back, dark eyes, short stature, and a robust build. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks in her family, and she speaks Spanish in the general culture and in her business. She is the first on from the left, wearing a red t-shirt and black shoes. She shares her life with her husband, who works as a business, and with her children. The 2 oldest work and go to school and the youngest is not school aged yet. They live in a rented room made of brick and cement with a sheet metal roof. It has potable water, electricity and plumbing. Her desire to get ahead led to her forming a bank of people with businesses such as making empanadas, selling school materials, selling police clothing, a cleaning service, selling grains, selling gaiters, selling diapers, and selling candelabras. They did it to ask for a loan an expand their activities. Her business is selling boiled beverages as a street vendor, such as mocochinchi (made with boiled dried peaches), chicha (made with a corn base), somó (similar to chicha, but it includes boiled corn), and more. These are traditional drinks and they are very popular. “I started my business because I knew about the demand for cold drinks in the area and because I knew about popular consumption…” she remarks. The advantage of her business is that her customers are loyal and her sales are stable. The disadvantage is the distance she has to go, hauling containers of beverages and bags of ice. Her dream is to open a permanent beverage spot. She wants to expand her business by buying pots to boil beverages and to sell a larger quantity. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 10 years that she has been doing this activity.  

That is why Sonia decided to ask for a loan to buy pot and kitchen utensils to make traditional beverages to open a permanent sales spot.

loans.use: to buy pots and kitchen utensils to make traditional beverages to open a permanent sales stall.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира 34 лет. Она жительница города Душанбе. Нодира замужем и пока не имеет детей. Она в городе живет вместе мужем, тестю и свекровью. Нодира шустрая и активная женщина. Ее муж без работы. Он сейчас находится загранице, чтобы найти работу и зарабатывать на жизнь. Нодира занимается приготовлением пирожки, беляши, гамбургеры, шаурмы и  самбусы. В 2010 году она начала свой бизнес. Она ранее утром идет на работу, чтобы во время приготовить еду для клиентов. У Нодиры есть свои постоянные клиенты. Она так больше старается зарабатывать, чтобы обеспечить и улучшить  условия жизни семьи. Сейчас Нодира решила отремонтировать дом. Но для купли стройматериалов у нее не хватает денег, по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. В будущем Нигора хочет открыть свою торговую точку.
texts.en:
Nodira is 34 years old. She is a resident of the city of Dushanbe. Nodira is married, but does not yet have any children. She lives in the city together with her husband, father-in-law and mother-in-law. Nodira is a nimble and active woman. Her husband is without work. He is currently abroad in order to find work and earn money for living. 

Nodira works with preparing pirozhki (pies), fried pirozhki, burgers, shawarma (kebab) and samosas. She started her business in 2010. She goes to work early in the morning in order to prepare the food in time for the customers. Nodira has returning customers. She strives to earn more to be able to provide and improve her family's living conditions. 

Currently Nodira decided to renovate her house. However, she does not have enough money to to purchase building materials. For this reason she applied for a loan. In the future, Nodira would like to open a retail sales point.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to renovate her home

loans.name: Evelio

texts.es:
Evelio tiene 38 años de edad, vive en armonía junto a su cónyuge y sus 3 menores hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el caserío Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima caluroso, sus pobladores son amables y se dedican al cultivo de frutales, café, maíz y hortalizas, ubicado en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza es el cultivo de café variedad catimore la cual es resistente a enfermedades, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café y con buenas referencias en su distrito. Adicionalmente cría animales menores como gallinas, cuyes, cerdos, entre otros. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, asegurando una buena producción lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Evelio is 38 years old and lives harmoniously with his wife and their three young children in their own home made of basic materials. They reside in the village of Buenos Aires, a community with a warm climate. The residents are friendly and engage in the cultivation of fruit, coffee, corn, and vegetables. This community is located in the District of Santo Tomás in Cutervo Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Evelio grows coffee of the Catimor variety, which is resistant to diseases. He has been in this business for four years and has experience in the coffee trade. Evelio has received good references from people in his district. In addition, he raises small animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and other livestock. His loan will be used to buy compost and fertilizers so that he can adequately maintain his coffee crop. This will help him to secure a good production, which will be reflected in a large volume of sales. Eventually he will generate more income so that he can improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer so that he can maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Manolita

texts.en:
Manolita is 45-year-old widow and has four children.  One of her children is currently in school.

Manolita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Manolita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

Manolita has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Manolita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Aisuluu

texts.ru: Айсулуу успешно погасила свой кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Айсулуу на сегодняшний день есть 2 лошади, 3 жеребенка, лошадь, 6 коров, теленок, 15 овец, 7 коз. На 0,50 Га она выращивает кукурузу. Хозяйство на сегодня приносит в среднем 9,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Также Айсулуу преподает швейное дело девушкам села, принимает заказы и сама шьет. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Aisuluu successfully repaid her previous loan. She thanks Kiva and everyone who helped her with the financing. 

Aisuluu currently has two horses, three foals, a horse, six cows, a calf, 15 sheep and seven gooses. She grows sweet corn on 0.50 hectares of land. The business currently brings in 9,000 som (KGS) per month on average. Aisuluu also teaches sewing to the girls in her village, takes sewing orders and sews herself. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Aisuluu turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 65,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep. She plans to invest the income from her loan in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to increase her herd

loans.name: Mercyline's Group

texts.en:
"Mercyline, pictured above, has 5 children and is always described as a very resourceful person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Mercyline is representing her group of 12 farmers in Butere District, and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Mercyline has been a farmer for 10 years and in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Mercyline is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 7.25 acres will be planted by Mercyline's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 7 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Nhóm 38 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en: Mrs. Ly, 57, works in agricultural production and earns a monthly income of about 38 USD. She is married and has four grown children. Her husband and she herself usually get sick. In her commune, Ly has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1991. Now, her family is in an economic hardship situation, and they don't have a sanitary latrine. Ly is fully aware of the fact that using a degraded double-pit latrine has many risks, including potential adverse effects on the health of her family members and her community, as well as environmental contamination. With this loan, Ly will build a septic tank toilet, which will improve the hygiene and health for the family members and contribute to sanitary improvement in her community. In this photo, Ly is pictured first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Asesewa Group

texts.en:
Irene and her colleagues are part of the group called Asesewa. Irene, who is in her early 40s, is married and has two children; all of them are still at school. 

Irene has been selling underwear, second hand clothing, and kerosine for eight years. She works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Irene's eighth loan from ID-Ghana. She used the previous loan to buy underwear, second hand clothing, and kerosine, and she has repaid her loan successfully. She is happy with the loan and doing great. She used the profits to pay school fees and household expenses, and to invest into her business. She will use this new loan to buy more underwear, second hand clothing, and kerosine to sell to customers. 

She dreams of owning a big shop so that she can supply underwear, second hand clothing, and kerosine to people around her area. 

Irene will share this loan with her borrowing group members, which has a total of three members. They will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy more underwear, second hand clothing and kerosine and sell to customers

loans.name: Paulo's Group

texts.en:
Paulo, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very reliable person, which is why he was selected to become the leader of his group. Paulo is representing his group of 11 farmers in Butere District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Paulo has been a farmer for 15 years, and in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light which he is very happy to be getting, as that means he will be able to reduce his consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Paulo is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 5.5 acres will be planted by Paulo's Group, and between them they will receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Risolat

texts.ru:
Это Рисолат. Ей 44 лет. Рисолат замужем и мать троих сыновей. Она вместе семьей живет в городе Душанбе. Сыновьям 23, 21 и 17 лет. Старший сын женат. Муж занимается ремонтом автомашин. 
Рисолат шустрая и ответственна женщина. Она предоставляет услуги портнихи у себя дома. Рисолат шьет женское платье и детские одежды у себя дома. Она купить  ткани и шьет одежды на заказ.  Рисолат хочет расширить деятельность. Для расширения бизнеса ей надо приобрести больше ткани, чтобы сшить больше. Но для совершения данной операции у нее нет денег, по этой причине Рисолат обратилась за кредитом. Рисолат заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
This is Risolat. She is 44 years old. Risolat is married and the mother of three sons. She lives in the city of Dushanbe together with her family. The sons are 23, 21 and 17 years old, and the eldest son is married. Risolat's husband works with vehicle repairs. 

Risolat is a nimble and responsible woman. She provides a seamstress service at home. Risolat sews women's dresses and children's clothing from her home. She purchases fabric and sews the clothing on order. 

Risolat would like to expand her business. To expand, she needs to purchase more fabric, in order to sew more. However, she does not have enough money to carry out this operation. For this reason, Risolat applied for a loan. She extends her thankfulness in advance.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric and expand her business

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en:
Kefah is a 34-year-old married man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his wife and three kids: two sons and one daughter. Kefah works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income.  This income barely covers all the family needs. He decided to find an additional job, which is distributing goods using a rickshaw.

Kefah took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy soft drinks from the wholesalers and distribute to the local traders. This will increase his income and his family's living conditions. 

Kefah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks from the wholesalers and distribute to the local traders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to work with

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 52-year-old married woman and mother of seven children. Three of her children are still attending school.
