Martha is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her four children. She makes and sells chicken tamales and pisques (tamales with bean filling) and has been engaged in this business for 10 years. She sells as a street vendor in various neighborhoods near her home, and has many steady customers.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn, chickens, vegetables and other ingredients, so that she can continue with her sales and have a better qualty of life for her and her children.

loans.use: To buy corn, chickens, vegetables and other ingredients.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Agée de 38 ans, Abla est une femme mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Abla vit à Attiégou et vend des charbons de bois dans son quartier. Abla réalise un revenu grâce à son activité. Abla s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de charbons de bois et demande ce prêt pour atteindre ses objectifs et gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire
texts.en: Abla, aged 38, is a married woman and mother of four. She lives in Attiégou and sells charcoal in her district. She earns an income thanks to her business. She supplies herself once a month at the market. To put in an order for sacks of charcoal, Abla is asking for this loan to achieve her goals and to have a good profit margin.

loans.use: to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Nkamda Nkouankam

texts.fr: Michelle est une jeune femme agée de 28 ans, célibataire et  mère de 02 enfants de 05 ans et 11 ans, tous deux vont à l'école.Elle a un petit secrétariat, sa clientèle devient de plus en plus nombreuse alors elle sollicite un crédit pour agrandir sa structure en ajoutant les ordinateurs et le matériel bureautique pour pouvoir la satisfaire et augmenter sa production. Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt lui permettront non seulement d'ajouter le petit matériel bureautique, mais aussi de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les bénéfices générés lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Michelle is a young woman, 28 years old, unmarried, and the mother of two children, aged 5 and 11 years old. Both go to school. Michelle has a small office services business. Her customer base continues to grow, so she is requesting a loan to expand the premises by adding computers and office supplies and equipment to be able to satisfy her customers and increase her production. The profits earned from this loan will enable her not only to add various office supplies but also to satisfy her customer base further. The profits generated will allow her to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase computers and office equipment

loans.name: Linos's Group

texts.en:
Linos is 25 years old and is often described as a very friendly person.  He is married, with two children.  As a group leader, Linos is representing his group of 13 farmers in Butere District in Kenya.  He is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Linos's desire to earn enough to feed his family.  Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is exciting as he will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge his phone. 

With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to buy more land to cultivate.

Linos and his group will receive a total of 10 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 7 acres."

loans.use: to buy a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a lot of rice and beans to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Carlos Horacio

texts.es: Carlos de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus padres, el posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, pan dulce, productos lácteos, sopas, etc.  y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos
texts.en: Carlos is 41 years old and lives in his own home with his parents.  For the past 10 years, he has had a store located in his residence.  He has many clients, especially his neighbors, and with the sales he is able to meet some of the costs of his household.  He is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, snacks, sweet bread, dairy products, and soups, and in this way be able to have better economic earnings.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, sweet bread, dairy products, and soups.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: María  de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella posee una venta de comida desde hace un año su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por lo buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas arroz, frijoles, huevos, pollos, carnes, verduras, etc. todo por mayor para continuar con la elaboración de los alimentos  y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos
texts.en:
María is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her two children.  She has had a food stall for a year, and her business is located in her home.   She had many clients due to her good prices.  With what she gets from her earnings, she is able to meet some of the costs present in her household.  

Maria is requesting a loan to buy more rice, beans, eggs, chicken, meat, and vegetables, all at wholesale prices to continue preparing foods and have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale rice, beans, eggs, chicken, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Dúo Emanuel De Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
Dúo Emanuel de Santo Tomas

Este dúo está formado por Rosa Amalia, ella tiene 37 años de edad, y se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosméticos, zapato para niño, niña, dama, caballeros, ropa de bebe, desde ya hace muchos años en su local ubicado en su domicilio, desde ya hace muchos años, ella esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de ropa, y zapatos para surtir su tienda, su mayor deseo es aprovechar las ventas de esta temporada.
texts.en:
The Duo Emanuel de Santo Tomas:

This duo is formed by Rosa Amalia. She is 37 years old and makes a living selling clothing, cosmetics, shoes for children and men and women, baby clothing.  For many years now, her store is located in her home.  She is requesting a loan to buy clothing and footwear to stock her store.  Her greatest desire it to take advantage of the sales of this season.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny de 38  años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración  y vender tortillas desde hace 3 años su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Marleny está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos
texts.en:
Marleny is 38 years old an lives in her own home with her two children.  She has dedicated herself to the preparation and sales of tortillas for the past 3 years.  Her business is located in her home, and she has many clients, especially her neighbors.  With what she earns, she is able to meet some of the household costs.  

Marley is requesting a loan to buy corn by 100 lb. units and lime to continue preparing the tortillas, so that she will have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy corn in 100 lb. bags and lime.

loans.name: Dúo Gardenia De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Gardenia de San Bartolo
Este dúo está formado por doña Rosa Audelia, ella tiene 55 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de refacciones en su domicilio ubicado en el municipio de San Bartolomé de lunes a domingo por las tardes desde ya hace muchos años, como venta de tacos de pollo, rellenitos, chuchitos, dobladas de papa y carne, atol de aba, arroz en leche, atol de plátano,  ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de su negocio y lo necesita para compra de carne, verduras, compra de platos y vasos desechables.
texts.en:
"Dúo Gardenia de San Bartolo" [Gardenia de San Bartolo Duo]

This duo is formed by Rosa Audelia. She is 55 years old and makes a living selling snacks in her property located in the municipality of San Bartolomé, from Monday thru Sunday afternoons for many years now, like the sale of chicken tacos, stuffed mashed plantains, dried maize husk-wrapped tamales, stuffed folded tortillas, corn-based bean drink, rice-in-milk drink, corn-based plantain drink. She is requesting the loan to invest in her business and needs it for the purchase of meat, vegetables, purchase of disposable plates and cups.

loans.use: in the purchase of materials for food sale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa se 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas adicional a eso también posee una tienda, se dedica a las dos actividades desde hace 15 años y su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, Rosa está solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, maíz, frijoles, etc. todo por mayor y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 51 years old and lives in her home with her family.  She dedicates herself to the preparation and selling of pupusas, and  in addition she has a store.  She has dedicated herself to these activities for 15 years, and her business is located in her home.  She has many clients because of her good prices.  

Rosa is requesting a loan to buy pork rinds, corn, beans, etc. at wholesale prices and in this way be able to have better economic income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale pork rind, corn, beans, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a bathroom with a toilet to provide better conditions for the family in their house.

loans.name: James's Group

texts.en:
James is a 40-year-old proud father of six children. He is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing his group of 12 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, James has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

James described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, James’s Group will be able to plant a total of six acres of land and purchase a total of 14 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more wood, nails, glue, varnish, and fiber rush at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Dúo Florecitas De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Dúo Florecitas de Vista Hermosa La encargada de este grupo es la señora Sonia Patricia quien se dedica la venta de ropa interior para damas y niñas, también a la venta de cosméticos en general como cremas, shampoo, talcos, desodorantes, lociones de catalogo y es costurera de la colonia.  Las fechas de verano se aproxima y tiene varios pedidos de cremas especiales, shampoo y trajes de baño para damas y caballeros, tiene que hacer varios pedidos y no le alcanza el dinero por eso necesita hacer otro préstamo para poder vender mucho y tener ganancias.  Su sueño es agrandar su tienda que está en su casa y vender de todo.
texts.en:
Florecitas de Vista Hermosa Duo:  

The manager of this group is miss Sonia Patricia, who makes a living selling intimate clothing for women and girls, and also by selling cosmetics such as creams, shampoos, powders, deodorants, catalog lotions, and also as a seamstress in the neighborhood.  Summer is approaching and she has many orders for specialty creams, shampoo and bathing suits for women and men.  She needs to make the orders but does not have the necessary money, and so she needs to take another loan to be able to sell a lot and have income.  Her dream is to grow her store that is in her house, and sell more products.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Daysi Del Carmen

texts.es: Daysi de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, etc. desde hace 7 años su negocio está ubicada en su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza ha logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maíz para los tamales, plátanos y todos los ingredientes para su elaboración y así poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en:
Daysi is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her family.  She makes a living selling snacks like french fries, fried yucca, empanadas, etc for the past 7 years.   Her business is located in her home.  Thanks to the sales she has made, she is able to meet some of the household costs.  

She is requesting a loan to buy the products she will use in the preparation of her food, such as oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, plantains, and all the ingredients for the preparation.  This way she will be able to continue to support her household and meet the costs that present themeslves.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, plantains and all the ingredients.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children. She has a business of operating a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. Margaret has been in this business for the last 17 years. She takes care of additional family members, and she works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of  UGX 3,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, rice, cooking oil, and beans. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land and start building. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and rent for her business.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a fish vendor from Mayorga, Leyte, Phillipines. She is a 40 year old married woman with six children ages 8 to 18 years old. She has been peddling fish to her local community for two years now. 

To be able to support her livelihood, she decided to take a loan to purchase variety of fresh fish so she can better cater to the needs and orders of her customers. The more variety of fish she purchase, the higher her possible sales. This enables her to slowly improve her earnings to pay her loan obligation. 

She dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable for the improvement of her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase variety of fresh fish

loans.name: Almaz

texts.ru: Алмаз, 32 года, женат, вместе с супругой воспитывают 3 детей. У Алмаза среднее образование, работу в селе найти очень тяжело, однако надо содержать семью и воспитывать детей. Поэтому уже 11 лет, Алмаз занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 2 лошади, на которых он оказывает услуги пастуха местным жителям. Ежемесячный доход Алмаза составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, он обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма. Доходы от кредита Алмаз планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить на постройку сараев для скота.
texts.en: Almaz is 32 years old and married.  He and his wife are raising three children.  He has a secondary education.  Although it is very difficult to find a job in the village, Almaz still has to support his family and educate his children.  For this reason, he has been involved in agriculture for 11 years already.  He owns two horses which he uses to provide shepherding services to the local residents.  He makes a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow his farming business, he has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy a few cows for fattening.  Almaz plans to use the earnings from his loan to further increase his number of domestic animals.  He also wants to save enough money to build barns for his livestock.

loans.use: to buy a few cows in order to increase the size of his herd.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita works hard to support her family. Carmelita is married and has a repair shop business in the Philippines.

Carmelita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional equipment and tools for her business.

Carmelita has been in this business for 16 years now.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and tools for her business

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana es una mujer casada de 42 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de cinco hijos de las cuales 3 son hombres y 2 mujeres, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de Chichicastenango.
Sebastiana con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, se dedica a la elaboración ropa típica de su región, ella tiene ocho años de realizar esta labor, gracias a esta actividad ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
Sebastiana es una mujer muy trabajadora y optimista que elabora los trajes más preciados de su país, pero Sebastiana ahora se ha dado cuenta que deberá modernizar más sus trajes, pues el mundo de la moda se encuentra en constantes cambios, pero para poder realizar esta inversión ella requiere de un buen capital, por tal razón ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar materiales como hilo de tipo: seda, alemán y lustrina y poder elaborar  los trajes mas bonitos.
El gran sueño de Sebastiana es poder tener una tienda donde pueda exhibir mejor sus propios trajes y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is a 42 year old, married woman. She has a lovely family with 5 children, 3 of them male and two female. This beautiful family lives in the community of Chichicastenango. Sebastiana with the desire to make income and support her husband with the household expenses works making the traditional clothing of her region. She has been doing this for 8 years and thanks to this activity has manged to get her family ahead. Sebastiana is a very hard-working and optimistic woman who makes the most valued clothing in her country.

But Sebastiana now realizes that she needs to modernize her clothing more as the world of fashion is in constant change. But in order to be able to make this investment she needs a good amount of capital. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy material like different types of silk threads and be able to make more beautiful clothing. Sebastiana's big dream is to be able to have a store where she can display her own clothing better and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy different silk threads to decorate her traditional clothing.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She also deals in selling animals to generate extra income. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated.

She has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales, so she can generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales, so she can generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Nhóm 32 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en: Mrs. Hoi, pictured first from the left, is a 69-year-old farmer who earns about $30 a month. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1980. Her husband got sick so she had to raise 4 children alone. Now her childrem have grown up but they don't have stable job. Given these reasons, her family is still listed as a poor family. The family does not have a hygienic latrine. They still use a double-pit latrine that has the risks of potential adverse effects on the health of all family members . A portion of Nhóm 32 - Bình Xuyên's loan will help Hoi as well as other group members buy materials to  build a septic tank and a hand-washing device with soap to improve the living conditions and health of the community while also contributing to environmental protection.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Maggie

texts.en:
Maggie lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and all of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food. 

Maggie operates a retail shop at the market. She works seven days a week, and she has been in this business for the last 12 years. Her major challenges include defaulters and transportation. She has requested a loan of 1,400,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, beans, peas and flour. 

Her goal and aspiration is to buy land so as to start farming in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, beans, and peas.

loans.name: William Armando

texts.es: William de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposa, el se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 4 años vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su casa y ya tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para  tener mejores ingresos económicos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
William is 39 years old and lives in his own home with his two children and his wife.  He has sold fruits and vegetables for 4 years in different neighborhoods that are close to his house.  He has many clients.  With what he earns, he is able to meet some of the household costs.  

He is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale fruits and vegetables and have better economic income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Dúo Mari Cruz Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mari Cruz 
Este está formado por doña Florentina, ella tiene 58 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, físicos y por catálogo, desde ya hace muchos años ubicado en su local de San Bartolomé, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de ropa de temporada de verano, cosméticos  ropa de bebe , su mayor deseo es aprovechar esta temporada,agradese a kiva por el apoyo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Dúo Mari Cruz:  

Florentina is part of this duo.  She is 58 years old and makes a living selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics and figures by catalog.  For many years her store has been located in San Bartolome.  She is requesting a loan to buy summer clothing, cosmetics, and baby clothing. Her greatest desire is to take advantage of this season. She thanks Kiva for supporting her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more building materials for her retail business

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen would like to take a further loan to buy animal feed for her cows. Yen's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her cows.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is 51 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Purita is borrowing 12,000  PHP through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business.

Purita has been fattening pigs for four years and also earns additional income from buying and selling peanut butter. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Thao would like to take a another loan to buy vegetable seeds and cows. Thao's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting and cows for raising and selling.

loans.name: Naveeda

texts.en: Naveeda is a 37-year-old married woman. She is shown with her son in the photo. In order to support her family, she began selling milk. She is known in her town for providing good-quality milk. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate extra income. She happily supports her family with the income she generates. For the growth of her business, she has taken a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She is hopeful that an increase in milk production will help her generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong would like to take another loan to buy animal feed and pay her children's school fees. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира молодая девушка. Ей 21 лет. Она жительница района Пяндж. Замира замужем и мать одного ребенка. Она серьезная и трудолюбивая девушка. Ее семья занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Сама Замира занимается растениеводством. Она год назад начала занимается этой видом деятельности. Для нее данная деятельность является единственным источником доходом. На данный момент Замире надо обработать урожай с минеральными удобрениями. Она планирует получить богатый и качественный  урожай, поэтому она просит кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений. У Замире нет другого варианта кроме кредит. Она верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Zamira, age 21, is a young woman who lives in the Pyandj district.  She is married, with  one child.  She is serious and hardworking.  Her family works in agriculture.  Zamira herself is involved in crop farming, an activity she started a year ago.  This is her only source of income.  At the moment, Zamira needs to prepare her land with mineral fertilizers.  She is counting on an abundant and high quality harvest and, for this reason, she is taking a loan to buy mineral fertilizers.  She has no other option but this loan.  She relies on you and your support.

loans.use: to buy high quality mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Thach

texts.en: Thach would like to take another loan to buy more goods and household items to sell from her store. Thach's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of basic goods to restock her general store.

loans.name: Carolynes's Group

texts.en:
Carolyne's Group is formed by 14 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Carolyne, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 35 years old, married, and has 4 children. Carolyne has been a farmer for 14 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Carolyne isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Carolyne will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Carolyne's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 8.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Dirla Xiomara

texts.es:
La señora Dirla Xiomara de 48  años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa,  se dedica desde hace 20  años al negocio de venta de Rosquillas, Quesadillas, y Hojaldras,  Radica en la aldea  los Chorritos,  al sur de Honduras, ella es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Dirla está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos, Maíz, Queso, Manteca y Leña, con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente existente  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma y KIVA.
Doña Dirla su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - MARZO  2015.
texts.en:
Dirla Xiomara, 48, lives with her husband and their children in their home. She has been selling doughnuts, quesadillas, pastries, etc. for the last 20 years. She lives in the village of Los Chorritos in southern Honduras. Dirla is an enterprising woman with the desire to succeed, and she strives day by day to improve her quality of life. 

She is applying for a loan to buy corn, cheese, lard, firewood, etc. With the help of this loan, she intends to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is an existing client who wishes to work with Prisma and Kiva. Dirla’s dream is to have a good business, increase her clientele, and at the same time improve her and her family’s future.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2015.

loans.use: To buy corn, cheese, lard and firewood for her business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 52 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Evangeline has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and maintenance for her motorcycle.

Evangeline has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and maintenance for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Idd's Group

texts.en:
Idd is 28 years old and is often described as a very trustworthy person. He has 2 children and is married. As a group leader, Idd is representing his group of 14 farmers in Butere District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Idd's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

Idd and his group will receive a total of 11 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 8.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane's Group is formed by 13 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Jane, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 36 years old, is married, and has 4 children. Jane has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Jane isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year, Jane will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Jane's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Donald's Group

texts.en:
Donald, featured in the above picture, is representing his farming group formed by 15 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. He is 36 years old and a married father of 5 children, often described as a very friendly person. 

Although Donald has been a farmer for 10 years, he is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because he really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though he is new to the program, Donald wanted to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Donald hopes to be able to buy a cow.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 10 solar lights; even though Donald decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Goodwill Baptist School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Nelson. He is the Head teacher of Goodwill Baptist Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Kakiika in Mbarara with 142 students. Goodwill Baptist Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Goodwill Baptist Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Nelson ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students. Concentration and attendance will also improve the number of students coming to the school by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice, in the photo, has five children and is always described as a very resourceful person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Beatrice is representing a group of 13 farmers from the Butere district and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Beatrice has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Beatrice is planning to buy a cow.

A total of 6.5 acres will be planted by Beatrice's Group, and between them, they will receive a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Rony Samuel

texts.es:
El señor Rony Samuel de 29  años de  edad, vive con su mama y su hermana en casa de su hermana,  se dedica desde hace 3  año al negocio de venta de Abarrotería tales como: Arroz, azúcar, frijoles, manteca, huevos, pollo, papel higiénico, sardinas, agua en bolsa, frescos, jugos,  y otros productos,  sus clientes son todos sus vecinos amistades y demás personas que transitan por la zona.
Rony radica en la aldea los Chorritos al sur de Honduras, el es un hombre emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Rony está solicitando el préstamo para surtir su negocio de productos  como; arroz, frijoles, azúcar, frescos, huevos,  sardinas bolsas plásticas, churros, pan bolillo de torrejas, y otros productos de consumo básico, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con prisma y KIVA.
Rony Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida junto a su familia.
San Lorenzo valle, Honduras - MARZO  2015.
texts.en:
Rony Samuel is 29 years old. He lives with his mother and sister in his sister’s house. For the past three years he has been in the business of selling grocery items, such as: rice, sugar, beans, shortening, eggs, chicken, toilet paper, sardines, drinking water in bags, soft drinks, juices, and other products. His customers are all of his neighbors, friends, and other people who pass through the neighborhood.

Rony lives in the small town of Chorritos, in the south of Honduras. He is an entrepreneurial person, with a desire to get ahead and work hard every day in order to improve his quality of life.

Rony is requesting the loan in order to stock his business with products such as rice, beans, sugar, soft drinks, eggs, sardines, plastic bags, chips, bread used for making torrejas [a type of dessert], and other basic products of daily need. He is a new borrower with a desire to work with Prisma and Kiva.

Rony’s dream is to grow his business in order to improve his quality of life, along with that of his family. 

San Lorenzo, Valle, Honduras – March 2015

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, soft drinks, eggs, sardines, plastic bags, chips, bread used for making torrejas [a type of dessert], and other basic products of daily need.

loans.name: P.a.c.p& L.a.c Foundation Group

texts.en:
Mikel operates a local bar in Kamwenge, Uganda, to boost his family's income and educate his children. He also owns a sugarcane plantation, which earns him extra income. He hopes to construct a very good home and have all his children educated, but faces the constraints of bad weather and season. He is requesting a loan to buy more local brew to sell. He is a member of P.A.C.P. & L.A.C. Foundation, whose members guarantee one another for the loan.

The extra person in the photo is also a group member who has guaranteed others but has not taken out a loan.

loans.use: to buy more local brew to sell.

loans.name: Sindeh

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Sindeh. She is married and has two children aged 8 years and 15 years. 

In 2005, Sindeh established her provision shop business. She began her business because she wanted to earn more profits and take care of her family. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are both men and women. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Sindeh requires a loan in order to buy more bundles of drinks, water and provisions for resale. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase the level of her additional stock. In the future, Sindeh plans to be a supplier to retailers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of drinks, water and provisions.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 30-year-old divorced woman from a village near Ramallah city. She lives with her two kids in a small, simple house. 

Lina took some training in the beauty center and now she would like to open her own salon in the village. She loves her job and would like to improve it more in the future. Lina took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to prepare her new business because she can buy new tools and beauty products for her beauty salon. Lina appears in the photo.

loans.use: to prepare her new business by buying new tools and beauty products.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar CDS, DVDS, controles para TV, recargas para celular, cargadores, entre otro tipo de productos para seguir compitiendo en el mercado.
Al utilizar el financiamiento anterior ha surtido el negocio con nuevos productos, sus deudas son menores, cuenta con nuevos clientes, sigue esforzándose para que su familia tenga un mejor bienestar y que su negocio continúe creciendo para llegar a tener un local propio.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan to buy CDs, DVDs, TV remote controls, pre-paid phone minutes for cell phones, and cell phone chargers, among other types of products so he can continue to compete in the market. 

Using the previous loan, he was able to stock his business with new products. His debts are smaller, he has more clients, and he keeps working hard so that his family will have a better quality of life and so that his business will continue growing until he can have his own store.

loans.use: to buy CDs, DVDs, TV remote controls, pre-paid phone minutes for cell phones, and cell phone chargers, among other types of products so he can continue to compete in the market.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Adzo est âgée 52 ans et vit à Adidogomé. Adzo est mariée et mère de quatre enfants à sa charge. Adzo vend des charbons de bois dans son quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour subvenir aux charges et s’épanouir. Adzo s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Adzo veut passer une commande de sacs de charbons et demande ce crédit pour le réaliser afin de disposer d’une rentabilité nécessaire pour leur épanouissement.
texts.en:
Adzo is 52 years old and lives in Adidogomé. She is married and the mother of four dependent children. She sells charcoal in her neighborhood so that she can pay her expenses and be happy. She buys her supplies once a month in the market. 

She is asking for this loan because she would like to order bags of charcoal. This will help her attain the level of profitability she needs to be happy.

loans.use: buy 21 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: St. Mukasa School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Godwin. He is the rector of St. Mukasa Seminary School, a boys’ school in the rural area of Kabwohe in Sheema with 400 students. St. Mukasa School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Mukasa School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Godwin ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from waterborne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: William's Group

texts.en:
Featured in the above picture is William, who has been a farmer for 16 years. Although he is pictured alone, he is actually representing his group of 11 farmers in the Butere District of Kenya. William has always been described as a very hardworking individual, which is largely why he was selected to be the group leader.

William started working with One Acre Fund for the first time in 2013, and this year he decided to not only get farming inputs but also to purchase two solar lights as part of his loan. He is very excited about this new addition, as now he will be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge his phone. He can’t wait to buy a cow using the profits he earns from this coming season. 

William’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres using the farming inputs obtained with this loan, and will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 49 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Amalia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. Amalia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, soft-drinks, beers, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Amalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Julita requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.  She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Julita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Dora Celina

texts.es:
Dora, desea reactivar su negocio por lo que se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo, así comprara madera al mayoreo para fabricar muebles y atender las nuevas demandas que tiene en su negocio.
El financiamiento anterior le ha facilitado a la señora Dora continuar trabajando, ella manifiesta estar agradecida por la oportunidad y buen servicio que se la ha brindado, su negocio está un poco más surtido y sus ingresos son utilizados para cubrir necesidades familiares primordiales.
texts.en:
Dora would like to boost her business, which is why she has decided to request a new loan. She will buy wood at wholesale price in order to make furniture and fill the new orders she has in her business. 

The previous loan made it possible for Dora to continue working. She explains that she is grateful for the opportunity and good service she was provided. Her business is a bit better stocked and her profits are used to cover her family’s basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy wood at wholesale price in order to make furniture and fill the new orders she has in her business.

loans.name: Almakan

texts.ru: Алмакан успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог в финансировании. В хозяйстве Алмакан  на сегодня есть 2 коровы, на 1,50 Га она выращивает клевер и перец. Ежемесячный доход Алмакан  составляет около 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычка для откорма. Доходы от кредита Алмакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Almakan successfully paid off her previous loan, having used it as intended. She is grateful to Kiva and to everyone who offered her financial support. She currently has two cows on her farm as well as 1.5 hectares of land where she grows clover and peppers. Her monthly income is about 16,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Almakan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 25,000 KGS to purchase a steer to fatten. She plans to put profits from the loan into further improving her farm and renovating her house.

loans.use: to purchase a steer for fattening and resale

loans.name: Marinely

texts.es:
Trabajar con créditos se ha convertido en una buena opción para apoyarse en los negocios, por ello Marinely ha aprovechado las oportunidades de financiamiento que MiCrédito le ha ofrecido para invertir en su negocio de venta de ropa y nacatamales. Con los que ha podido comprar telas y productos  para la venta de comida típica. 
Sin embargo, solicita un nuevo crédito para adquirir telas, botones, vestidos, leña, tomate, maíz, cebolla, etc. Y así poder producir sus productos en tiempo y forma. En consiguiente, podrá cubrir la creciente demanda de sus clientes y aumentará las ganancias. Marinely recibe el apoyo de su familia que la ayuda con la preparación y elaboración de sus productos.
texts.en:
Working with loans has become a good option for Marinely to assist her in her business. Because of this, she has taken advantage of the financing opportunities that MiCrédito has offered her in order to invest in her business of clothing sales an making nacatamales [tamales wrapped in banana leaves]. With the loans she has been able to buy fabrics and also ingredients for making this typical dish.

She is requesting a new loan to buy fabrics, buttons, dresses, firewood, tomatoes, corn, onions, etc. so she can make her products on time. With this, she will be able to cover the recent demand from her clients and increase her profits. Marinely has the support of her family, who help her with the preparation and making of her products.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, buttons, dresses, firewood, tomatoes, corn, onions, etc.

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
Amna is 49 years old, married, and she has been running a buy-and-sell animal business with the help of her husband for many years. She also sells milk in her locality to earn extra amount of income. 

Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 7 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR, and she intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 56 years old and has 4 children. She has been providing laundry services at her home for many years, and she makes enough to lead a decent life. 

She is known in her community for providing quality services to her customers. To help her run her operations, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase packs of detergents, bleach and packing bags. With those purchases, she would then be able to consistently meet the demands of her customers. She expects a boost in her net income and wishes to expand her business for more earnings.

loans.use: to purchase packs of detergents, bleach and packing bags to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Daniel's Group

texts.en:
Daniel is 32 years old, married and has four children. He has been a farmer for five years and is known as a hardworking individual in the district of Butere in Kenya.

Daniel also represents a group of eleven farmers for the One Acre Fund. He joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since.

Through the One Acre Fund Daniel and his group will receive 103,710 KES credit in the form of maize seeds and fertilizer, plus training and possibly crop insurance, all to be invested in a total of six acres. The group will also be buying ten solar lights. Daniel is excited about receiving one, as he will be able to cut back on paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

loans.use: to receive a credit for maize seeds and fertilizer as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Songuepare

texts.fr: Agée de 47 ans, Songuepare est une femme mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Songuepare vit dans le quartier d’ Adidogomé pour faire son commerce de du charbon de bois. Songuepare s’approvisionne une fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs pour avoir son stock. Songuepare demande ce crédit commander des sacs de charbons de bois afin de maximiser son profit et soutenir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Songuepare is 47 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She lives in Adidogomé where she sells charcoal.

Songuepare buys her stock once a month from her suppliers. 

She is asking for this loan in order to buy bags of charcoal. This will help her maximize profits and support her children’s education.

loans.use: buy 22 bags on charcoal.

loans.name: Kulsunai

texts.ru: Кульсунай, 54 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, работает инспектором и архивариусом, также в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1995 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Кульсунай на сегодняшний день имеет 1 корову и 30 овец. На участке мерою 2,50 Га собственной земли она выращивает фасоль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кульсунай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. Кульсунай является участником группы "Бай-Тушум" в которой кроме нее состоят еще 4 человека, всего их 5. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Kulsunai is 54 and married with two children. She has a specialist secondary education and works as an inspector and archivist. She also works in animal husbandry and agriculture as an additional source of income for her family, a business she began in 1995. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has one cow and 30 sheep as well as 2.5 hectares of her own land where she grows beans.

With the goal of further developing her business, Kulsunai has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase a dairy cow to increase the volume of organic milk she can sell. She is a member of the Bai Tushum group along with four other people. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase the volume of organic milk she can sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit and improve her business.

loans.name: Aikan

texts.ru: Айкан, 59 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, работает главной медицинской сестрой, также в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1996 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Айкан на сегодняшний день имеет 10 овец. На участке мерою 1,0 Га собственной земли она выращивает фасоль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку теленка и удобрений для полеводства. Айкан является участником группы "Бай-Тушум" в которой кроме нее состоят еще 4 человека, всего их 5. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Aikan is 59 and married with three children. She has a specialist secondary education and works as a head nurse. She also works in animal husbandry and agriculture as a secondary source of income for her family, a business she started in 1996. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has 10 sheep as well as 1 hectare of land where she grows beans.

With the goal of further developing her business, Aikan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 KGS to purchase a calf and fertilizers. She is a member of the Bai Tushum group along with four other people. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and into home renovations.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and fertilizers so she can grow beans

loans.name: Jessika

texts.es: La señora Obando es casada con una hija de 8 años, trabaja como costurera quiere un crédito de un millón de colones para comprar una nueva máquina de coser y materia prima para seguir trabajando. Ella tiene gran demanda de trabajo en la zona donde vive,  y considera que con este crédito saldrá adelante produciendo para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Mrs. Obando is married and has an 8 year-old daughter. She works as a seamstress. She needs a loan of one million colones (1,000,000 CRC) to buy a new sewing machine and sewing materials so she can continue working. There is a lot of demand for her work in the area where she lives, and she believes that with this loan she will get ahead and produce enough to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing materials.

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru: Гульзат, 42 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, работает секретарем-оператором, также в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, вместе с супругом занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1999 году с суммы 8,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, Гульзат на сегодняшний день имеет 1 корову и 15 овец. На участке мерою 2,40 Га собственной земли она выращивает фасоль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульзат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычка и 50 тюков сена. Гульзат является лидером группы "Бай-Тушум" в которой кроме нее состоят еще 4 человека, всего их 5. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и увеличение площади орошаемых земель.
texts.en:
Gulzat is 42 and married with three children. She has a specialist high school education and works as a secretary and operator. She also works with her husband in animal husbandry and agriculture as an additional source of income for her family, a business she began in 1999 with 8,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has one cow and 15 sheep as well as 2.4 hectares of her own land where she grows beans.

With the goal of further developing her business, Gulzat has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase a steer and 50 bales of hay. She is the leader of the Bai Tushum group which consists of herself and four other people. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and increasing the amount of irrigated land she has.

loans.use: to buy a steer and 50 bales of hay for her livestock

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Massan est une femme veuve âgée  de 39 ans. Avec ses trois enfants, Massan vit à Adidogomé pour vendre du riz préparé accompagné du spaghetti dans le quartier. Ce commerce lui procure le bénéfice et Massan s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Massan sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des bols de riz et des spaghettis qu’elle pourra vendre pour avoir un profit considérable et faire face à ses préoccupations.
texts.en:
Massan is a 39-year-old widow. She lives with her three children in Adidogomé. She sells prepared rice and spaghetti in her neighborhood. Her business is profitable and she buys her supplies once a month in the market. 

Massan is asking for this loan in order to buy bowls of rice and spaghetti. She sells them to earn a considerable profit and ease her worries.

loans.use: buy 86 bowls of rice and 1 box of spaghetti.

loans.name: Sofia Road Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising a hand in the photo is Teresiah, a member of Sofia Road Women Group. She is 59 years old, a widow, and the mother of five children.

Teresiah joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year of 2014. She has benefited a lot from training in the saving and enterprise modules, where she acquired skills for better saving methods and enterprise development. She has also learned how to run her dairy enterprise well and manage her income from the enterprise.

Teresiah is borrowing from Kiva to buy dairy feeds to increase milk production of her cows, which will earn her more income enabling her to improve her living standards, such as providing quality education for the children and better clothing. She is thankful to Kiva and the lenders for their assistance and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds that will help increase milk production and improve her income

loans.name: Chynar

texts.ru: Чынар, 60 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, она пенсионер, также работает в отделе кадров в больнице. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1996 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Чынар на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы и 8 овец. На участке мерою 0,80 Га собственной земли она выращивает картофель. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чынар обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. Чынар является одним из 5 участников группы "Бай-Тушум". Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Chynar is 60 and married with three children. She has a specialist secondary education and receives a pension. She also works in the personnel department of a hospital, and works in animal husbandry and agriculture as an additional source of income for her family, a business she started in 1996. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has two cows and eight sheep as well as 0.8 hectares of her own land where she grows potatoes. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Chynar has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 60,000 KGS to purchase a dairy cow to increase the volume of organic milk she can sell. She is one of five members of the Bai Tushum group. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and renovating her house.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow in order to increase the volume of organic milk she can sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 52-year-old hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He rears cattle and goats as his main source of income, a business he started to earn a living. He also earns extra income from tenders. He hopes to educate his children but is limited by competition from farmers with similar businesses. 

John is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child.

loans.name: Abdukahor

texts.ru: Абдукахор 41 лет. Он житель города Куляб. Абдукахор женат, и отец троих детей. Его жена дома предоставляет услуги портнихи. Она шьет национальные женские одежды, и помогает мужу обеспечить семью. Абдукахор честный и ответственный человек. Он в городе занимается ремонтом дома уже 6 лет.  Абдукахор хороший мастер, и  он хорошо справляется своей работой. Он любить отремонтировать больших  и многоэтажных домов. У него мечта стать хорошим мастером. Абдукахор просит кредит, и за счет кредита хочет приобрести инструментов для ремонта дома. Абдукахор заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
Abdukahor is 41 and a resident of the city of Kulob. He is married with three children. His wife works from home as a seamstress sewing traditional women's clothing, and helps her husband to provide for the family. He is an honest and responsible man who has been working in home renovations for six years. He is a good craftsman and carries out his work well. He loves to renovate big and multi-story buildings and dreams of improving his skills. 

Abdukahor is requesting a loan to purchase tools for his work. He expresses his thanks in advance.

loans.use: to buy building tools to expand his business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photograph is Regina. She is a 54-year-old married mother of six children. All her children are in school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from savings and enterprise development training.

Regina does poultry rearing, and she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy more indigenous chicks, which will help her increase egg production in the future and hence satisfy her customers' rising demands for both indigenous chicken and eggs. 

Regina is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and plans to invest the Kiva loan wisely.

loans.use: To buy more indigenous chicks, which will help her increase egg production in the future and hence satisfy her customers' rising demands for both indigenous chicken and eggs.

loans.name: Reyna De La Luz

texts.es:
Reyna, vive con su esposo y un hijo, de 34 y 7 años de edad respectivamente, en busca de una alternativa para ayudar a tener mejores ingresos familiares, opto por dedicarse a vender ropa, oficio que aprendió con la ayuda de su hermana y cuenta con 4 años de estar practicándolo.
Quiere aprovechar la época de vacaciones y es por ello que solicita un crédito para comprar chores, camisetas, faldas, pantalones, ropa interior, etc., mejorara el inventario del negocio esperando tener mayores ventas y mejores ingresos.
El objetivo de Reyna es darle una vida más confortable a su familia y resarcir su deuda sin impuntualidades que le puedan afectar en un futuro.
texts.en:
Reyna lives with her husband and one son, who are 34 and 7 years old, respectively. In search of an alternative to help improve the family income, she decide to work selling clothing, an occupation that she learned with the help of her sister, and she has been doing it for 4 years. 
She wants to take advantage of the vacation season, and this is why she asks for a loan, to purchase shorts, shirts, skirts, pants, underwear, etc., to improve the inventory of her business, hoping to have increased sales and improve her income. Reyna’s goal is to give a more comfortable life to her family and reimburse her debts without being unpunctual, which could affect her in the future.

loans.use: to purchase shorts, shirts, skirts, pants, underwear, etc. to improve her inventory, hoping to increase sales and improve her income.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Doña Dominga tiene una tienda de abarrotes, de esta actividad depende para vivir, actualmente necesita surtir su negocio para atender la demada de los clientes de la zona, para lo cual está solicitando un préstamo de un millón de colones, (¢1.000.000), con este dinero comprará mercadería para surtir su tienda y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a su clientela.
texts.en: Dominga has a grocery store, she depends on this occupation to make a living. Currently, she needs to stock her business to satisfy the demand of the clients in the area, which is why she is asking for a loan of 1 million colones. With this money, she will purchase merchandise to stock her store and be able to offer a better service to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her store and be able to offer a better service to her customers.

loans.name: Immaculate's Group

texts.en:
Immaculate is 35 years old and is often described as a very friendly person. She has four children and is married. As a group leader, Immaculate is representing a group of 12 farmers from the Butere district in Kenya and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Immaculate's desire to make more farmer friends in her community. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting for her as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to study. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

Immaculate and her group will receive a total of nine solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of eight acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Bwizi Balema Tukore Group

texts.en:
Johnson is a hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He grows beans, maize, cassava, and onions to earn a living. He also runs a small bar as an extra source of income. He plans to have all his children educated and improve the standard of living of his family, but he faces the challenges of bad weather and price fluctuation for the produce from his farm.

Johnson is requesting a loan to buy seeds for planting in the next season.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting in the next season.

loans.name: Solidario Lupita Group

texts.es: Solidario Lupita esta conformado por doña Guadalupe quien es la lider y esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que se le ha brindado ya que este es su segundo credito kiva y ella solicita su credito para invertir en su salon de belleza que inicio hace 16 años y tambien se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza su credito lo solicita para la compra de shampoo en combos para su salon y para la venta ya que ha tenido una gran demanda de su producto pero no cuenta con suficiente dinero para hacer esta inversion en shampoo y poderlos vender a menos costos.
texts.en: Solidario Lupita is made up by Guadalupe, who is the leader, and she is very grateful for the help she has received, as this is her second Kiva loan. She asks for the credit to invest in her beauty salon, which she opened 16 years ago, and she also works in the sale of beauty products. She asks for the loan to purchase shampoo in combos for her salon and for sale, as she has had a great demand for her products, but does not have enough money to make this investment in shampoo and be able to sell it at a lower cost.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Maria Hortencia

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo de 45 años de edad y sus dos hijos, con edades de 20 y 13 años, la familia entera trabaja en atender el negocio de venta de quesos, además en su vivienda crían diferentes animales de corral, el negocio lo tiene hace 10 años y está ubicado en el mercado municipal.
Invertirá en quesos, crema, cuajada, requesón y otro tipo de lácteo para ir diversificando la oferta a sus clientes, María considera que es importante renovar su negocio con nuevos productos para aumentar sus ventas  y percibir nuevos ingresos.
Sus mayores sueños son mantener el negocio con vida para que sus hijos puedan tener un mejor futuro y se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband, who is 45 years old, and her two sons, who are 20 and 13 years old. The whole family works in their business, selling cheese. Also, in their home, they raise different farm animals.  She has had the business for 10 years, and it is located in the municipal market. 

She will invest in cheeses, cream, curd, cottage cheese and other dairy products to diversify her offer to her customers. Maria considers that it is important to renew her business with new products to increase her sales and gain new income.

loans.use: to invest in cheeses, cream, curd, cottage cheese, and other dairy products, to diversify her offer to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
La Sra. Claudia tiene 31 años, vive con pareja, ella se inició vendiendo asadito y panchos de manera ambulante, actualmente ya cuenta con un carrito de hamburguesas, se dedica a dicha actividad desde cuatro años y ya cuenta con una buena clientela formada en el barrio donde vive.
Gracias a este negocio puede ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
Claudia solicita este crédito para la compra de panchos, hamburguesas carne y gaseosas en cantidad ya que de esta forma puede abaratar el costo y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Claudia is 31 years old and lives with her partner. She began selling grilled meats and hot dogs as a street vendor. Claudia now operates a hamburger cart and has been in this business for four years. She already has an established clientele in the neighborhood where she lives.

Thanks to this business, Claudia is able to help her husband with the household expenses and provide a good education for her children. She is requesting this loan in order to buy hot dogs, hamburger meat, and sodas in quantity so that she can get a cheaper price and earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, hamburger meat, and sodas in quantity.

loans.name: Mujeres Capaz Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Capaz  se formó en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, con la unión de 17 mujeres, quienes quieren mejorar sus vidas por medio de la lucha unida y el esfuerzo en conjunto, todas y cada una son personas humildes y de escasos recursos.
Alguien que se destaca por su entusiasmo y por ser siempre una persona luchadora y por sobre todo trabajadora y sacrificada es la Sra. Virginia, quien es además la presidenta de este grupo. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, y con ello tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y darles una vida digna y sin privaciones como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de ropas varias, como jeans, camisas, remeras, camperas y otros, para poder tener una mayor y mejor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group named “Mujeres Capaz” (Capable Women) was formed in the city of Villa Elisa as a result of 17 women who have joined together. They want to improve their lives through a unified effort by working together. All of them are humble individuals who have limited resources.

One person who stands out because of her enthusiasm is Sra. Virginia. She has always been known for being a determined person, but most of all, she is hardworking and self-sacrificing. Virginia also serves as the president of this group. She sells clothes of all types and this business provides her the means to help her family and give them a decent life without having to experience the deprivation that she had to endure.

Virginia is requesting a loan in order to buy various types of clothes such as jeans, shirts, T-shirts, boots, and other garments so that she can have a better and wider variety to offer to her customers. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can continue her work.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, T-shirts, boots, and other garments to sell.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: Hernán habita con su cónyuge y su hijos, en un municipio donde la playa, brisa y mar es lo típico de estas tierra; allí hace 15 años, cuando unos amigos le sugirieron generar ingresos mediante este negocio, nació su miscelánea donde vende accesorios femeninos, detalles para el hogar, útiles de aseo papelería y diversos artículos, a los que le agregó posteriormente la venta de cerveza; él comercializa de contado y a crédito  todo lo que ofrece entre sus vecinos del municipio, quienes son sus principales clientes. Su meta es lograr una mayor ampliación del surtido y su mayor desafío es fidelizar su clientela, para ganar más dinero y remodelar su vivienda. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará artículos de aseo, papelería, variedades y cerveza en un mayor volumen, con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y sus utilidades, con lo cual hará de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Hernán lives with his wife and children in a town where the beach, the breezes, and the sea make up the typical surroundings of this area. Fifteen years ago, when his friends suggested that he make money with a business, Hernán opened a variety store where he sold women’s accessories, home furnishings, cleaning supplies, stationery, and different types of products. He later expanded by selling beer. Hernán sells his products on credit or for cash to his neighbors in his town. They are his main customers. His goal is to expand his inventory, but his greatest challenge is retaining the loyalty of his customers so that he can earn more money and remodel his home.

Hernán is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the money to buy cleaning supplies, stationery, sundries, and beer in large volumes. In the end, he hopes to increase his sales and his profits. This would make his Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies, stationery, sundries, and beer in large volumes.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 38 years old and has one child. Bernadeth is married, and her child is in school.

Bernadeth is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Bernadeth requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Bernadeth has been in pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Bernadeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Etant veuve et âgée de 43 ans, Yawa est une mère de trois enfants et vivent ensemble à Adidogomé. Yawa a comme activité la vente des beignets qu’elle prépare à l’aide de la farine de blé. Yawa s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Yawa nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de farine de blé et réaliser ses beignets pour satisfaire ses consommateurs. Yawa souhaite augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire afin d’aider ses enfants à bien s’épanouir dans la famille.
texts.en:
Yawa is a 43-year-old widow. She lives with her three children in Adidogomé. 

Yawa sells beignets that she prepares with flour. She buys her supplies three times a month in the market. She needs this loan to buy bags of flour so that she can make beignets for her customers. 

She hopes to grow her profit margin so that her children can thrive.

loans.use: buy three bags of flour.

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Massan est âgée de 65 ans et vit à Adidogomé. Veuve, Massan a sept enfants à sa charge et travaille dynamiquement pour leur permettre une bonne condition de vie. Massan vend des légumes dans son quartier afin de réaliser une bonne marge de bénéfice. Massan s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des légumes, Massan demande ce prêt pour réaliser son objectif et gagner un profit pour favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
