Masan is 65 years old and lives in Adidogome. A widow, Massan has seven children to support and works energetically to provide them with good living conditions.

Massan sells vegetables in her neighborhood to achieve good profit margins, and resupplies four times a month at the market.

To buy vegetables, Massan is requesting this loan to achieve her objective and generate profits to promote her children's education.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Cañaveral Group

texts.es:
Es un grupo solidario mixto, integrado por 2 hombres y 1 mujer (CARLOS ENRIQUE, JAMILETH DEL CARMEN y SINFORIANO) de la etnia miskita, viven en la comunidad de San Miguel, que se localiza aproximadamente a 75 kilómetros del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron recientemente para poder accesar a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. Son hombres y mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios.

SINFORIANO: Es el coordinador del grupo solidario, con cualidades de líder, es un señor 46 años de edad amable y luchador, casado con 4 hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Debido a la falta de un empleo formal para su esposa, desde hace 8 años le estableció una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo y madera, para que pudiese contar con su propia fuente de ingresos. Él se dedica a la agricultura, con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia, apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Está solicitando su primer crédito para continuar apoyando a su esposa en su negocio, comprar en Bilwi: Granos básicos, chiverías, entre otros productos. El sueña con diversificar sus cultivos y contar con un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
It is a mixed supportive group, made up of 2 men and 1 woman (Carlos Enrique, Jamileth del Carmen, and Sinforiano), of the miskita ethnic group. They live in the community of San Miguel, which is located approximately 75 km away from the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They recently organized to be able to access loans with a supportive guarantee in Pana Pana. They are entrepreneurial men and women who fight day to day to grow their small businesses. 

Sinforiano: he is the coordinator of the group, with leadership qualities. He is a 46-year-old man, kind and hard-working, with 4 teenage sons who study at primary and secondary school. Due to the lack of formal employment for his wife, 8 years ago he opened a small grocery shop in the hall of their wooden home, so she could have her own source of income. He works in agriculture, with the purpose of helping his family get ahead, and helping with household expenses. He is asking for his first loan to be able to support his wife in her business, and to purchase in Bilwi: staple grains, dairy products, among other items. He dreams of diversifying his crops and having a prosperous business.

loans.use: to support his wife in her business, and purchase staple grains, dairy products, among other items.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con tres hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y crianza de animales que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de jornalería en diversos cultivos de su distrito, realiza esta actividad desde hace 20 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Solicita préstamo para la compra de nuevas herramientas como son palanas, pico, etc, para realizar su trabajo, esto con la finalidad de brindar mejores servicio a sus clientes lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Raul is 46 years old and in a common-law relationship. He has three dependent children. Raul lives in his own home in a rural area within the District of Oyotún. This community is known for agriculture and livestock breeding. It is located in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Raul offers his services as a hired hand with growing different crops in his district. He has been in this line of work for 20 years and has experience in this type of business. Raul has established clients who have given him good personal and work-related references. He is requesting a loan in order to buy new tools, such as shovels, picks, and other implements that he needs to do his job. In the end, he hopes to provide better service to his clients and increase his income level. This will eventually lead to an improvement in the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy shovels, picks, and other tools that he needs for his work.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 29-year-old, proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 11 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Mary has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Mary described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Mary’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.fr: Très dynamique et active, Abiba est une femme mariée âgée de 33 qui vit à Adidogomé. Abiba est mère d’un enfant et travaille pour leur épanouissement. Pour parvenir à ses fins, Abiba est une coiffeuse qui vend des mèches afin d’avoir un revenu nécessaire pour leur survie. Abiba s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des mèches, Abiba demande ce crédit pour réaliser ses objectifs et avoir une plus grande rentabilité pour aider sa famille
texts.en:
Very dynamic and active, Abiba is a 33-year-old married woman living in Adidogome. She is the mother of one child and works to further their development.

To meet her ends, Abiba works as a hairdresser selling hair extensions so she can generate enough income to survive. She resupplies four times a month at the market.

Abiba is requesting this loan to buy hair extensions so she can achieve her objective of generating more profits to help her family.

loans.use: buy 45 hair extensions

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 43 years old and married with two children.

Laura works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like candies, eggs, biscuits, noodles, detergent soap, cooking oil, etc., to sell.

Laura has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising chickens.

Laura aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like candies, eggs, biscuits, noodles, detergent soap, cooking oil, etc., to sell

loans.name: Sahossi

texts.fr: Sahossi vit à Ségbé et est âgée de 53 ans. Sahossi est une femme mariée avec deux personnes à charge. Sahossi vend des éponges et des petits sceaux plastiques en parcourant tout le quartier et arrive à vendre grâce à son dynamisme. Sahossi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des éponges, Sahossi demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et tirer le profit nécessaire pour aider ses enfants dans les diverses charges quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Sahossi lives in Segbe and is 53 years old. She is married with two dependents.

Sahossi sells sponges and small plastic pails throughout her neighborhood and is able to sell through her dynamism. She resupplies twice a month at the market.

Sahossi is requesting this loan so she can purchase the sponges and generate profits needed to help her children with various daily expenses.

loans.use: buy one bale of sponges

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El Sr. Julio tiene 33 Años, es agricultor con más de 10 años de experiencia, tiene plantación de Locotes, Tomates, Pepinos y Mandioca. Comenta que está casado con la Señora Gloria de 34 Años, con quien tiene 1 hija.
El Sr. Julio comenta que empezó a trabajar  en la agricultura gracias a su padre que le regalo un terreno de para empezar a cultivar, es una profesión que su padre ya lo ejerce hace más de 20 años.
Pide este préstamo para comprar semillas y de esa forma poder seguir con su plantación como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus siembras.
texts.en:
Sr. Julio is a 33-year-old farmer with more than 10 years of experience with cultivating peppers, tomatoes, cucumbers, and cassava. He says that he is married to Sra. Gloria, age 34, and that they have a daughter.

Sr. Julio indicates that he began working in agriculture because of a plot of land that his father had given him for farming. His father was in the same line of work for more than 20 years.

Julio is requesting this loan so that he can buy seeds in order to continue planting as usual. He appreciates the opportunity he has received so that he can continue growing his crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Emprendedoras  está en su ciclo número 15, es un grupo muy numeroso donde todas decidieron unirse para poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Villa Elisa.
Angela es la presidenta, una persona que siempre inspira a sus compañeras, que las organiza y las orienta, por medio su puesto siempre es un ejemplo. Ella tiene una despensa, en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día hasta muy tarde en la noche, comenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que poco a poco se fue abriendo camino.
La Sra.  Angela solicita de este crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, artículos de limpieza como detergente, desodorante de ambiente, jabones, enjuagues, entre otros, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named “Las Emprendedoras” (The Entrepreneurs) is in its 15th loan cycle. Everyone in this large group decided to join together so that they could grow and improve their living conditions. All of them are friends and neighbors from the city of Villa Elisa.

Angela is the group president. She is the type of person who always inspires her fellow group members by organizing and advising them. Through her position, she is always setting an example. Angela owns a general store where she works every day, beginning in the early morning hours and ending late at night. She says that she started out with very little, but over time she has been able to make a way for herself.

Sra. Angela is requesting a loan in order to buy meat, vegetables, cleaning supplies, detergents, air fresheners, soaps, rinses, and other products. This will help to solidify her business plan and improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, cleaning supplies, detergents, air fresheners, soaps, rinses, and other products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Cinthia Pamela

texts.es:
La joven  Cinthia  de  28  años de edad, vive con su conyugue y  tiene  un hijo que depende de ella, se dedica desde hace 06  años al negocio de venta de ropa usada clasificada, también vende ropa nueva, carteras, lociones, sus clientes son los amigos y familiares, también vende con los empleados de una finca de melón, cercana a su comunidad, está ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras,  Cintia es una joven emprendedora con deseos de superarse ya que también ya se graduó de  la universidad y espera conseguir un buen empleo para ejercer su profesión.
Cinthia esta solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de dos fardos de ropa clasificada y ropa nueva de hombre y mujer también vende joyas de acero. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos, y de esta manera desea mejorar su forma de vida y salir adelante también apoyar a su hijo que está en la escuela.
Cinthua su sueño es tener una casa para ella y su hijo.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2015
texts.en:
Cinthia is a young woman who is 28 years old. She lives with her spouse and she has one son who depends on her. She has worked for 6 years in the business of selling assorted clothing. She also sells new clothing, wallets, and lotions. Her customers are friends and family members, she also sells to the workers of a melon farm close to her community, located in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. Cinthia is a young, entrepreneurial woman with dreams of getting ahead, as she also graduated from university and she hopes to find a good job where she can practice her profession. 
Cinthia is asking for a loan to purchase two bundles of assorted clothes and new clothes for men and women, she also sells steel jewelry. With the help of this loan, she hopes to improve her income and in this way she wishes to improve her quality of live and get ahead, also supporting her son who is in school.
Cinthia’s dream is to have a home for herself and her son.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, March 2015.

loans.use: to purchase two bundles of assorted and new clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in lipsticks, lotions, hair accessories, deodorants, etc. to have products which are requested by her clients.

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Teresa, de 49 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada y junto con su esposo tiene 3 hijos de 16, 14 y 10 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando en el centro educativo de la comunidad y su esposo se dedica a la albañilería.

Teresa, actualmente trabaja como empleada domestica en casa de su vecina, pero en el invierno se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas con su pareja, este trabajo lo hace desde hace 9 años.- Para llegar a su lugar de trabajo camina tres kilómetros y su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m. y finaliza a las 4:00 p.m.

Teresa, está solicitando el crédito para comprar pollos de engorde y dos cerdos, ella espera tener ganancias dentro de un periodo corto, todo con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y poder pagar su crédito de forma puntual.

Teresa, sueña con poder ampliar su negocio, mejorar su calidad de vida y además construir una vivienda digna, porque en la que hoy en día vive está muy deteriorada.
texts.en:
Teresa, who is 49 years old, is a housewife. She studied until the sixth grade, she is married and together with her husband she has 3 children who are 16, 14, and 10 years old, who are currently studying at the education center of the community, and her husband works in construction.
Teresa currently works as a house cleaner in her neighbor’s home, but in the winter she works in the sowing of leafy vegetables with her partner. She has had this work for 9 years. To get to her place of work she must walk three kilometers, and her work schedule starts at 7:00 a.m. and it is over at 4:00 p.m.
Teresa is asking for a loan to buy broilers (chickens for fattening) and two pigs. She hopes to have some profits in the short term, all with the goal of improving her quality of life and be able to pay back her loan in a punctual manner.
Teresa dreams of being able to expand her business, improve her quality of life, and also build a decent house, as her current one is very deteriorated.

loans.use: to purchase broilers (chickens) and two pigs.

loans.name: Las Hermosas De Chujulimul Segundo Group

texts.es:
Anastasia es una mujer de 48 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de catorce hijos de las edades entre 6 y 30 años, esta hermosa familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Anastasia (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa,  se dedica a la elaboración de trajes típicos, ella tiene 10 años de realizar esta labor en el lugar de su domicilio.
Anastasia por tener una familia muy numerosa su sacrificio de trabajo es muy cargada, pero para ella no hay nada más importante que el bienestar de su familia es por eso que para ella es tan importante mejorar la calidad de sus tejidos típicos, aunque una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no  cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder realizar esta inversión, por tal razón organizo a un grupo de mujeres para juntas solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá comprando hilos de tipo, seda, alemán, lustrina y mish para la elaboración de trajes típicos.
El gran sueño de esta gran mujer es que sea reconocida como una gran tejedora y artesana a nivel nacional.
texts.en:
Anastasia is a 48-year-old woman, she is married, she has a nice family of 14 children between the ages of 6 and 30. This beautiful family lives in a community of Sololá. Anastasia (the first on the left side of the photograph), with the urge to obtain an income and help her husband with household expenses, works in the elaboration of traditional dresses. She has had this job for 10 years in her home.
By having a large family, her work sacrifice is very large, but for her there is nothing more important than the well-being of her family. It is for this reason that she finds it important to improve the quality of her traditional cloths, although one of the difficulties she has is that she does not have enough money to make this investment. For this reason, she organized a group of women so together they could ask for a loan which she will invest buying thread made of silk, german style, silk cloth, and rayon thread to make traditional dresses. 
The big dream of this great woman is that she will be known as a great weaver and artisan at a national level.

loans.use: to purchase thread made of silk, german style, silk cloth, and rayon thread to make traditional dresses.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Comité Esperanza está en su ciclo número 16 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 8 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Hermelinda, quien es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, comenta que se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace, y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Ella es muy buena en lo que hace es por ello que leva muy bien y ya tiene mucha clientela, quiere ir mejorando aún más, es por ello que está poniendo todo de sí, y está luchando por poder lograr esa meta que tiene.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, con lo cual podrá seguir con su elaboración de comidas, y seguir luchando cada día.
texts.en:
The group named “Esperanza” (Hope) is in its 16th loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another so that they can get ahead. They have also taken the poverty elimination survey, which indicated that eight of the members are below the poverty line. This means that they are in extreme poverty.

One of the members is Sra. Hermelinda, who is a hardworking and determined individual. She says that she sells food that she prepares herself. Her sales are conducted as a street vendor. Hermelinda is very good at what she does and has many customers. However, she wants to improve even more. For this reason, she is doing everything she can and is striving to achieve her goal.

Hermelinda is requesting a loan in order to buy greens, meat, condiments, vegetables, and other supplies so that she can continue preparing her dishes and moving forward each day.

loans.use: to buy greens, meat, condiments, vegetables, and other supplies.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor José Antonio tiene 48 años de edad, es padre de 3  hijos, convive con su compañera de hogar, Su actividad es la venta de ropa Americana y cuenta con más de 7 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad comercial, este producto lo vende a los vecinos de este  municipio de Trojes y comunidades aledañas que lo visitan a su paso ya que a diario realizan tramites por la ciudad, el cual le genera muy buenos ingresos.
Don  José está agradecido con PRISMA ya que los créditos que se le han otorgado han sido de provecho y ha tenido un crecimiento y Recopilación de nuevos Clientes.  
Don José con el crédito que solicita le contribuirá a poder surtir mas su negocio y obtener nuevo productos como camisas, pantalones, blusas, faldas, vestidos, calzonetas, jeans y camisetas, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Don José su sueños es mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr una escala más de sus sueños.

                                                                                       Trojes, Honduras Marzo 2015
texts.en:
Jose Antonio is 48 years old, he is the father of 3 sons, and he lives with his partner. His occupation is the sale of American clothing, and he has worked in this activity for more than 7 years. He sells these products to the neighbors of the municipality of Trojes, and neighboring communities who visit him on their way, as they have to do work daily throughout the city, which generates good income. Jose is grateful to PRISMA, as the loan which he has been given have been very helpful and he has had growth and acquired new clients. 
With the loan he asks for, Jose will be able to stock his business more and obtain new products, such as shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, dresses, swimming trunks, jeans, and t-shirts, which will allow him to improve his income to cover the family expenses and financial commitments. Jose’s dreams is to improve the quality of life of his whole family. The support he receives from the loan will contribute to getting a step closer to his dreams.

Trojes, Honduras, March 2015.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, dresses, swimming trunks, jeans, and T-shirts for his business.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben tiene 33 años, está viviendo en pareja, es comerciante desde hace más de 9 años, empezó primeramente como secretario de un vecino pero después poco a poco fue ahorrando y empezó a independizarse.
Ruben se dedica a la venta ambulante, y vende todo tipo de productos, por medio de este trabajo tiene los ingres que necesita para una mejor vida.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de hilos, prendas calzados y demás productos para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Ruben is 33 years old and lives with his partner. He has been a merchant for more than nine years. Ruben started out working as an assistant for one of his neighbors. Afterwards, he began saving up some money so that he could begin working independently.

Ruben conducts his business as a traveling salesman. He offers all types of products. Through his work, he is able to earn the income he needs to have a better life.

Ruben is requesting this loan in order to buy thread, clothes, shoes, and other products so that he can continue his sales just as before.

loans.use: to buy thread, clothes, shoes, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Denia Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Denia Consuelo de 46  años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 20  años al negocio de venta de Rosquillas, Quesadillas, y Hojaldras,  Radica en la aldea  los Chorritos,  al sur de Honduras, ella es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Denia esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como Maíz, Queso, Manteca y Leña, con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma y KIVA.
Doña Denia su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - MARZO 2015.
texts.en:
Denia Consuelo, 46 years old, lives with her husband and children in her home. For 20 years she has worked selling donuts, quesdillas and pastries, in the village of Chorritos, in the south of Honduras. 

She is an entrepreneur with dreams to succeed and she fights every day to better her quality of life. 

Denia is asking for the loan to buy products such as corn, cheese, butter and firewood. With the help of this loan, she aims to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is a new client with dreams to work with Prisma and KIVA. 

Her dream is to have a good business and increase her clientele, and at the same time better her future with her family. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras  - March 2015.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, butter and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 58-year-old, married woman with four children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nida has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Nida would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Mariée, Ama est une femme de 45 ans qui vit à Adidogomé avec deux enfants. Pour vivre et venir en aide aux besoins de la famille, Ama vend des marmites et des ustensiles de cuisine dans son quartier. Ama s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et les revend dans son quartier en réalisant un bon bénéfice grâce à son activité génératrice de revenu. Ama désire ce microcrédit pour acheter des casseroles afin de favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants et  générer assez de revenus
texts.en:
Ama is 45 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She sells pans and cooking utensils in her neighborhood in order to meet her family’s needs.

She buys her supplies once a month in the market. She resells in her neighborhood for a good profit thanks to her revenue-generating activity.

Ama wants this micro-loan to buy pans in order to further her children’s education and generate enough income.

loans.use: buy six pans.

loans.name: Kabale-Ntara Parishes Coffee Producers Organisation Group

texts.en:
Sam is a thirty-seven-year-old, hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

Sam runs a hardware store as his major line of business. He also gets extra income from his coffee plantation. He hopes to expand his agricultural business, however this big challenge for him has been delayed because of drought. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more stock like nails, iron bars and cement to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock like nails, iron bars and cement to sell.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Yawa est une femme âgée de 50 ans. Yawa vit à Adidogomé pour exercer efficacement son activité. Pour favoriser l’épanouissement de sa famille, Yawa est restauratrice et vend du riz préparé dans le quartier pour trouver un gain. Yawa s’approvisionne une fois par mois marché. Yawa nécessite ce crédit pour commander des bols de riz afin de satisfaire favorablement les besoins de ses consommateurs.
texts.en:
Yawa is 50 years old, married, and has three children.

She lives in Adidogomé so that she can easily run her business. To help her family thrive, Yawa is a caterer who sells prepared rice in the neighborhood for a profit. 

She buys her supplies once a month in the market. She needs this loan so that she can order rice bowls that will help her satisfy her customers’ needs.

loans.use: buy 80 rice bowls.

loans.name: Sheban's Group

texts.en:
Sheban, featured in the above picture, is representing his farming group formed by 12 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. He is 57 years old and a married father of 5 children, and he is often described as a very friendly person. 

Although Sheban has been a farmer for 3 years, he is new to One Acre Fund. He decided to join this year because he really wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Even though he is new to the program, Sheban wanted to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Sheban hopes to be able to save more money for the future.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 6 solar lights, as, even though Sheban decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr: Amah habite à Ségbé et est âgée de 33 ans. Amah  est une femme mariée avec deux enfants à charge. Pour venir en aide aux besoins de la famille, Amah vend des chaussures au marché et se promène dans les quartiers. Amah s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des chaussures et équiper son étagère, Amah demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et tirer le profit nécessaire pour aider ses enfants dans les diverses charges quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Amah lives in Segbe and is a 33-year-old married woman with two children.

To help meet family needs, Amah sells shoes at the market and throughout the neighborhoods. She resupplies twice a month at the market.

Amah is requesting this loan to buy shoes and fill her display, so she can generate the profits needed to help her children with various daily expenses.

loans.use: buy four dozen shoes

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Essi est une femme mariée de 32 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Essi est mère de trois enfants et très dynamique. Essi met ses capacités à aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes en vendant des tomates fraiches au marché et dans le quartier. Grâce au revenu, Essi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des paniers de tomates, Essi demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et accroitre son bénéfice pour promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Essi is a 32-year-old married woman who lives in Adidogomé. Essi is a very dynamic mother of three children.

Essi is able to help her husband with everyday expenses by selling fresh tomatoes at the market and in the neighborhood. Using her income, Essi resupplies three times a month at the market.

Essi is requesting this loan to order and purchase baskets of tomatoes, and increase her profits to further her children's education.

loans.use: buy six baskets of fresh tomatoes

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Doña Laura tiene una panadería en una terminal de autobuses, quiere un millón de colones para invertir en su negocio, ella va ha comprar un mueble más grande y más moderno para exibir el pan que pondrá a la venta  y el resto del dinero lo invertirá en comprar  materia prima par producir el pan , de esta manera prrtende aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Laura has a bakery in a bus terminal. She is asking for a million colones to invest into her business. 

She is going to buy a bigger and more modern display case to display the bread that she will sell, and the rest of the money she will invest into buying staple goods to make the bread. This way she aims to increase her sales and thus her income.

loans.use: to buy staple goods.

loans.name: Gladys's Group

texts.en:
Gladys is 35 years old and is often described as a very friendly person. She has 4 children and is married. As a group leader, Gladys is representing her group of 11 farmers in Butere District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Gladys's desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting for her as she will now be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

Gladys and her group will receive a total of 8 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 7 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Flordeliza has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 1 year now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Byron Anders

texts.es: Anderson  es un joven muy positivo, pasa por sus 21 años de edad, vive solo debido porque ya es independiente, Anderson vive en el campo y se dedica  a la agricultura, Anderson  vive en una casa por la que paga arriendo y también arrienda terrenos para sembrar sus cultivos, Anderson necesita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de fungicidas y pagar mano de obra para que sus cultivos estén sanos y vayan creciendo cada dia, Anderson tiene una hija de 2 años y su aspiración es mejorar sus ingresos para el bienestar de la niña.
texts.en:
Anderson is a very positive young man, 21 years old, and lives alone because he is already self-dependent. Anderson lives in the country and works in agriculture. 

Anderson livs in a house that he pays rent for and also rents land to plant his crops. He needs the loan to invest into the buying of fungicides and to pay labor so that his crops are healthy and growing every day. 

Anderson has a 2 year old daughter and his aspiration is to increase his earnings for the welfare of the girl.

loans.use: to buy fungicides and pay labor.

loans.name: Ayawavi

texts.fr: Ayawavi est une femme veuve âgée de 55 ans. Ayawavi vit avec ses sept enfants à Ségbé. Ayawavi vend des friperies en se promenant dans son quartier et trouve son bénéfice grâce à ce commerce. Ayawavi s’approvisionne au marché deux fois par mois pour avoir en permanence son stock. Pour avoir une nouvelle commande, Ayawavi sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des friperies et vendre à ses clients afin de  réaliser plus de bénéfice pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation
texts.en:
Ayawavi is a 55-year-old widow, who lives with her seven children in Segbe.

Ayawavi sells used clothes as an itinerant vendor in her neighborhood and generates profit from this activity. She resupplies at the market twice a month to maintain a permanent stock level.

Ayawavi is requesting this loan to purchase a stock of used clothes so she can sell them to her customers and achieve more profits, to help further her children's education.

loans.use: buy eleven dozen used clothes

loans.name: Kuweta Na Kwika Kitanga S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Beatrice, who is a member of the Kuweta Na Kwika Kitanga S.h.g. Group. She is 50 years old, married and a mother of six. She is an active member of the group, which was formed in 2014 and joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on savings mobilization and enterprise development.

Currently Beatrice keeps dairy cows and rears chickens, and she is taking out a Kiva loan to buy dairy feeds and chicken feeds. This will help her to increase her production of milk and eggs, and hence earn more income to enable her to pay school fees for her two children in secondary school.  

Beatrice is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds and chicken feeds which will help her to increase her production of milk and eggs

loans.name: Gs Los Cafetaleros Group

texts.es:
El Señor Carlos habita en la Comunidad de Rio Arriba, Trojes al Oriente de Honduras y se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 10 años, su finca esta ubicada en una zona muy productora de café ya que también el clima es adecuado para esta actividad.
Don Carlos está solicitando el préstamo para realizar el proyecto de fertilización de sus fincas ya que cree que si invierte en su tierra esta le producirá mejor producto y será más fácil comercializarlo y tendrá más valor.
Don Carlos su sueño es que su finca este sana y le dé buen café para poder ofrecer un mejor bienestar a su familia.
Don Carlos está solicitando el préstamo de forma grupal con:
Santos Miguel quien  se dedica a la caficultura.
Rosendo que también se dedica a la Caficultura. 

Trojes, Honduras - Marzo de 2015
texts.en:
Carlos lives in the community of Rio Arriba, Trojes to the east of Honduras and has worked in coffee production for 10 years. His farm is located in a coffee producing area since the climate is adequate for this business. 

Carlos is requesting a loan to carry out the fertilization project of his farms since he believes that if he invests in his land, it will produce better product and it will be easier to sell and it will be worth more. 

His dream is that his farm is healthy and gives him good coffee beans to be able to offer a better wellbeing to his family. 

Carlos is requesting this loan in group form with: 
Santos Miguel who works in coffee production. 
Rosendo who also works in coffee production. 

Trojes, Honduras - March 2015

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for his business.

loans.name: Dorivel Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Dorivel es una mujer de 52 años, que comercializa artesanías de barro en su municipio. Ella agradece a Kiva y MiCrédito ya que gracias al crédito con el que se le beneficio pudo invertir más en su negocio y comprar productos de artesanías de barro. 
Ella solicita un nuevo crédito ya que desea volver a comprar productos de artesanías de barro para que su negocio tenga más variedad y así los clientes escojan. Las metas de doña Dorivel son de las ganancias comprar dos tv plasma que le ayudaran a instalar un nuevo negocio de video juegos que le ayudara a generar más ingresos. También pagar su crédito a tiempo para seguir trabajando con MiCrédito.
texts.en:
Dorivel is a 52 year old woman that markets clay crafts in her town. She thanks Kiva and MiCrédito, being that thanks to the loan she already benefitted from, she was able to invest more into her business and buy clay crafting products. 

She is asking for a new loan because she wishes to purchase clay crafting products again so that her business has more variety for the clients to choose from. 

The goals of Dorivel are to buy two plasma TVs from the earnings that will help her to set up a new video gaming business, which will help her generate more income, and also to pay her loan on time to continue working with MiCrédito.

loans.use: to buy clay crafting products.

loans.name: Djakpassi

texts.fr: Djakpassi est une femme mariée qui vit avec ses six enfants à Adidogomé. Djakpassi est âgée de 37 ans et vend de la farine de manioc dans son domicile. Djakpassi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché pour disposer son stock. Pour commander quelques bols de farine de manioc, Djakpassi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et gagner plus de bénéfice pour venir en aide aux diverses charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Djakpassi is a married woman who lives with her six children in Adidogome.

Djakpassi is 37 years old and sells cassava flour from her home. She resupplies twice a month at the market to maintain her stock.

Djakpassi is requesting this loan to purchase bowls of cassava flour and make more profit, to help with various family expenditures.

loans.use: buy 200 bowls of cassava flour

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, está disponiendo todo para realizar sus cultivos de temporada, opta por un nuevo crédito para poder comprar insecticidas, herbicidas y abono, estos materiales le permitirán preparar el terreno en los que posteriormente cultivara granos básicos.
El crédito anterior ha sido una herramienta de utilidad para que sus cosechas sean abundantes y sus ingresos mantengan estabilidad, su núcleo familiar es el mismo y se encuentran saludables.
texts.en:
Victoria is giving her all in order to grow her seasonal crops. She is applying for another loan in order to buy insecticides, weed-killers and manure, which will allow her to prepare the land where she will later grow basic grains.

Victoria’s last loan was helpful and, as a result of it, she had abundant harvests, and a stable income. 

Victoria’s family is as before and everyone is in good health.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, weed-killers and manure, which will allow her to prepare the land where she will later grow basic grains.

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.es: Gerónimo es originario del área de san Martin y desde hace más de seis años se ha dedicado a la crianza de animales de granja tales como: vacas, pavos, gallinas y marranos. Su negocio lo tiene en su casa propia y esto le permite tener libertad para atender a sus animales y darles el cuidado necesario para vender animales de buena calidad. Junto a su esposa han procreado tres hijos por los que luchan y quiere darles estudio y esa es la razón de luchar por mejorar su negocio. El solicita el crédito para comprar dos novillas, marranos y concentrado para su alimentación.
texts.en:
Gerónimo is from the San Martin area and for more than six years he has made a living raising farm animals such as cows, ducks, hens and pigs. He runs the business out of his home, allowing him to tend to the animals and give them the necessary care so that he can sell quality animals. 

Gerónimo has three children with his wife. He works hard for his children and wants to give them an education. He is therefore working to improve his business. 

Gerónimo is applying for a loan in order to buy two heifers, pigs, and feed for the animals.

loans.use: to buy heifers and feed.

loans.name: Eyavi

texts.fr: Agée de  60 ans, Eyavi est une femme mariée et vit avec cinq enfants à Ségbé. Bien consciente de son état, Eyavi vend du piment  dans son quartier. Eyavi achète ses provisions  au marché de Lomé deux fois par mois et en trouve son profit. Eyavi désire ce crédit pour acheter quelque sac de piments afin de trouver plus de profits et venir en aide aux  charges quotidiennes et améliorer la vie éducative de ses enfants
texts.en:
Aged 60, Avi is married and lives with five children in Segbe.

Well aware of her condition, Eyavi sells hot peppers in her neighborhood. She resupplies at the market in Lome twice a month and generates some profit.

Eyavi is requesting this credit loan to buy a few bags of hot peppers to generate more profit, help with daily expenses and further her children's education.

loans.use: buy three bags of hot peppers

loans.name: Pablo Ernesto

texts.es: Ernesto es un señor divorciado, tiene 60 años de edad y en total tiene 4 hijos, Ernesto trabaja en la agricultura desde que tenia 14  años y comenta que esa es su fuente de ingresos para mantener a sus hijos, Ernesto necesita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de fungicidas y abono para que sus plantas crezcan sanas, Ernesto tiene la aspiración de seguir trabajando y seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 60 years old and divorced. He has four children. Ernesto has been working in farming since he was 14 years old and says that this source of income supports his children. 

Ernesto needs a loan in order to buy fungicides and manure so that he his plants grow healthily. 

Ernesto wants to continue working and supporting his children.

loans.use: to buy fungicides and manure.

loans.name: Akpéné

texts.fr: Akpéné vit à Ségbé avec ses cinq enfants à sa charge. Akpéné est une femme mariée et âgée de 39 ans. Pour mieux subvenir aux besoins quotidiens qu’elle éprouve, Akpéné prépare du riz et du haricot qu’elle vend  afin d’avoir un revenu leur permettant de se nourrir. Akpéné s’approvisionne une fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs du quartier. Akpéné demande ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de riz, des bols du haricot et un bidon d’huile d’où elle peut tirer du bénéfice pour relever les défis qu’elle affronte quotidiennement.
texts.en:
Akpene lives in Segbe with her five children under her care. Akpene is married and is 39 years old.

To better meet her daily needs, Akpene prepares rice and beans she sells to generate the income needed to feed the family. Akpene resupplies once a month from suppliers in her neighborhood.

Akpene is requesting this credit loan to buy bags of rice, bowls of beans and a can of culinary oil, to generate the profits needed to meet her daily expenses.

loans.use: buy four bags of rice, ten bowls of beans and one container of [culinary] oil

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Dans le quartier d’Adidogomé, vit Akouvi avec ses quatre enfants. Akouvi est une femme mariée âgée de 33 ans. Akouvi est une revendeuse d’oeufs et gagne son revenu journalier grâce à ce commerce. Akouvi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs. Pour acheter des plateaux d’œufs, Akouvi  demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer un revenu favorable pour l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akouvi lives with her four children in the Adidogome neighborhood. She is a married, 33-year-old woman.

Akouvi is a retailer of eggs and earns her daily income from this activity. She resupplies twice a month from her suppliers.

Akouvi is requesting this loan to purchase trays of eggs, so she can generate income sufficient for her family's development.

loans.use: buy three trays of eggs

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor, está casada, vive en compañía de su esposo e hijos, sus actividades económicas son la crianza de ganado y cultivo de granos básicos, las desempeña con toda su familia, es el medio de ir teniendo los recursos necesarios para subsistir y no se identifican dificultades para mantener el negocio funcionando.
Utilizará el capital para comprar abono, insecticidas, herbicidas y semilla de maíz, espera realizar todos los trabajos agrícolas en el tiempo indicado para obtener mejores resultados de la inversión.
Aspira continuar luchando para que su negocio siga con vida y les provea el alimento familiar e ingresos para cubrir otras necesidades.
texts.en:
Flor is married and lives with her husband and children.  Her business is raising cattle and growing basic grains.  She works with her family to earn the necessary income to live.  She does not foresee any problems in keeping the business running.

She will use the loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides and corn seeds, in the hope that she can finish all the farm work on time and earn a good profit.

Her goal is to keep her business afloat in order to feed the family and earn enough to cover necessities.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides and corn seeds, hoping to complete all the farm work on time and earn a good profit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Dúo Flor Que Ayer Plante Group

texts.es:
Dúo Flor que ayer plante
Dúo formado por María Josefa. Ambas originarias del área de San Martin. María Josefa es propietaria de una tienda de consumo en la cual ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad. Doña María Josefa está cumpliendo su sueño gracias a Fape y kiva que es el de darle estudio a sus cuatro hijos esto la llena de satisfacción y le dan más ganas de seguir luchando y siendo puntual en sus depósitos, está solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para vender.
texts.en: One of the members of this group from San Martin is Maria Josefa.  She owns a grocery store and sells basic needs products.  She is fulfilling her dream thanks to Fape and Kiva, which is to give her four children an education.  This gives her great satisfaction and more determination to continue her struggle and pay back the loan on time. The loan is to buy groceries to sell.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José es un humilde y trabajador hombre de 56 años de edad. Quien desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de queso. Él agradece a Kiva y MiCrédito ya que gracias al primer crédito con el que se le beneficio pudo sacar adelante su negocio e invertir en la mejora del vehículo que utiliza para comercializar su producto. Asimismo, generar mayor y mejores ingresos. 

Don José solicita un nuevo crédito ya que desea invertir en la compra de productos lácteos, los cuales utiliza para hacer queso, entre ellos, leche, crema, coagulantes, etc. Esto le ayudara a mejorar sus productos y satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela, así como aumentar sus ganancias. Sus metas y planes son continuar con el negocio y sacar adelante a si familia.
texts.en:
Jose, 56, is a humble, hard-wroking man.  For 12 years he has been selling cheese.  He is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito because thanks to his first loan he was able to sustain his business and buy a vehicle to sell his products.  He also was able to earn more income.

Jose is requesting a loan to buy dairy products, such as milk, cream, curdling agents, etc. to make cheese.  This will help improve his products and satisfy customer demand, as well as increase earnings.  His goal is to continue with the business and raise his family.

loans.use: To buy dairy products such as milk, cream, and curdling agents to make dairy products.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es: Luis es un joven de 20 años de edad, él vive con  su mamá y 2 de sus 7 hermanos, la menor que tiene 18 años ya salió del colegio y no pudo seguir sus estudios ya que esta familia vive con bajos recursos económicos, Luis se dedica a la agricultura y trabaja en una hacienda de cuidador de ganado y al ordeño de las vacas, Luis también va a invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de una vaca, la aspiración de Luis es mejorar su negocio e incremente el producto que es la leche  para tener mejores ingresos que le permitan cubrir sus gastos y los de su hogar.
texts.en: Luis, 20, lives with his mother and two of his seven siblings.  The youngest is 18 and finished school but was unable to continue her education because the family lives on a low income.  Luis works in agriculture and on a farm caring for cattle and milking the cows.  Luis wants to use the loan to buy a cow.  His goal is to improve his business and produce more milk.  This will increase his income so he can cover his own expenses as well as those of the household.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Doris

texts.fr:
Doris, 41 ans et mariée, a trois enfants de 23, 19, et 12 ans. L'ainé et le dernier sont handicapés depuis leurs naissances et doivent suivre des traitements depuis et vivent avec elle. Le cadet est étudiant à l'université: lourdes responsabilités
En 2005, elle a décidé d'ouvrir une petite épicerie pour soutenir sa famille. En plus, le conjoint de Doris est chauffeur de taxi dont son revenu est instable, alors avec leur situation, la famille a besoin de plus de revenu pour couvrir les charges surtout les traitements des 2 enfants et le frais de scolarisation de l'universitaire.
Malgré tout ça, c'est une femme très courageuse et travailleuse infatigable, car en 2013; elle a ainsi démarré une petite boucherie.
En conclusion, elle mérite un coup de pouce pour pouvoir améliorer la condition de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
41-year-old Doris is a married mother to three children, aged 23, 19 and 12 years old. Her eldest and youngest have been handicapped since birth and have had to undergo treatment all their lives. They live with their mother. Her second child is a university student and therefore has a lot of responsibilities.

In 2005, she decided to open a small stall in order to support her family. In addition to this, Doris' partner is a taxi driver who earns an unreliable income. With their situation, this family needs more revenue in order to pay for their children's hospital treatment and university fees.

But despite all this, Doris is a very courageous women who works tirelessly. In 2013, she also started up a small butcher's counter.

She deserves a little helping hand in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, soft drinks, everyday foodstuffs, biscuits and sweets etc

loans.name: Marie Patricia

texts.fr:
Patricia, une jeune femme très dynamique et souriante, mariée et mère d'un enfant de un an et demi a 23ans.
Elle vend en détail et surtout en gros des différentes sortes de chaussures comme nous pouvons le voir sur la photo. 
Elle a démarré  cette activité en 2013 avec un prêt au près de sa sœur. En tant que grossiste, elle nécessite davantage d'augmenter et de diversifier les marchandises.  
En plus son mari est maçon tâcheron dont le revenu est instable car dès foi, il a du mal à trouver du travail pendant lesquels il appuie sa femme dans son activité.
Le recours à un emprunt a permis à la famille d'acquérir une autonomie pour le développement de l'activité.
texts.en:
Marie Patricia is a happy and dynamic young woman. She is a married mother to one child, aged 18 months old, which she had when she was 23.
She sells, especially in bulk, different sorts of shoes, as you can see from the photo.
She started this business in 2013 with a loan from her sister. As a wholesaler, she needs to further increase and diversify her merchandise.
Also, her husband works as a low-income builder. His income is unreliable, as it is often difficult for him to find work. During these periods, he supports his wife in her business.
By taking out this loan, this has allowed the family to gain a degree of independence in developing this business.

loans.use: to purchase sneakers, sandals, flat-sole shoes and heels etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy boxes of sorbets, pallets of flavors, cones, cups, and spoons in order to have an inventory that gives him the opportunity to better serve his customers and increase his sales.

loans.name: Blanca Laura

texts.es: Con 62 años de edad Blanca es una señora Colombiana que reside en Ecuador, ella comenta que se siente contenta ya que  Ecuador es un país tranquilo para vivir y existen muchas actividades a las que se puede dedicar, Blanca es una señora muy dedicada a su familia que son sus 8 hijos pero 3 viven con Blanca, pese a su edad Blanca tiene muchas ganas de trabajar, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para criarlos en la hacienda donde ella trabaja junto a sus hijos, ella dice que en verdad necesita el crédito ya que su fuente de ingresos  es la cría de animales.
texts.en:
Blanca is 62 years of age and a Columbian woman who lives in Ecuador. She says that she is happy because Eucuador is a peaceful place to live and there are many activities one can do as a living.

Blanca is a lady very devoted to her family, which consists of her 8 children, but only three live with Blanca. Despite her age, Blanca is eager to work. She will invest the loan in the purchase of a cow which she wants to raise on the farm where she works with her children. She says that she really needs the loan, as animal husbandry is her source of income.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Marinero Group

texts.es:
Es un grupo solidario mixto, conformado por 1 hombre y 2 mujeres luchadoras (YURIS RENE, MARIA ESTELA y MARIA LUISA), viven en Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron hace 3 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

María Estela: Es integrante del grupo solidario MARINERO, es una mujer emprendedora de 31 años de edad, madre soltera de 4 hijos: 2 adolescentes que estudian su primaria y 2 menores de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos desde hace 1 año vende de manera ambulante cosméticos, productos de belleza por catálogo. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para diversificar sus productos y comprar en Managua accesorios para mujeres, prendas de acero: pulseras, aretes, cadenas, brazaletes, entre otros productos y venderlos a precios accesibles a su clientela de Bilwi. Ella sueña con tener su propio tramo, equipado con vitrinas para exhibir sus productos.

Con el primer crédito otorgado por Pana Pana y financiado por KIVA le permitieron los integrantes incrementar el inventario de sus productos, mejorar su nivel de ingresos y poco a poco mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
This is a mixed gender support group, with onw man and two women who are fighters (YURIS RENE, MARIA ESTELA and MARIA LUISA). They live in  Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. They organized 3 months ago with the purpose of accessing financing to improve their living conditions, to cover the basic needs of their home, to ensure the education of their children, and to expand their businesses. 

María Estela is a member of this group, called MARINERO. She is an enterprising woman who is 31 years old. She is the single mother of 4 children: two adolescents in primary school and 2 younger children. In order to get her children ahead he has been selling cosmetics as a street vendor for 1 year, we well as beauty products via catalog. She is asking for her second loan to diversify her products and buy women's accessories in Managua, such as steel jewelry like bracelets, earrings, chains, bangles and more. She will sell them at accessible prices to her customers in Bilwi. She dreams of having her own sales locale with display cases to show her products. 

With the first loan she got through Pana Pana and financed by KIVA, the borrowers were able to increase their product inventory, improve their income level and little by little improve their and their families' standard of living.

loans.use: to buy steel jewelry in Managua, such as bracelets, earrings, chains, bangles, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a married 40-year-old trained carpenter with  2 daughters.  They live in Kayole, which is a few kilometers away from the capital city.
He was able to pay for his training through working odd jobs and using his savings.  He has run a small carpentry workshop for16 years but it has been difficult to raise enough money to buy equipment, run his workshop efficiently,and  attract customers.

His vision is to use his skills and knowledge to improve his livelihood and that of his dependents. Through expansion of his workshop, he will be able to create employment opportunities for other artisans in his trade. He requests financial support, to purchase woodwork tools and equipment which will in turn help him realize his goals and aspirations.

loans.use: to purchase  a carpentry tool kit.

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
He is 42 years old. He is a welding and fabrication artisan and has been working in that field for 25 years. He became an artisan through apprenticeship after dropping out of high school due to lack of school fees.
He is married and lives with his wife and nine kids in Uthiru, on the outskirts of the capital city. He has a workshop near his home area where he spends most of his day working.  
His goals are to meet his customers’ demands for better products and also be able to provide for his family and educate them. 
The biggest challenge is getting welding tools and equipment which are quite expensive. 
He requests for financial support, to enable him purchase tools and machines for welding. This will raise his standards of working and increase production. This will in turn help him realize his goals and aspirations.

loans.use: to buy tools and machines for welding.

loans.name: Kitheuni Winners Group

texts.en:
Kitheuni Winners is a group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014. The group has benefited much from Hand in Hand - Eastern Africa's, (HiH EA) training in the management of their table banking and in their enterprises. Members in the group are involved in small enterprises.

The member who is raising her hand is Mwikali. She is 31 years old, married and blessed with four children. She joined HiH EA to learn business skills such as bookkeeping and also savings management so that she can be economically stable. 

She operates a butchery in her nearby market. She is borrowing money to buy more stock of beef to boost her business. This will increase her income which she intends to use in educating her children and to save more money to build her own shop to operate from.

Mwikali is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for supporting her financially.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beef for the butcher shop that will help improve on income.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase food products to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 48 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Evelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her business.

Evelyn has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her business.

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es:
Blanca, tiene como actividad económica el cultivo de maíz, en la época seca utiliza sistema de riego para tener buenas cosechas, cuenta con 10 años de estar desarrollando este negocio, el oficio se lo enseñaron sus padres; Blanca tiene casa propia, vive con sus hijos, uno de ellos ya está acompañado, trabajan juntos para salir adelante.
Invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas y costos de la recolección de la cosecha de maíz, se mantendrá trabajando y generando ingresos para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para tener una vida digna. 
Sus aspiraciones son mantenerse trabajando en la agricultura, cultivar un área más grande, generar mejores ingresos y reparar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca has as her work growing corn. In the dry season, she uses an irrigation system to have good harvests. She has been developing this business for 10 years, and her parents taught her how to do this work. Blanca has her own house; she lives with her children, one of whom is partnered. They work together to get ahead.

She will invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies and the costs of harvesting the corn crop. She will continue working and generating income so that her family doesn't lack anything necessary to have a dignified life.

Her aspirations are to continue working in agriculture, to cultivate a larger area, generate more income, and repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and pay for the harvest of the corn crop.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, ha tenido un buen resultado con el uso de préstamos, sus cosechas son abundantes y no presentan problemas de salud u otra índole para continuar trabajando y seguir cubriendo las necesidades familiares.
Considera que no cuenta con los recursos económicos para tener de manera inmediata los materiales necesarios para trabajar, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas importantes como abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas y semilla para sembrar granos básicos.
texts.en:
Carlos has had good results with the use of loans. His harvests are abundant and he has had no health or any other type of problem so he can keep working and covering the family needs.

He doesn't believe he has the financial resources to have the materials he needs to work with the materials he needs right away. He requires a new loan to buy important agricultural materials such as fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, and seeds to grow basic grains.

loans.use: to buy important agricultural materials such as fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide and seeds to plant basic grains.

loans.name: Alejandro José

texts.es:
José, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja realiza los quehaceres del hogar y cuida de su hijo.

José, trabaja como músico, en la banda de la sexta brigada de infantería, él empezó a tocar en el colegio donde estudiaba, desde los nueve años de edad, luego que termino sus estudios, inmediatamente ingreso a la Escuela de música de la brigada de infantería, en donde pudo aumentar sus conocimientos.- Es así como hace tres años, paso a formar parte de la banda de esta institución, en donde se encarga de tocar el instrumento del saxofón.

José, utilizara el crédito para comprar instrumentos musicales y de esa forma podrá conformar su propio grupo musical.

José, sigue manteniendo el sueño de continuar con sus estudios de música y tener su casa propia para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 23 years old, went to school through secondary school. He is partnered and his partner takes care of the household tasks and cares for their child.

José works as a musician in the band of the Sixth Infantry Brigade. He began playing in school where he studied from the time he was nine years old. After finishing his studies, he immediately entered the music school for the Infantry Brigade, where he could expand his knowledge. In this way, three years ago he became part of the band of this institution, where he plays the saxophone. 

José will use the loan to purchase musical instruments and in this way he will be able to form his own musical group. 

José still has his dream of continuing his musical studies and having his own house to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase musical instruments and in this way he will be able to form his own musical group.

loans.name: Edgar Alfonso

texts.es: Alfonso tiene 59 años de edad, el es un señor casado y tiene 5 hijos, Alfonso vive con su esposa, su suegra que ya es mayorcita,  2 hijos, una nuera y 2 nietos. La esposa de Alfonso se dedica al jornal de trabajos del campo. Alfonso se dedica 35 años a la carpintería, el va a invertir el crédito en la compra de madera para la fabricación de muebles, su aspiración es seguir apoyando con techo y comida a sus hijos y nietos que más lo necesitan.
texts.en: Alfonso is 59 years old. He is a married man and has 5 children. Alfonso lives with his wife, his mother in law, because she is elderly, two children, a daughter in law and 2 grandchildren. Alfonso's wife is a day worker in the fields. For 35 years, Alfonso has worked in carpentry. He is going to invest the loan in buying wood to make furniture. His goal is to keep providing a roof and food for his children and grandchildren who need it the most.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Kitindo Kiseo Kya Katitu Kisekini Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Peninah. She is 43 years old, married with four children, and a member of Kitido Kiseo Kya Katitu Kisekini Women Group. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2013 so as to benefit from trainings on enterprise development and financial planning.

She practices farming where she grows maize and beans. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase fertilizers and certified seeds to increase production and income to enable her access to better health care services for her family.

Peninah is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and certified seeds to increase production and income to enable her to access better health care services for her family.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 31 years old. He is married with two children aged two and four years, who do not yet go to school. He is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past four years, while his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer for growing maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and to buy a motorcycle.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for growing maize.

loans.name: Peter Otieno

texts.en:
The borrower is 38 years old. He is a welding and fabrication artisan and has been in the trade for 15 years. Throughout the years, he has worked with different individuals, as a welder. He lives with his wife and three sons, and also takes care of his niece, since her parents are deceased. He owns a workshop where he spends most of his time working, and sometimes when the workload is bigger he hires more artisans and they work together. 

The biggest obstacle in his career has been lack of proper tools and equipment to help him do his work efficiently and timely.  He would like to increase productivity and safety at his workshop, and also create employment for other artisans, as well as be able to provide for his family. He is requesting financial support, to enable him purchase tools and machines for welding, to run his business efficiently, to increase productivity, and to create employment opportunities for other artisans.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for welding and fabrication.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 37 years old. He owns a small workshop at the Komarock market where he practices welding and fabrication. Throughout the years after graduating from college, he worked and was able to save a little money and purchase some tools for his shop.

He is married and lives with his wife in Zimmerman in Nairobi and his workshop is nearby. He runs the workshop and sometimes hires artisans when he has many orders from clients.

His main challenge is lack of funds to acquire enough equipment to run the workshop. He would like to run his workshop successfully and also train young people to acquire skills, especially those near his home who are dropping out of school. 
 
He requests financial support from Kiva to purchase more equipment so that he can realize his goals.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for welding and fabrication

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon is a 41-year-old Kenyan. He is married with three daughters aged 15, 9 and 6 years old.  His skill is in electrical installation. He is registered under the Energy Regulatory Commission of Kenya as an artisan in electrical installations. 

He has been working in the field for 17 years now. He operates an office, which is a requirement by the commission, together with his wife just near his home area.

His main challenge has been working without proper tools and equipment when he gets contracts due to lack of funds to procure the appropriate tools. He usually hires other people to work with him whenever he gets a job contract despite the few tools he has.
 
His vision is to grow his career as an electrical contractor and hire more young people from his community, as well as be able to provide for his family. 
 
He requests Kiva to grant him a loan so that he can buy the proper working tools to help him realize his goals.

loans.use: to buy an electrical installation toolkit

loans.name: David

texts.en:
He is 36 years old. He works as a carpenter in the Jua Kali sector.  He is married with two kids, both girls who are 6 and 10 years old. He has been working as a carpenter for 10 years now. With the little money he saved, he established a workshop in 2009.  It has been quite difficult for him working due to the lack of proper equipment and tools, which makes it a challenge to run his workshop. 

His goals are to run his workshop efficiently as well as grow his business and support his community through employment to young people like him. 

He is requesting a loan to buy machines for woodwork so that he can fulfil his goals.

loans.use: To buy woodworking tools and equipment

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is a young, hard-working man who is 29 years old. He is an artisan skilled in carpentry and joinery, and he has been in the trade for 8 years. Throughout the time of his work he has trained other youths to work with him in carpentry.

He owns a carpentry workshop just outside the capital city. His goals are to grow his business of furniture-making and also be an employer as well as a trainer who will train more youths to become artisans for employment/business opportunities. He also wants to open a second workshop in another location in the near future.

The biggest challenge, however, has been lack of proper tools for productivity and therefore sometimes he is unable to deliver products to his clients on time. He requests financial support to enable him purchase tools and equipment for carpentry, and to increase productivity and efficiency, so that he realizes his goals.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for woodwork

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice, pictured above, has five children and is always described as a very friendly person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Beatrice is representing her group of 12 farmers in Butere District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Beatrice has been a farmer for 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. 

With the profits from this coming season, Beatrice is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 8.5 acres will be planted by Beatrice's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cocoa to sell and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a single mother of one child, and her child goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and feeding the family.

She has a retail shop business and has been in this business for six years. 

Annet has applied for a loan of UGX 700,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, and a bag of rice. 

She works in a shop and sells on a retail basis, seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She would like to buy a fridge to start selling cold drinks.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, and a bag of rice

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is married with four children, and living in Bundibugyo Uganda. He is a retailer and gets additional income from rentals. 

He started the business 10 years back and continues to see progress despite challenges of inadequate capital, which limits his profits. However, he works hard to expand his business and raise income for the family and school fees.  

James has asked for a loan to  buy merchandise like sugar and cooking oil, among other things, for selling.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sugar and cooking oil, among other things

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en:
Nhan is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to sell from her store.

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en: Hoang would like to take a further loan to buy more household items to sell from her store. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new products and household items to sell from her store.

loans.name: Phi

texts.en:
Phi is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and increasing sales, and it will also help him to improve his living
conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods and beverages, to stock in his general store.

loans.name: Ali's Group

texts.en:
Ali, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very resourceful person, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Ali is representing his group of 11 farmers in Butere District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Ali has been a farmer for 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. 

With the profits from this coming season, Ali is planning to send his children to school.

A total of seven acres will be planted by Ali's Group, and between them they will receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Taliko

texts.en:
Taliko is a 63-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in Kutaisi district.
