Taliko and her husband are provided with a retirement pension. In addition, she works as a nurse and gets a small monthly income, which is not enough to cover everyday costs. 

Taliko decided to start up a trading business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 700 USD. 

With the received credit, Taliko will purchase clothes and will start a trading business. She will be able to increase family income and improve the living conditions.

loans.use: to begin trading clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Gitwe Support Group

texts.en:
The person raising up her hand is called is called Anjerika. She is 49 years old, married and she has a family of nine children. 

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 with an aspiration to be trained and thus be able to gain economic and social power. She does dairy farming to earn a living.

She is applying for a loan  to buy a calf to help boost milk production, thus more income to cater for family needs.

Anjerika is grateful to Kiva for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy a calf that will help boost dairy farming.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is John, who is 79 years old, married, and blessed with four children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2011 to benefit from of enterprise development and financial management.

He is doing dairy farming, and is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy animal feed to increase milk production, hence to earn more income to meet his family's basic needs, such as food and clothing.

He is happy with Kiva and the lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy animal feed to increase milk production, hence earn more income to meet his family's basic needs such as food and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent cocoa gardens for harvesting and selling.

loans.name: Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Charles, 40, is a married man and a father of five children who are at school. 

He is supporting his family by running a business selling second-hand clothes (commonly known as Mtumba in Tanzania). He has been in this business for 15 years now, working from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to earn a small profit per month. His profit is limited by his small business capital, which  forces him to buy few types of clothes. 

This is his fourth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among Juhudi, a two-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Charles used the previous credits, since repaid back successfully, to buy clothes for his business to grow. He dreams to one day be able to improve his business and makes his family life better. 

Charles is so thankful for Kiva's support, since the little previous credits he received enabled him to generate an extra income that he used to pay school fees and household expenses. 

With his fourth credit request, he will buy second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 41 years old, married, and has has nine children. She lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. 

She trades in cocoa, mainly buying and selling to agents and cocoa companies. She also gets additional income from selling cassava flower in the markets. 

She started the business to raise income for the family and pay school fees for the children. Her main challenge is limited capital. 

She hopes to expand the business, educate her children and support the family in getting basic needs. Annah has asked for a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Kashangura Kwikiriza Group

texts.en:
Yonasi is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He sells fresh pineapples alongside farming to earn a living. He has 12 children and also lives with 2 more children who are his relatives'. He hopes to expand his business into a smart food stall but faces the challenges of inadequate capital and bad weather, which affects the quality of his pineapples. 

He has requested a loan to buy more fresh ripe pineapples to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fresh ripe pineapples to sell.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong would like to take a further loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. 

Huong's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is requesting a new loan to buy products to restock her general store.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of food and other products  to sell at her store.

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and it will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods and beverages, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Gitwe Support Group

texts.en:
The person raising up his hand is called Malko. He is 44 years old, married, and he has a family of three children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 with an aspiration to be trained in business management and be able to gain economic and social power. He benefited more from enterprise development and financial management trainings.

He does dairy farming as his economic activity. He is applying for a loan to buy animal feed that will help boost milk productivity. He hopes this will help meet the rising demand for milk in Thika, Kenya. 

He looks forward to more income, thus meet family needs with ease. Malko is very grateful Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy animal feed that will boost milk production.

loans.name: Hitiv

texts.en:
Hitiv raised her three children alone after her divorce and has succeeded in seeing them through a university education. She  took training courses in sewing and tailoring before she opened her business and basic business management. At first she provided services at clients’ homes but then opened her home based seamstress service. She has gained a strong and well-respected reputation and has a growing client base.

Hitiv needed this loan for minor renovations and to purchase a specialized sewing machine, chairs and table for a waiting area as well as cloth and materials.

Hitiv wants to continue and allowing her children to thrive and wants to develop and expand her business so she will need and be able to hire and train a small cadre of staff.

loans.use: to pay for minor renovations and to purchase a specialized sewing machine, chairs and table for a waiting area as well as cloth and materials.

loans.name: Vision Farmers Shg Group

texts.en:
The person  raising his hand in the photo is Simon. He is 52 years old, married and blessed with two children. He is a farmer who does vegetable farming of kale, tomatoes, spinach and parsley to earn a living.

He is a member of Vision Farmers SHG, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2011 to be trained on business management and record keeping. Through the trainings he has been able to keep better records for his enterprise. 

He is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and hybrid seeds to boost his production. Simon hopes that this will help increase his income, which will help him to satisfy his family's basic needs such as food and clothing.

Simon is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hybrid seeds that will boost farming.

loans.name: Herminio Ramiro

texts.en:
Ramiro is 37 years old; he works as a driver and he belongs to the 21 de septiembre union. Ramiro is married and his wife helps him by selling clothes to teenagers mostly (pants and jackets).

 Ramiro and his wife have four children and the family have their own house. Ramiro needs a loan to make home improvements (for example, Ramiro wants to build a room for one of his children and to finish some details at his house as you can see in the picture) that will allow his family to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to make home improvements

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is thirty-four-year-old Mary.  She is married and has three children aged fifteen, nine, and one. In 2005, Mary established her soft drinks, stout, beer and Pure Water business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant and to help in supporting the home. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,000,000. 

Mary requires a loan in order to buy additional crates of soft drinks, beer, stout, energy drinks and bundles of water. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 460,000. In the future, Mary plans to open another store to supply retailers, and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soft drinks, beer, stout, energy drinks and bundles of water for resale

loans.name: Ijugangoma Youth Entreprenuers Group

texts.en:
Martin, who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda, is a hardworking man dealing in the sale of men’s secondhand shoes. He is also a teacher and gets additional income from teaching. He got involved in these businesses to earn income and meet his increasing demands. He is challenged by bad debtors that affect his business plan of having a big, well-stocked shoe center in his area. 

Martin has asked for a loan to buy more used shoes to sell.

He is a member of Ijugangoma Youth Entreprenuers Group, where members guarantee one another for a loan. The extra person in the photo is a group member who has savings with the group and has guaranteed the others for a loan.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Tuganeheza Group

texts.en:
Charlotte is a group leader, aged 41. She is married with three children, aged between 7 and 20 years; they all go to school. The group is called TUGANEHEZA which means “Visualizer” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

Charlotte sells vegetables and has been doing this business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more carrots, green peppers, and cabbages to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and make savings for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more carrots, green peppers, and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Kigunga Twetungure Women's Group

texts.en:
Irene is a hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She is 31 years old with five children aged 14, 11, 9, 6 and 3 years old. All her children attend school. She is a farmer and also rears cattle to supplement her income and cater for her family's needs. 

She wishes to have diversified businesses and educate all her children, but is limited by poor weather that affects her garden output and competition from traders who deal in the same business like hers. 

Irene is requesting a loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Osman.  He is married and has no children.   

In 2014, Osman established his men's wear and t-shirt business. He began his business after he sat his high school exams and there was no sponsor for him to further his education, so a good friend of him gave him Le 50,000; he used it to start retailing. 

Presently, he is selling on wholesale and his main customers are men. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,005,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Osman requires a loan in order to buy three new bales of jeans, t-shirts and underwear for resale. He hopes that this loan will help to increase stock and maximize profit. 

In the future, Osman plans to buy a piece of land, expand the business, and would like to have his own children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy new bales of used clothing

loans.name: Tho's Group

texts.en:
Tho is 40 years old and lives with her children and her husband. 

For the past five years, Tho has been running a shop selling soft drinks to earn an income to support her family. She is the group leader of a three-member loan group in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is on the left wearing a dark jacket. Each of the other group members is requesting a loan to fund income-generating activities. 

Tho is requesting a loan to purchase a greater variety of beverages to restock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy beverages to sell from her shop.

loans.name: Walma So Zia - Zoggu Group

texts.en:
Adisah is a 40-year-old hard working woman from Zoggu in the northern region of Ghana. She is married and has five children with two of the children attending school. Adisah is the individual pictured with the hand raised among members sitting.

Adisah is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the last five years. The name of the group is ‘Walma So Zia - Zoggu’. Adisah earns a good profit from the business, as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local markets around Bimbilla and non-local markets.

Adisah and ‘Walma So Zia - Zoggu’ have asked for a loan of GHS 4,400. Adisah’s share of the loan is GHS 200, which would be used to buy shea nuts for processing. 

Adisah aspires to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her family with food and buy a bicycle for one of the children to use to go to school.

Adisah thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Mbuya Parents School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Roger. He is the head teacher of Mbuya Parents School, a mixed school in the urban area of Mbuya in Kampala with 1,000 students. Mbuya Parents School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. 

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mbuya Parents School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Roger ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Rubenia

texts.es: Rubenia de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de fruta y verduras de manera ambulante en su pick up y su hijo es quien le ayuda, tiene 18 años de dedicarse a la actividad de las ventas, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la comprar mas frutas y verduras por mayor para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rubenia is 61 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She sells fruits and vegetables from a pick-up truck with the help of her son. She has been selling for 18 years and with her earnings she is able to cover some of her household expenses.

She is asking for a loan so she can buy more fruits and vegetables at wholesale so she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fruitsand vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Guillermo Enrique

texts.es:
Don Guillermo de 30 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 3 años, quiere invertir su crédito en venta
De gaseosas coca cola, tiene 10 años de negociar es vendedor ambulante
Su mayor anhelo es poder tener un depósito grande el cual le deje más ganancias,
Para pode seguir adelante con su familia y poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Agradece a Fape por el apoyo que le ha brindado para tener cada día más grande el negocio esperando el apoyo que siempre le han brindado gracias.
texts.en:
Guillermo, age 30, has a three year old child.  He wants to invest the loan in Coca Cola sales.  He has been in this business as an itinerant salesman for ten years.  His biggest desire is to be able to have a large warehouse, which would leave him with more earnings.  He would do this in order to be able to get ahead with his family and to be able to meet his customers’ needs.

He is grateful to FAPE for the support they have provided for him so that his business will be bigger each day.  He is hoping for the support that they have always provided to him.  Thank you.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Mariama Sia

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Mariama.  She is married, and has two children aged 18 and 16. 

In 2005, Mariama established her computer accessories business. She began her business because her elder brother brought freezers for her to be selling cold water and drinks. She saved some of the profit and used it to start supplying computer accessories; her main customers are offices. This  business is open 6 days a week and 11 hours a day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Mariama requires a loan in order to buy additional computer accessories, like UPS, power cables, mouse and keyboard, etc for resale. 

She hopes that this loan will help to promote the business by increasing capital and profit.  The loan will also help to achieve her future plan by saving some of the profit. 

In the future, Mariama plans to develop her piece of land, expand the business and also educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more computer accessories for resale

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is an artisan from Peru who specializes in recycled metal sculptures. He would like to invest in a purchase of new equipment for the workshop, including diamond nozzles for sandblasting and a grinding iron.

Miguel has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is his story:

Peru's Miguel says, "I'm a self-taught and impassioned artist. I was only 13 years old when I began to make my own toys. I used to tear apart other toys and use their components to create my own versions. That's how I got into making sculptures, but this time recycling mechanical parts."

"I am very thankful for your support, as it will allow me to replace some older equipment that I assembled myself with something that will work much better and allow me to craft in greater quantities. Because this new equipment is somewhat expensive, I would not be able to make the investment without this microcredit."

Use the link below to view Miguel's recyled metal sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6243

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of new equipment for the workshop, including diamond nozzles for sandblasting and a grinding iron

loans.name: Diah

texts.en:
Diah is an artisan from Bali who specializes in silver and gemstone jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver.

Diah has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is her story:

Javanese artisan Diah says, "The unique culture, charm, and beauty of this paradise island have become my never-ending source of inspiration."

"I need capital to buy silver to prepare new designs for this year. I would like to prepare 12 new designs. Hopefully, I will get a good response for my new work so I can increase sales and keep my creativity running. Thanks for your support!"

Use the link below to view Diah's silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5793

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver

loans.name: Daniel Santos

texts.es:
Daniel, vive en casa propia con su esposa y dos hijos, una hija trabaja en un comedor, aprendió de sus padres a trabajar en la tierra, desarrolla los cultivos de maíz, yuca y también  tiene ganado, está actividad la realiza de forma independiente desde hace 15 años. 
Comprará abono, insecticidas, herbicidas, semilla y pagara la preparación de la tierra para sembrar, se limitara a invertir el crédito en la agricultura para que sus cosechas sean más abundantes y no presenten problemas de plagas.
Sus sueños son reunir el capital necesario para comprar una propiedad que sea patrimonio familiar y disminuir sus deudas.
texts.en:
Daniel lives in his own house with his wife and two children.  One daughter works at an eatery.  He learned how to work the land from his parents.  He grows corn and yucca.  He also has livestock.  He has been engaged in this business activity for 15 years.

He will use the loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, and seeds.  He will pay to prepare the land for planting.  He will only use his loan for investing in agriculture so that his harvests will be more abundant and so they do not have pest problems.

His dreams are to get together the needed capital to buy a property that will be the family heritage and to decrease his debts.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, and seeds and to pay to prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Paola

texts.en:
Paola is a single woman with a one-year-old daughter.  She  lives with her parents who help to take care of her daughter. 

Paola sells perfume and travels a lot. Paola needs a loan to buy more perfume and increase her products for her customers.

She hopes you can help her because her parents only help to raise the baby. Paola is the person that earns money.

loans.use: to buy perfume.

loans.name: Estrellas Del Carmen Group

texts.en:
Friendship Bridge provides loans and education (“Microcredit Plus”) to more than 22,000 women, offering them the tools and skills essential to work their way out of poverty. The first two things that the women do with their extra income is to buy more and better food for their family and send their children to school. More nutritious food helps today while education helps for generations to come. 

Eleven women formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Estrellas del Carmen” or “Stars of Carmen”. They have just finished a loan cycle, funded by KIVA investors last June.  They successfully repaid the entire loan. Currently, there are seven women in the Trust Bank who are requesting a new loan that they hope will be funded by KIVA investors.

The group is composed by 7 women, and one of them is Maria, a hard-working, 25-year-old teacher. She sells cosmetics and clothing from the United States. She requests a  loan to buy more cosmetics and clothing, increase her earnings, and improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

The ladies enjoy the educational components of their monthly meetings with a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer.  They learn to raise their self esteem and empower themselves. 

Thank you, KIVA investors, for your generosity that is truly appreciated. KIVA investors and Friendship Bridge empowers more women to build a solid foundation for a path out of poverty benefitting the ladies, their families and their community.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a married mason with a daughter.  He has his own house and his wife sells backpacks. Simon needs a loan to build  a room  to rent. This business will increase his income and will give him and his family a better quality of life.

 Simon hopes you can help him because this is very important for him. He is shown in the picture in the place where the room will be constructed.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Ivana

texts.en:
Ivana works at a butcher shop cutting bones which is  hard work due to safety concerns. Ivana also sells lamb and is a good cook.

She asks for a loan to buy supplies to prepare Bolivian food to earn more money. Ivana would like to sell the food on the street and if business prospers she would open a little restaurant. Ivana is 28 years old and has 3 children .

She needs your help because she is single and lives with her parents, who receive help from Ivana. Ivana has experience cooking Bolivian dishes and hopes that you can trust her

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare Bolivian food.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is a farmer and sells rice to the local community. She is a 46-year-old married  woman who never tires of selling and working.  She earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.

Esperanza is a full fledged member of PMPC and has received several previous loans. She maintains her membership in good standing. She will use the loan to purchase  rice to sell which will increase her inventory and sales. Esperanza continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the determination and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a widow with one child who lives in Tolon, Rizal. Josefina's hobby is growing flowers and it helps her to earn a living. She has grown flowers  for 25 years.

 She requests a loan to purchase fertilizer and compost. Josefina has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Josefina hopes to supply flowers to  neighbors.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en: As a married mother of nine children, Ninfa works hard to support her family. She has a vulcanizing shop in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling rice. Ninfa has requested PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her vulcanizing shop. Ninfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn works hard to support her family. Ginalyn is married and has a buy and sell plastic bags business in the Philippines. He requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of plastic bags to sell.

Ginalyn has been in this business for four years now.

Ginalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of plastic bags to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, coffee, milk, soap, shampoo, chips, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending and furniture making.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Elena dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, coffee, milk, soap, shampoo, chips, etc.

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mylen works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of eyewear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods. Mylen is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy more eyewear to sell to her customers.

Mylen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more eyewear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is 35 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Nona works very hard to provide for them.

Nona runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nona has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future, Nona would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonila is 56 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Leonila has a buying and selling of dried fish business in the Philippines. Leonila requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Leonila has been in this business for 10 years. Leonila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Norilyn

texts.en:
Norilyn is 35 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Norilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Norilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like detergent soap, canned goods, coffee, salt, noodles, shampoo, etc., to sell.

Norilyn has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, canned goods, coffee, salt, noodles, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Norilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like detergent soap, canned goods, coffee, salt, noodles, shampoo, etc., to sell

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela buys and sells dried fish to earn her living. She has been engaged in this activity for eight years. She supplements her income by preparing and selling food items. She is a hard-working entrepreneur who has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, along with the help of her loans from NWTF.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy dried fish to offer for sale.
 
Estela dreams of building and expanding her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is single and has a business selling seafood in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall.

Gloria has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from frozen foods.

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es: Lizeth de 24 años de edad, se dedica  hace 2 años, al comercio de calzado en un municipio cercano a la capital de Colombia. Su hermana y su esposo tienen una fábrica en Bogotá y contaban con un punto de ventas en este municipio y como no podían dedicarse a ambas actividades, producción y comercialización, decidieron venderle el almacén a Lizeth y desde ese momento sus sueños de crecimiento de este negocio, no se detienen. Su tarea comercial inicia a las 10 de la mañana y finaliza a las 9 de la noche; vende de contado todos los días y sus principales clientes son los habitantes del pueblo donde se encuentra ubicada. Su meta es mejorar los inventarios e incrementar sus ventas, para más adelante ofrecer a su pequeño de 2 años de edad, una educación de calidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una estantería en madera y comprará modernos diseños de calzado. Con esta inversión su almacén estará más ordenado, tendrá un mejor surtido e impactará la decisión de compra de todos los clientes reales y potenciales, para hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Lizeth, age 24, has been selling shoes for two years in a municipality that is close to the capital of Colombia.  Her sister and her husband have a factory in Bogota, and they have a point of sales in this municipality.  As they were not able to work in both business activities, production and sales, they decided to sell in Lizeth’s shop.  Since that time her dreams of growth in this business have not stopped.

Her commercial work starts at ten in the morning and ends at nine at night.  She sells for cash every day.  Her main customers are the inhabitants of the town where the business is located.  Her goal is to improve her inventory and to increase her sales.  This is because  later on she wants to give her little two year old a quality education.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy a wood shelf and modern styles of shoes.  With this investment her shop will be tidier and better stocked.  This will impact her current and potential customers’ decision to buy.  This will make her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy a wood shelf and modern styles of shoes.

loans.name: Juana Rafaela

texts.es:
Dar sazón a los alimentos es el trabajo de Doña Juana, una humilde mujer de 52 años de edad, que desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de fritanga. Ella comenzó su negocio vendiendo tajadas y refrescos; su único apoyo son sus dos hijas.
Ella solicita el crédito porque desea invertir más en su negocio y comprar granos básicos y carnes los cuales utiliza en la elaboración de sus comidas. Esto con el objetivo de complacer los gustos de sus clientes y tener mejores ingresos. Sus metas y planes son poner su propio comedor de comidas e invertir en la compra de mesas y sillas para brindarles mejores condiciones a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Giving seasoning to food is the work of Ms Juana, a humble woman of 52 years, who for the past 7 has made a living selling fried foods.  She started her business selling friend plantains and soft-drinks.  Her only support is her two daughters.  

She is requesting a loan because she wants to invest more in her business and buy basic grains and meats, which she will use for the preparation of her food, with the objective of satisfying the likes of her clients and have better income.  Her goals and plans are to have her own restaurant and invest in the purchase of tables and chairs to bring better service to her clients.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and meats.

loans.name: Rigoberto Antonio

texts.es:
Rigoberto, de 47 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, dejo sus estudios por dedicarse al trabajo agrícola y por las condiciones económicas de su familia; está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los trabajos domésticos y al comercio de frutas y verduras, sus hijos estudian.

Rigoberto, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, siembra tomate, chile y cebolla desde hace 10 años, además siembra maíz y frijol para comercializarlo, el trabaja dos parcelas de tierra y su pareja le ayuda a comercializarlo. 

El dinero lo invertirá para comprar semilla de cebolla, de chile y de tomate, con el resto del dinero preparara la tierra para sus cultivos, el crédito mejorará su vida, porque con las ganancias de sus cosechas, cancelará el crédito y tendrá alimentos de calidad para su familia.

Rigoberto, sueña con ampliar el área que cultiva, dar una vida más estable a su familia  y ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien y puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 47 years old and studied up to second grade.  He stopped studying to dedicate himself to his agricultural work and because of the economic conditions of his family.  He is in a civil union and his partner works in domestic tasks and selling fruits and vegetables.  His children study. 

Rigoberto dedicated himself to planting vegetables- tomato, chile and onion for 10 years.  He also grows corn and beans for commercial use.  He works two parcels of land and his partner helps him to sell the produce.   

He will use the money to buy onion, chile and tomato seeds, and with the rest of the money he will prepare the land for cultivation.  The loan will improve his life because with the earnings from his harvest, he will repay his loan and have quality nutrition for his family.  

Rigoberto dreams of expanding the area he cultivates, giving a more stable life to his family, and help his children so they can study and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy onion, chile, tomato seeds and use the rest of the money to prepare the earth for cultivation.

loans.name: Nengah

texts.en:
Nengah is an artisan from Bali who specializes in hand-carved wood art. He would like to hire additional carvers for his workshop and purchase wood in bulk. He would also like to increase the physical space of his workshop.

Nengah has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

"From an early age I loved natural things: plants, animals, birds or sea life. When I was still quite young I knew I had an ability to translate nature into artful things of beauty. Although I have no formal art training and work purely from my own inspiration and intuition, I know what looks good and what doesn't look right in a carving. I particularly want to create wildlife and other animal themes in an exact, realistic and original way."

"This microcredit will help all of my carvers. In times when business is slow it's very difficult for me to keep my carvers busy. We constantly need to replace tools, paint and other supplies. Having the funds to do this means we can build up our inventory for the next busy period and is very important for our survival. Your help is much appreciated. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Nengah's hand-carved wood art on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4660

loans.use: to hire additional carvers for his workshop, purchase wood in bulk and to increase the physical space of his workshop.

loans.name: Blanca Lydia

texts.es:
Blanca, de 63 años de edad, está soltera, ya que su pareja falleció hace varios años, ella tiene tres hijos, uno está en Estados Unidos y dos están casados, por lo tanto ella vive sola.

Blanca, tiene una tienda desde aproximadamente 40 años, pero aparte de eso ella trabaja en una finca de café, donde contrata jornaleros para trabajar, mientras ella administra las compras y la cosecha del cultivo, la tienda está en su casa y el cultivo está a una hora caminando, su jornada laboral es pesada.- Cuando trabaja en el cultivo, tiene que buscar un familiar que le cuide la tienda mientras ella regresa.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar productos para la tienda y así mejorar su inventario y brindar un mejor servicio a las personas de su comunidad.

Sus sueños a futuro son, sueña con seguir trabajando sus cultivos, para dejárselo como herencia a sus hijos para que mejorar las condiciones de vida de ellos.
texts.en:
Blanca is 63 years old and single.  Her husband passed away several years ago. She has three children; one is in the United States and two are married, so she lives alone.

For the past 40 years Blanca has had a store, but in addition to this she works at a coffee plantation where she hires day workers. She manages purchasing and the harvest. The store is in her house and the plantation is an hour away by foot, so her work day is very difficult. When she is working at the plantation she has to ask a family member to tend the store until she returns.

She needs the money from the loan to buy products for the store to improve her inventory and provide better service to the people in her community.

Her dream for the future is to continue working her coffee crops so she can leave it to her children and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store and improve her inventory.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Juan  está en su ciclo número 10º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, gracias al trabajo unido de todas están mejorando sus condiciones de vida, y a través de ellas también sus respectivas familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Norma, quien se destaca por hacer muy buenas confecciones, ya que ella se dedica a la costura, es una persona muy activa, que está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para que a través del programa vaya capacitándose para mejorar y poder ayudar con ello a sus seres queridos.
Ella pide este préstamo para que pueda surtirse con telas e hilos, ya que este es su principal insumo que utiliza en su tarea, y con ello poder seguir trabajando y luchando.
texts.en:
The group named “San Juan” is in its tenth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another so that they can move forward. They have also taken the poverty elimination survey. Thanks to their work as a group, they have been able to improve the living conditions for themselves and their respective families.

One of the members is Sra. Norma, who is known for being good at sewing. She works as a seamstress and is a very active person. Norma is doing her best to get through the program. She has access to training so that she can improve and be able to help her loved ones.

Norma is requesting a loan so that she can obtain fabrics and thread since these are the main supplies that she uses in her work. As a result, she can continue working and striving.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread for sewing.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee un molino de nixtamal desde hace 10 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes especialmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas pues ahí llegan a moler el maíz, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cuchillas, fajas, discos y darle mantenimiento al molino ya que es su herramienta de trabajo y  así tener mejores ingresos económicos
texts.en: Manuel is 52 years old and lives in his own home with his wife.  He has owned a corn mill for 10 years.  His business is located in his home and he has many clients, especially the ladies who make tortillas, as they come to grind their corn.  With his earnings from work, he is able to cover some household costs.  He is requesting a loan to buy blades, belts, disks and to do maintenance on his mill, as it is the tool of his work and this way he can have a better income.

loans.use: to buy blades, belts, disks and to do maintenance on his mill.

loans.name: Jose Julio

texts.es: José de 69 años de edad vive en casa propia con su dos hijos,  el posee un taller de carpintería, tiene 18 años de experiencia en el negocio y está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el trabajo, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, José está solicitando un crédito para la compra de madera, clavos barniz, pega etc. todo por mayor y asi poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida junto con sus hijos.
texts.en: Jose is 69 years old and lives in his own home with his two children. He owns a carpentry shop which is located in his residence and he has 18 years of experience in the business. He has a lot of clients due to the quality with which he executes his work and with the earnings from his work he is able to cover some of his home's expenses. Jose is requesting a credit for the purchase of wood, nails, varnish, glue etc. all at wholesale prices which will allow him to continue his work and have a better income in order to achieve a better quality of life for him and his children.

loans.use: purchase wood, nails, varnish, glue etc. all at wholesale prices

loans.name: Putri Sari Group

texts.en:
Six months ago was a very good season for agriculture. The Putri Sari group with their efforts in raising pigs and farming got maximum results. The pigs grew healthily and farming got maximum results. 

Ni Made, head of the group, has 70 acres of rice fields. With maximum care and supported by good weather, Ni Made was able to harvest her rice fields and get a satisfactory result. All members of the Putri Sari group got satisfactory results.

Encouraged with satisfactory results and to improve the welfare of families, the Putri Sari group resumes their borrowing. Now, they will focus the effort in agriculture. The group has one new member. The loan will be used to purchase seeds, pay land processing costs and buy fertilizer or hire tractors. 

Ni Made is using the loan to buy paddy (rice) seeds and fertilizer. Ni Made is using her own money to pay land processing costs and rent a tractor. The weather is still supportive, and water still flows well. She hopes to get the maximum results for the welfare of her family.

One member is not in the picture because of illness.

loans.use: to buy paddy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Deysi Nabel

texts.es: Deysi de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a vender productos naturales para la nutrición, tiene 3 años de tener su negocio el cual inicio de manera ambulante y actualmente lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor y seguir con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias para una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Deysi is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their daughter. She makes a living selling natural products for nutrition. She has had this business for 3 years which she began as a street vender and today she is located in the municipal market. She is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale products and continue with her sales which generate good profits for better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale nutrition products.

loans.name: I Wayan

texts.en:
I Wayan, age 46, is a farmer and a cow breeder living in the village of Melaya, which is located in the western part of Bali. He grows and harvests his rice entirely on his own so that he does not need to pay for land maintenance costs. He also keeps two cows. His wife has a small kiosk business. They have one son, who attends high school.
 
I Wayan has requested a loan in the amount of 10,000.000 IDR. He will use his loan funds to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his rice paddy, to rent a tractor, and to help support his wife's business. 

I Wayan's goal is to improve his family's standard of living. Through his own efforts and with the help of his Kiva lenders, he hopes to obtain a strong yield and a good profit, which he intends to use to meet his family's needs. He also plans as to set some aside as savings and to reinvest some as business capital.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his rice paddy, to rent a tractor, and to help support his wife's business

loans.name: Solidario Las Pascuas Group

texts.es: Solidario las Pascuas La encargada de este grupo es la señora Isabel quien tiene una panadería desde hace 7 años. También inicio su pequeña tienda de productos comestibles hace 1 año y está muy agradecida con Dios en primer lugar por las oportunidades que recibe. En las fechas de verano y por las diferentes actividades que realizan en su comunidad tiene varios pedidos de pasteles, magdalenas, panes grandes y pequeños por mayor, pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza y por eso necesita un préstamo para poder comprar las deliciosas magdalenas que le han pedido y así no quedarles mal a sus clientes.
texts.en: The charge for the group Solidario las Pascuas is for Isabel who has had a bakery for 7 years. She also started her small grocery store 1 year ago and is very grateful to God first for the opportunities she has received. In the dates of the summer and for different activities that happen in her community, she has various orders of pastries, muffins, large breads and small bulk. But the money has not reached her and it is for this reason that she needs a loan to be able to buy the delicious muffins that she has requested and thus leave no harm with her customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the preparation of bread.

loans.name: Ma. Imy

texts.en:
Ma. Imy runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items ranging from biscuits, candies, cooking oil, soap, powdered milk and fabric conditioner to noodles. 

She is a 25-year-old, married woman with a 1-year-old dependent. She hails from Dulag, Leyte. She has been running a store for almost a year now. To be able to continue to operate her variety store, she decided to take a loan.

She has requested a loan to buy assorted supplies for the store. These will definitely help improve the stock of her store and enable her to attract buyers to shop. Thus, this will help augment her income and enable her to pay her obligations. In this way, she could do some expansion and be able to provide for the needs of her very young child.

Ma. Imy hopes that she could manage her current business properly to become successful in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy asssorted supplies for the store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth operates a vegetable store in Ozamiz. As the mother of two older children, she never tires of trying to trying to find ways of improving her family's standard of living. 

Elizabeth has reached her fifth year of membership with Paglaum MPC. She would like to request a loan in the amount of PhP 50,000 in order to make a bulk purchase of vegetables to replenish and supplement her inventory. Adding more kilos of vegetables to her product offerings will mean additional income for Elizabeth and her family.  

In the future, Elizabeth hopes to open another market stall in a nearby town.

loans.use: to make a bulk purchase of vegetables to replenish and supplement her inventory

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Imelda raises and sells hogs. She has been raising hogs for three years now. In addition to that, she also engages in selling peanut butter.  She is married woman with two children, ages 7 and 2 years old, respectively.

She is asking for a loan to buy more supplies of peanut butter and purchase pig feed. This will help Imelda to raise healthy hogs and purchase more peanut butter to sell. In this way, her daily income will slowly improve and start to pay for her obligations. She could now provide her children with nutritious diets and continue to send her children to school.

Imelda hopes that she could be successful in handling both businesses someday.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of peanut butter and purchase pig feed

loans.name: Ederlinda

texts.en:
Ederlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur with twelve children.

She runs a charcoal business and requests 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal.

She is industrious and earns additional income growing rice.

Ederlinda dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Christy Ann

texts.en:
Christy Ann is a 31-year-old married woman with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family and has run a general store for 7 years. She requests 27,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase household goods to sell.

Christy Ann has borrowed and repaid 11 previous loans. She earns income providing motorcycle transportation.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase household goods.

loans.name: Hedeliza

texts.en:
Hedeliza is a 50-year-old married woman with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a general store for 6 years and requests 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods and personal care products .

In the future Hedeliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and personal care products.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nida is a married woman with six children who works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish business  and earns additional income selling vegetables. Nilda is borrowing  25,000 PHP through NWTF to  purchase additional fish to make dried fish.

Nilda has sustained her business with 21 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living raising cows and is borrowing  30,000 through NWTF to purchase another cow.

She supplements this income with earnings selling food.

Marilou dreams that one day will be able to save money to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Mary Wilma

texts.en:
Mary Wilma is a married woman with two children and works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business and earns additional income  selling beauty products.  Mary Wilma is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Mary Wilma has  sustained her business through 8 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a vegetable and spice business for 11 years. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase vegetables and spices to sell.   Conchita earns additional income providing motorcycle transportation services.

She has sustained her business  through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 54-year-old married woman and a hardworking entrepreneur.

She runs a general store and requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy soap, milk, sugar, and eggs.

She is industrious and earns additional income growing vegetables.

Angelita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to buy soap, milk, sugar, and eggs.

loans.name: Diseree

texts.en:
Diseree is a 36-year-old married woman with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family and has run a general store for 8 years. She requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, soap, milk, and sugar.

Diseree has borrowed and successfully repaid 26 loans from NWTF.  She earns additional income selling Avon products.

She aspires to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soap, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Tho

texts.en: Tho would like to take a further loan to buy sugar cane to make juice and buy some beverages for selling from her stall. Tho is undertaking this business in addition to her clothing business so that she may supplement her income. Tho's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in creating a new source of income. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sugarcane and beverages to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Xaviera Ezemeris

texts.es:
Las personas que se dedican al arte del diseño, con sus creaciones seducen, educan y provocan a los demás respuestas emocionales.  Xaviera es una joven de 21 años, que estudia el cuarto año de la carrera de Diseño Gráfico. Ella eligió esta profesión porque le gusta ser creativa e innovar con nuevas ideas. Su apoyo son sus padres y hermano mayor. 
Ella solicita el crédito porque desea comprar una cámara fotográfica y un computador, los cuales, le son útiles para realizar sus tareas ya que son herramientas necesarias para el desarrollo de su carrera y trabajo. Sus metas son aprobar sus clases con buenas calificaciones y sus planes son concluir de manera exitosa su carrera y trabajar.
texts.en:
Graphic designers attract, educate, and provoke emotional responses in other people with their creations. Xaviera is a 21 year old woman who is in her fourth year of studying graphic design. She chose this profession because she enjoys being creative and innovative with new ideas. Her support system includes her parents and her older brother.

She requests this loan because she would like to purchase a camera and a computer, which she will use to complete her homework, since they are necessary tools for her career development and for her job. Her goals are to pass her classes with good grades and her plans include finishing school successfully and finding a job.

loans.use: to purchase a camera and a computer.

loans.name: Decy Maricela

texts.es: Maricela es una señora colombiana que es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 19 años que se encuentran estudiando, Maricela vive en el campo y se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores,  ya que una vecina le anima a este negocio y le dice que es muy rentable,el esposo de Maricela es jornalero, Maricela el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para  obtener un ingreso mas para sus gastos y los de sus hijos.
texts.en: Maricela is a Columbian woman who is married and has two children. They are 17 and 19 years old and are both in school. Maricela lives in the country and makes a living in agriculture and in the raising of small livestock. A neighbor encouraged her in the business and said to her that it is very profitable. Her husband is a laborer. Maricela's loan will go to invest in the purchase of pigs to have more income for her expenses and those of her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for paddy seeds, land maintenance costs, and fertilizer and also helps him support his wife's business

loans.name: Ugulhon

texts.en:
Ugulhon is a hardworking woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1955. She is living in a small town where doing business in agriculture is a common thing to do. Ugulhon is a responsible, hospitable and goal-oriented person. She has four years' practice doing business in agriculture. 

She is married and has five children. They have a big family and feeding them is not easy. 

Ugulhon buys and sells dairy products. Her daughter-in-law helps her to do business. Her husband is busy in agriculture. Her family members all work hard together in agriculture, planting agricultural products. 

She asks for a loan from Kiva lenders to renovate her house. She hopes to live in better conditions, because their house is an old one, and it is not in good condition to live in. She wishes to be supported.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Rogie

texts.en:
Rogie raises hogs to earn a living. He supplements his income by planting and harvesting rice. He and lives with his wife and their four-year-old child in Dulag, Leyte. 

Rogie has encountered difficulty in trying to maintain the business capital needed to be able to continue to operate his two sources of income. He has therefore requested a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000. He will use his loan funds to purchase fertilizer for his field as well as to buy pig feed and supplements. These are essential investments that will allow Rogie and his family to continue depending on these businesses to support themselves. 

The loan funds will help him raise and sell more hogs, and they will also improve the yield of his farm. With the expected profits, he will be able to afford to buy nutritious meals for his family and to improve the family's overall standard of living.

Rogie dreams of expanding his businesses in order to make them as productive and profitable as possible.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his field as well as to buy pig feed and supplements

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
Nodira is a patient woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1992. She is living in a small town where business in agriculture is well-known among the area's citizens. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a bus driver.

Nodira has a business baking the national homemade bread. She is well-known among bakers and bakes very delicious and tasty bread. She has permanent customers and likes to do business. She needs to enlarge her business to earn a profit in order to raise her children and help her husband feed their family. She requests a loan from Kiva lenders for the first time to buy flour to bake bread. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: To buy flour to bake bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of dried fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Fanny Luz

texts.es:
Fanny tiene 39 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su hijo en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, desde hace más de 05 años. Cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El destino del préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales y alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, con esto Fanny espera mejorar su negocio lo que le generará mayores ganancias que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Fanny is 39 years old and lives in her own home along with her son in a community that is known for trade, agriculture, and livestock breeding. It is located in the District of Zaña in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Fanny has been raising and selling small animals such as hens, ducks, turkeys, chicks, and other livestock for more than five years. She has experience in this business and has received good personal and work-related references from people in her district. Her loan will be used to buy a large quantity of animals and balanced feed for fattening her livestock. As a result, Fanny hopes to improve her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Bebeth Isable

texts.en:
Bebeth Isable works hard to support her family. Bebeth Isable is married and has had a motorcycle transportation business for 11 years.

She requests 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts and maintain her motorcycle.

In the future, Bebeth Isable would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts and maintain her motorcycle.

loans.name: Via Mora

texts.en:
Via Mora is a 38-year-old married woman with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a charcoal business for 2 years and requests 19,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal.

In the future, Via Mora would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal.

loans.name: Joselin

texts.es: Joselin de 23 años de edad habita en un municipio área metropolitana de la ciudad con su cónyuge y su pequeña de 5 años de edad. Para genera ingresos Joselin se dedica a la actividad comercial, vende mercancía variada como perfumería, ropa, calzado entre otros productos trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito a su principal clientela que sin sus vecinos y familiares cercanos. Joselín inició su negocio hace 4 años, cuando el desempleo la impulsó a genera ingresos mediante esta actividad, como hasta la presente lo ha hecho, pues tiene una meta muy precisa y es as adelante tener su propia vivienda y continuar estudiando una carrera profesional de contaduría pública, aunque su mayor desafío es tener el capital suficiente para invertir. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa y perfumería al por mayor, con esta inversión disminuirá los costos de ventas e incrementará sus inventarios haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Joselin is 23 years old and lives in a municipality within the metropolitan area of the city with her spouse and 5 year old daughter. In order to generate income Joselin works in commerce, selling a variety of merchandise like perfume, clothing and footwear amongst others. She works from 8 in the morning until 9 at night. She makes her sales in cash and on credit to her main clients as well as her neighbors and close family.

Joselin started the business 4 years ago with unemployment driving her to generate income through this business as she has done up to now. She has a very precise goal and that is to have her own house later on and continue to study the profession of Public Accounting. Her main challenge is to have enough capital to invest .

Currently she is requesting a loan from Kiva, the first loan she has had from la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy clothing and perfume wholesale. She will decrease the cost of her sales with this investment and increase her inventory making this loan from Kiva a success.

loans.use: to buy clothing and perfume wholesale.

loans.name: Merenisa

texts.en:
Merenisa is a 28-year-old married woman with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family and has run  a general store for 5 years. She requests 19,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase soap, shampoo, eggs, and noodles.

Merenisa has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF and earns additional income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase  soap, shampoo, eggs, and noodles.

loans.name: Cherry Gil

texts.en:
Cherry Gil is a 31-year-old married woman with two children, one attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cherry Gil has had a pottery business for 7 years and requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy raw materials.

In the future, Cherry Gil would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

loans.name: Jerie

texts.en:
Jerie is a 27-year-old married woman with two children and works hard to provide for her family. 

She has run a general store for 5 years and requests 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase chips, bread, soft drinks, and canned goods.

Jerie has borrowed and repaid 4 previous loans. She  earns additional income raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase chips, bread, soft drinks, and canned goods.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos Enrique es un  muchacho de  22 años, es casado tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre año y medio y tres años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Chichicastenango.
Carlos Enrique para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia trabaja en recauches de llantas el realiza esta actividad desde hace ocho años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos se dedica al cultivo de manzanas, gracias a estas dos actividades ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
Carlos  Enrique a pesar de ser un padre de familia muy joven  se preocupa por las necesidades de su familia es por eso que ha priorizado la remodelación de su casa, pero una de las dificultades que él tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para la remodelacion, por tal motivo solicita un crédito para poder comprar cemento, cal, arena y hierro.
El gran anhelo de Carlos Enrique es poder seguir haciendo mejoras en su vivienda para que su familia tenga una mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Carlos Enrique is a young man of 22 years, he is married and has a beautiful family with two children aged between a year and a half and three years. This humble family lives in a community of Chichicastenango. 
Carlos Enrique generates his income and maintains his family by working in tire retreading which he has been doing for the past eight years. To improve upon his income he also harvests apples and it is thanks to these two activities that he has provided for his family. 
Carlos Enrique, although he is a very young father, concerns himself with his family's needs and this is why he has prioritized the remodeling of his home. However, one of the challenges he faces is that he does not have enough money for the repairs. This is the reason he is requesting a credit in order to purchase cement, quicklime, sand and iron. 
His big desire is to be able to continue improving his home so his family can enjoy greater comfort.

loans.use: purchase cement, quicklime, sand and iron.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, vive con su hermano y sobrinos, él se dedica a crianza pollos y su hermano tiene otras actividades económicas diferentes, inicio su negocio hace aproximadamente un año debido a una fuerte necesidad de ingresos que tenía en su momento, a partir de ahí decidió conservarlo para tener un medio de subsistencia, algunas dificultades en el negocio son las enfermedades que sufren los animales y la variación de precios. 
Para mejorar su negocio se ha decidido a solicitar un crédito que utilizara para comprar pollos, concentrado y vitaminas, así aumentará el número de animales y los cuidara adecuadamente, el resto del préstamo será de ayuda para ampliar las galeras de la granja.
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más rentable, resarcir la deuda con puntualidad y apoyar a su familia para tener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Jose, lives with his brother and nephews, he is in the business of rearing chickens and his brother has other economic activities. He began his business approximately one year ago due to a strong need for income which he found himself having at the time. From that point forward he decided to keep it in order to have a means for subsistence. 
Some of the challenges the business faces are the disease that the animals suffer from and the price variations. To improve his business he has decided to request a credit which he will utilize to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins, which will allow him to increase the number of animals and be able to adequately take care of them. The rest of the loan will help broaden the farm's galleys.
His dreams are to have a more profitable business, pay off the loan punctually and support his family and help them enjoy a better style of life.

loans.use: purchase chicks, feed and vitamins, this will allow him to increase the number of animals and be able to adequately care for them

loans.name: Josefa Idalia

texts.es:
Josefa, vive en casa familiar con su padre y  dos hijos, ella es soltera y sus hijos ya son independientes, para cubrir las necesidades de su familia y criar a sus hijos hace más de 20 años fundo una venta de ropa y una granja pollos, la jornada de trabajo de cada día tiene un horario de siete de la mañana a una de la tarde, sus padres le apoyaron para aprender el oficio.
El financiamiento lo utilizara solo para equipar la granja, comprara pollos, concentrado, vacunas y vitaminas, con ello fortalecerá el negocio esperando tener mayor demanda de su producto y así poder cubrirlas.
Su visión es saber administrar el crédito y sus ganancias para cumplir con sus obligaciones y colaborar con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Josefa lives in her family's home with her father and two children. She is single and her children are adults. In order to cover her family's expenses and raise her children, she started a clothing sales business and a chicken farm more than 20 years ago. She works each day from 7 am until 1 pm. Her parents helped her to learn the business.

She will use the loan to equip her farm. She will purchase chickens, animal feed, vaccines, and vitamins. This way, she will strengthen her business because she anticipates great demand for her product. Her vision is to be able to manage the loan and her earnings in order to take care of her obligations and contribute to the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, animal feed, vaccines, and vitamins, which she will use for her business because she anticipates great demand for her products.

loans.name: Bertha Aura Elisa

texts.es: Elisa es madre soltera, tiene 37 años de edad su  hija de 19 ya no esta estudiando debido  a la falta de recursos económicos, su hijo de 9 y su hijo de 10 años asisten a la escuela,  Elisa se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, Elisa pide el crédito para invertirlo en la comprar de pollos que los cria y los comercializa obteniendo algo de ganancia, Elisa tiene la aspiración de mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos para pagar las necesidades de educación de sus hijos y ojala pueda darles la educción superior.
texts.en:
Elisa is a single mother who is 37 years old. Her 19-year-old daughter is not in school due to a lack of financial resources, but her 9-year-old and 10-year-old children attend school.

Elisa makes a living by raising small animals. She requests this loan to invest in the purchase of chickens that she will raise and sell in order to earn a profit. Elisa would like to improve her business and increase her income in order to pay education expenses for her children. She hopes to be able to afford higher education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Ovejas Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario OVEJAS, es un grupo mixto, integrado por 1 hombre y 2 mujeres alegres y luchadoras (JOSE ANTONIO, CLARA y YANEHT) pertenecen a la etnia miskita, viven en Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron recientemente, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

YANEHT: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora sonriente y jovial de 41 años de edad, con cualidades de líder, casada con 3 hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como albañil. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, contribuir con los gastos del hogar, aún recuerda con gran alegría, que desde hace 5 años inicio con C$3000 (Tres mil córdobas netos) su pequeña pulpería. Está solicitando su primer financiamiento para comprar: Granos básicos, chiverías, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
The Ovejas group is a mixed group, made up of 1 man and 2 women who are all happy and hardworking. Jose Antonio, Clara, and Yaneht belong to the Miskita ethnic group and live in Bilwi, in the Puerto Cabezas municipality. They organized recently with the goal of accessing financing for their small businesses, improving their incomes, improving their living conditions, paying for household expenses, paying for their children's education, and expanding their businesses.

Yaneht is the coordinator of the group. She is a smiling, jovial, 41-year-old woman with leadership qualities. She is married and has 3 adolescent children who attend primary and secondary school. Her husband works in the informal sector as a bricklayer. 

In order to have her own source of income and help to pay household expenses, she recalls starting her small grocery store with 3,000 cordobas. She is requesting her first loan in order to purchase basic grains, dairy products, and other products. Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains, dairy products, and other products.

loans.name: Shabonu

texts.en:
Shabonu is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northwestern part of Tajikistan in 1970. She is living in a small village nearby a beautiful scene of mountains and hills. She is an active, generous and honest person. She is married and has three children. She has ten years' practice doing business. She is a tailor. She sews beautiful, modern, traditional dresses for women. 

Her husband went abroad to earn some money to feed their family. But he sends less money than needed. Shabonu feeds their family with the income from her business. She has permanent clients and likes her activity. 

She is sick now and wants to get treatment in a hospital. She is asking for a loan to be treated in the hospital. Shabonu is hoping to be supported and is thankful for the service.

loans.use: to get treatment in the hospital

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda is a skillful woman. She was born in the northwestern part of Tajikistan in 1971. She is living in a beautiful city situated near a lake which lights seven colors. 

She is married and has three children. For about 25 years, she has been teaching students at a secondary school. Her husband is also a teacher. 

She felt not so good and went to a hospital to observe what was wrong with her health. She was informed that she is sick and needs to be treated in a medical clinic. That is why Mavluda is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders and IMON to get treatment in a medical clinic. 

She hopes to be healthy and continue working and teaching students. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to get treatment in a medical clinic

loans.name: Kurсhinoy

texts.en:
Kurсhinoy is a strong woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1968. She is living in a small town where agriculture is the most profitable business to do. 

She is a widow and has five children. She has many years of practice doing business in agriculture. After the death of her husband, she was responsible to grow her children and feed a family. She worked hard at the land and tried to earn money to live.
