They were living poor, then after some period, she had a good business keeping livestock and planting agriculture. She rents land and plants watermelon, melon and cotton. 

Kurсhinoy asks for a loan to buy fertilizers, natural chemicals, seeds of melons and needed items for planting and gaining harvest. She wishes to have a good harvest next season to be able to feed her family. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, natural chemicals, seeds of melons and needed items for planting and gaining harvest

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira buys and sells sweets and candies door to door to earn an income. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1981. She is divorced and has two children, and the family lives in poor conditions in an apartment in a small village. She is a hard-working, honest, and generous person who enjoys communicating with others. 

To earn a better income, Elmira would like to start a new business. She now intends to keep livestock. She participated in a training provided by IMON entitled “Women Entrepreneurs Achieve Success.” 

With the expected profit from her new animal husbandry business, Elmira intends to make essential repairs to the apartment where her family lives. 

She is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy cattle. She is grateful for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Aysluv

texts.en: Aysluv is a hospitable woman. She was born into a farm family in 1973. She is living in the southern part of Tajikistan in a remote district. She is married and has two children. She is a confident, responsible, strong person. She keeps livestock at home, and she has land where she plants onions, potatoes, cereal, and other agricultural products. She is asking financial support from KIVA lenders to buy fertilizer and cattle. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cattle

loans.name: Mosharif

texts.en: Mosharif is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in Dushanbe. She is divorced with a young child. After her divorce, she moved to Zafarabad District because she had no home and little money. She had difficulties when her daughter was a baby, and she could not find a good job. To obtain income, she borrowed money from her relatives and friends to start a business buying and selling needed household products. After some years, Mosharif  expanded her business and now trades women's shoes and clothes. She likes to do business and is happy with her achievements. Mosharif is asking for a loan from KIVA lenders to buy clothes and shoes to sell in her business and to have money for family expenditures such as clothes and food. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes and shoes to sell and to meet family expenditures such as clothes and food

loans.name: Mehrojjon

texts.en:
Mehrojjon is an active boy. He was born into a family of workers in the northern part of Tajikistan. He is single and lives with his parent in a remote district. He is a student and studies at a university. Every day after classes, he works for hire in order to help his mother feed the family. His father died 15 years ago; he was sick. The family is neither rich nor poor.

Mehrojjon wants to be educated and become a specialist in order to have a good job and help his family to live without difficulties. He requests a loan from Kiva lenders and IMON to pay tuition fees for his studies. He hopes to be supported.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for his education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay university tuition fees

loans.name: Rafael De Jesus

texts.es:
Rafael, es casado, en su casa vive con su esposa y tres hijos, él se encarga de darle el sustento diario a su familia, comenta que no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero, su negocio consiste en cultivar granos básicos y practicar la crianza de ganado, tiene  aproximadamente 25 años de experiencia, es un oficio que aprendió con su familia, sus laborares inician a las cinco de la mañana y finalizan a las dos de la tarde.
Invertirá en abono, semilla, herbicidas e insecticidas, para tener todo lo necesario y llevar acabo la siembra de granos básicos, trabajará para obtener una cosecha abundante y así lograr abastecer a su familia y clientes.
Rafael sueña con ser un gran agricultor, mejorar su vivienda y darles a sus hijos educación superior.
texts.en:
Rafael is married and lives with his wife and their three children. He is responsible for supporting his family. He comments that he does not have financial help from relatives living in foreign countries. 

His business involves growing staple grains and raising cattle. He has about 25 years of experience and learned the business from his family. He starts work at 5 am and finishes at 2 pm.

He will invest in fertilizer, seeds, herbicides, and insecticides in order to have the necessary items to have an abundant harvest so that he can provide for his family and his customers.

Rafael dreams of being a great farmer, improving his home, and providing his children with higher education.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizer, seeds, herbicides, and insecticides in order to have the necessary items to plant staple grains.

loans.name: Victor Raul

texts.es: A sus 33 años Victor es un joven soltero, vive en el campo y trabaja de cuidador de una hacienda ganadera, Victor tiene 2 hijos que están en las edades de 9 y 11 años, Victor comenta que por motivo de trabajo vive un poco alejado de sus hijos, los 2 niños esta estudiando, Victor cuenta que su patrón le hace tener 2 terneros en la hierba de la hacienda, Victor necesita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de terneros, la aspiración mas grande de Victor es la de trabajar duro para la educación y bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
At 33, Victor is a young unmarried man. He lives in the country and works as a caretaker on a livestock ranch. Victor has two children, ages 9 and 11. He says that due to his work, he lives a little far away from his children, who are both in school. 

He says that his boss has him keeping two calves in the pasture at the ranch. Victor needs the money from the loan to invest in the purchase of calves. His greatest wish is to work hard for the education and well being of his children.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila, de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casada y su esposo trabaja como albañil y también trabaja como jornalero en fincas; Zoila, tiene 2 hijos, uno está trabaja en una ferretería y el otro ya se casó; desde pequeña se ha dedicado a trabajar en las fincas, haciendo trabajos como, podar, abonar y sembrar pilones de café.

Hoy en día Zoila, se dedica a lo mismo aunque solo lo hace en sus tiempos libres, se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde para destazo y comercializarlos en el lugar donde vive.- Esto lo empezó a hacer por iniciativa de un hijo de ella, para ir al cafetal se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. y camina más o menos una hora y regresa a las 3:00 de la tarde, al regreso trae leña para cocinar.

El dinero lo invertirá para construir una champa para tener los pollos y para comprar más pollos, concentrado y medicina para ellos y de esta manera poder mejorar sus ingresos y ya no tener necesidad de trabajar en las fincas, pues para ella es muy pesado por su edad.

Ella sueña, con tener una granja de al menos 5,000 gallinas ponedoras, aunque también su casa es muy estrecha y también sueña con ampliarla.
texts.en:
Zoila is 46 years old and studied up to Grade 3. She is married and her husband works as a bricklayer and also works as labor on farm. Zoila has two children, one of them works in a hardware store and the other is already married.

Since she was small she has worked on farms doing work like pruning, fertilizing, and planting coffee seedlings. Today Zoila works at the same, although only in her spare time. She raises chickens to butcher and sell in the place where she lives. She started to do this on the initiative one of her children. She gets up at 4 am to go to the coffee fields and walks more or less an hour to get there and comes back at 3 in the afternoon. She carries wood back to cook.

She will invest the money to construct an enclosure to hold her chickens and buy more chickens, concentrated feed and medicine for them and not have to work anymore on the farms as this work is very hard at her age. She dreams of having a farm with no less than 5,000 laying chickens and as her house is very small she dreams of expanding it.

loans.use: to build an enclosure to keep her chicken, buy more chickens, concentrated feed and medicine.

loans.name: Dana Kerti Group

texts.en:
The Dana Kerti group successfully paid off all the loan after some periods of loans.

Desak Gede, a common housewife, runs a pig business to improve the income of her family. With the last loan, she purchased 3 superior piglets and succeeded in selling them all to the big buyer. With the profit she earned, she can support her husband's income to fulfill the daily needs and save for their future.

With only 7 members, the Dana Kerti group continues to borrow the loans to increase their businesses. They were motivated by their friend who was already successful in running the business by themselves.

Desak Gede used her loans to purchase piglets and feed. With motivation from her friend, she manages the business better then before and hopes for a satisfactory profit. The goal for her is that she can have enough capital to run the business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Sari Kencana Group

texts.en:
Until her first loan, Jro Nyoman (pictured with her hand raised) was the stay-at-home mother of two children. Her husband works as a laborer, and she herself grows food for the family in her garden. The family lives in the village of Sombang, located in the west part of Bali. As her children grew older, Jro Nyoman found that their increased needs required her to earn additional money to supplement the income provided by her husband. She therefore decided to start raising pigs in her yard. 

To start her new business, Jro Nyoman joined the other members of the Sari Kencana group in requesting a loan through MUK via Kiva lenders. The members bought piglets with their loan funds, and these investments brought them profits and new business capital to reinvest into their businesses.

Jro Nyoman is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 1,000,000 IDR, which she will use to buy two piglets at 500,000 IDR each. After six months of maintenance, Jro Nyoman expects to see a profit amounting to 200,000 IDR per month. 

The profit from her new business is helping her to meet her family's needs. Most importantly, as her business flourishes, she will be able to continue to pay her children's school fees. This is particularly important to Jro Nyoman, because her goal is to successfully provide for a higher-level education for both her children.

loans.use: to buy two piglets

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora is a wise woman. She was born in 1966 and lives in a small town in northern Tajikistan. She is a widow with six children. After the death of her husband, she had hard times in her life. It was not easy to raise children alone. Gulnora is a permanent client of Kiva's partner, IMON, and has a good credit history. She is hardworking, responsible, and goal-oriented. She has many years experience in agriculture and knows the key elements of planting crops. She asks a loan from KIVA lenders to buy fertilizer, natural chemicals, seeds, etc. for making the land productive. Gulnora hopes to gain a good harvest next season and use her earned money for family needs such as clothing and food. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for farming

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Teresa esta pasando  por los 69 años de edad, tiene 9 hijos pero ninguno de ellos vive con teresa porque ya son casados, Teresa es viuda, vive sola y se dedica a la crianza de pollos que le permiten tener sus ingresos para sus gastos, Teresa necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar pollos que tiene en un corral, lo que Teresa aspira es seguir trabajando mientras le queden fuerzas y asi no ser dependiente de sus hijos.
texts.en: Teresa is 69 years old. She has nine children, but none of them live with her because they are already married. Teresa is a widow and she lives alone. She works raising chickens, a job that allows her to have some income for her expenses. Teresa needs the loan to buy chickens that she keeps in a corral. Teresa wants to keep on working while she is still strong, and in this way, not depend on her children.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Dieudonne

texts.en:
Dieudonne is 44 years old. He is married with three children between the ages of 9 and 13 years. They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing soya beans for the past 20 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested soya beans. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of his children and to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested soya beans.

loans.name: Addy

texts.en:
Addy is a hard working single mother who lives in rural Lyantonde. She is a farmer since farming helps her to put food on the table for her children.  When she sells, she can get income to meet her household needs such as paying for tuition and medical care, among other needs that she and her children may need from time to time.

She has been able to also accumulate income to buy cereals from other farmers that she buys cheaply and sells at a profit. Addy is hard working and forward looking. Her dream is to give her children a better future by educating them. She is grateful to Kiva and the Kiva lenders for being there for her despite her difficult life. She will use the loan to buy corn for selling.

loans.use: to buy corn, millet and beans for selling

loans.name: Shareef

texts.en:
Shareef is a 25-year-old single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a small house.

Two years ago, Shareef opened a meat shop especially for chicken. It is a very good business and the demand is high.

Shareef took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more chicken for his store to resell. By taking this loan, Shareef will be able to increase his sales and also his income. Shareef appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more chicken for his store to resell

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia de 36 años de edad,  habita en la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 6 y 9 años. Hace 4 años Claudia inició su propio negocio  de venta de carnes frías y yogurt, después de adquirir experiencia vendiendo en una empresa carnes frías puerta a puerta. Entre su oferta se encuentran las salchichas, butifarras, chorizos, etc, que compra de contado a grandes empresas productoras. Claudia vende a crédito cada 15 días,  desde la 1 a las 5 de la tarde y sus principales clientes son vecinos del barrio,  con quienes impulsa sus ventas, pues ha establecido estupendas relaciones comerciales. Su meta más adelante es estudiar para salir adelante en compañía de su familia, aunque su mayor desafío es lograr que sus productos lleguen cada vez más a un número mayor de personas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará carnes frías en paquetes chorizos, butifarras,  entre otros embutidos. Con esta inversión tendrá un fondo de efectivo para comprar más productos y llegar a nuevos clientes con el propósito de obtener más utilidades, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Claudia is 36 years old and lives in the city with her spouse and their 2 children aged 6 and 9. Four years ago Claudia started her own business selling cold cuts and yogurt, after acquiring experience in a company selling cold cuts door to door. Among her offerings are sausages, Catalan sausages, chorizo sausages, etc., bought in cash from large manufacturing companies. Claudia sells on credit every 15 days, from 1 to 5 in the afternoon. Her main customers are residents of her neighbourhood, who boost sales and with whom she has established great business relationships. 

Her goal in the future is to study and therefore move her and her family forward, although her biggest challenge is getting her products to reach a greater number of people. Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan (credikiva), her first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo (FMSD). With this loan she will buy cold cuts in sausage casings and Catalan sausages, among other cured meats. With this investment she will have an effective base to buy more products and reach new customers, with the purpose of obtaining more profits, making your Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy cold cuts in sausage casings, Catalan sausages, and other cured meats

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 56 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of 16 and 28 years. Two of them go to school. Epiphanie is a farmer and she has been growing soya beans for the past 40 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested soya beans. The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare and to buy medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested soya beans.

loans.name: Cyprien

texts.en:
Cyprien is 56 years old. He is married with six children between the ages of 9 and 27 years. Four of them go to school. Cyprien is a farmer, and he has been growing soya beans for the past 40 years. His wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested soya beans. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of his children and to improve their standard of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested soya beans.

loans.name: Lilik

texts.en:
Mrs. Lilik has a family of two and lives in a town in Malang Regency in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water, and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. 

Mrs. Lilik heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held a safe water training in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, thus without using fuel or electricity. Mrs. Lilik, who is also a healthworker in  her neighborhood, seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. 

Mrs. Lilik will use this loan to buy about 20 filters to sell them to her neighbors on credit, making safe drinking water available to 100 people.

loans.use: To buy water filters in order to provide her neighbors with safe drinking water

loans.name: Dedit

texts.en:
Mr. Dedit has a family of two and lives in a town in Blitar City in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water, and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. 

Mr. Dedit heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava Water Filters held safe water training in his vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, thus without using fuel or electricity. Mr. Dedit, who is also a healthworker in his neighborhood, seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in his area. 

This loan will allow Mr. Dedit to buy about 30 filters to sell to his neighbors on credit, making safe drinking water available to 150 people.

loans.use: To buy water filters in order to sell affordable water purifiers

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 37 years old. She is married with two children between one and six years old. One of them goes to school. She is a farmer, and she has been growing soya beans for the past 15 years. Her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested soya beans. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested soya beans.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, age 44, is a soy farmer. She has earned her living from planting and harvesting soy beans for the past 15 years. She and her husband, who is also a farmer, have two children, ages 15 and 17. Both children attend school.

With her Kiva loan funds, Grace will pay workers to help her harvest her soy beans. 

The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings and to pay the school fees of her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers to help her harvest her soy beans

loans.name: Wendy Marisol

texts.es:
Wendy, es una joven soltera que vive en casa de su familia con su mamá y un hermano, buscando ser independiente y aportar en los gastos del hogar inicio a trabajar en una sala de belleza, pudo adquirir la experiencia necesaria y logro establecer su negocio, ofrece sus servicios de cosmetóloga y además oferta diferentes cosméticos a sus clientes, trabaja de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Su negocio aún no está bien establecido, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un préstamo con el que comprara un espejo, una silla para cortes de cabello, entre otros muebles que le sean de utilidad para ir equipando el local y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Los sueños que Wendy tiene son ver su negocio más amplio, tener clientes satisfechos, que la rentabilidad sea mayor para que sea autosostenible y apoyar a su familia para disminuir las necesidades existentes en el hogar.
texts.en:
Wendy is a young single woman. She lives in her family home with her mother and a brother. She began working in a beauty salon with the goal of becoming independent and of helping with household expenses. She was able to gain enough experience to establish her own business. She offers her services as a cosmetologist, and also sells cosmetics to her customers. She works from eight in the morning until five in the afternoon.

Her business has yet to become well established. This is why she has decided to seek a loan, which she will use to purchase a mirror, a beauty chair to use during haircuts, and other useful furnishings with which to equip the space and offer better service to her customers.

Wendy’s dreams are of seeing her business grow, having satisfied customers and making greater profits so that she can be self-sufficient and help support her family to lessen the needs of their household.

loans.use: to buy a mirror, a beauty chair to use during haircuts, and other useful furnishings with which to equip the space.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials like sliders, leather, and tools like die-cutters

loans.name: Dúo Angélica De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Angélica de San Pedro: Este grupo esta conformado por la señora Angelica de 21 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos en general, se ha dedica a está actividad desde hace varios años, y en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cosmeticos para la venta ya que el capital que tiene no le alcanza, el sueño de ella es agrandar mas su negocio y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: The Angélica de San Pedro Duo: This group is comprised of Angelica, 21 years old. She makes a living selling cosmetics in general. She has worked at this activity for several years, and this time she is requesting this loan to buy cosmetics for sale because the capital she has is not sufficient. Her dream is to enlarge her business and help her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Erick Joel

texts.es:
Erick, agradece la ayuda brindada a través del crédito anterior que solicito para realizar los trabajos agrícolas, las cosechas han sido abundantes, las ganancias han mejorado y le han servido para cancelar su deuda y enfrentar los problemas de salud de una hija.
Nuevamente solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas con los que acondicionara el terreno en el que va a sembrar maíz y pipían, espera que los resultados sean positivos para seguir dándole buena alimentación a su familia y mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.
texts.en: Erick is grateful for the support given him through his last loan that he requested to undertake his agricultural work. His harvests were abundant and his profits increased which helped him to pay his debt and take care of health problem of a daughter. Once again he is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs with which to prepare the soil to plant corn and squash. He hopes that the results will be positive so he can continue to provide good food for his family and keep his clients satisfied.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to prepare the earth to plant corn and squash.

loans.name: Domitille

texts.en:
Domitille is 47 years old. She is married with six children between the ages of 8 and 21 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer, and she has been growing soya beans for the past 21 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested soya beans. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested soya beans.

loans.name: Protogene

texts.en:
Protogene is 39 years old. He is married with three children between the ages of 4 and 15 years. They all go to school. He is a farmer, and he has been growing soya beans for the past 17 years. His wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested soya beans. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to buy a cow for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested soya beans.

loans.name: Isidorine Françoise

texts.fr:
Agée de 36 ans, veuve, Isidorine a deux enfants de 15 et 9 ans  qui vont tous à l'école.
C'est une femme combative et débrouillarde, malgré sa situation, elle ne baisse jamais les bras, elle est courageuse. Elle élève seule ses enfants depuis le décès de son mari.
Vente e fournitures de bureau et scolaires est l'activité génératrice de revenu de la famille depuis 16 ans. Auparavant, les deux époux exerçaient ensemble l'affaire. Actuellement, Isidorine gèrent seule les 2 points de vente.
Elle a des clients fixes qui achètent en gros et doit quelquefois faire des livraisons. Étant donné ses occupations, elle a fait appel à un employé pour l'aider.
Elle veut toujours développer son affaire, qu'elle est seule à soutenir sa famille.
Son but est de pouvoir continuer à scolariser ses enfants jusqu'à la fin de l'université et que ces derniers auront de bonne carrière.
texts.en:
Isidorine is 36 year old, a widow, and the mother if two children, 15 and 9 years of age, both of whom are in school. She is a resilient and hard-working person; in spite of her situation, she never gives up and remains courageous. She has been raising her children on her own since her husband passed away. She  resells office and schools supplies, having been supporting her family in this way for 16 years.  In the past she and her husband used to run this business together. 

At present, Isidorine manages two sales stands on her own. She has loyal customers who buy from her wholesale, and sometimes she needs to make deliveries as well. Given all of her work, she employs one additional person to help. She would like to continue developing her business as she is the sole breadwinner in the family. Her goal is to be able to continue paying for her children’s education through university studies, so that her children may have a good professional future.

loans.use: to buy envelopes, vellum papers, calculators, wrapping paper, receipt books etc.

loans.name: Lauben

texts.en:
Lauben, age 42, is a dairy farmer. He raises and sells cattle to earn an income, as well as trading in milk at market. He started his business in 2000 with the aim of meeting his family's increasing needs. His clients are traders from surrounding towns as well as from the city. He describes himself as a hard-working man.

He lives in a rural area with his wife and their seven children, six of whom are still attending school.

Lauben is acquiring this loan facility in order to buy calves to raise for three to six months and then offer for sale. He appreciates UGAFODE's flexibility in terms of giving quarterly loans to facilitate this kind of business, allowing the loans to be repaid quarterly. 

He appreciates the support he is receiving from UGAFODE and from his Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Nancy Del Socorro

texts.es: A sus 34 años de edad Nancy esta casada, tiene 2 hijos, de 9 y 19 años de edad, el esposo de Nancy trabaja de albañil,  Nancy se dedica  a la venta ambulante de ropa, ofrece a sus amigas, clientas y familiares pero con buen servicio y productos de calidad es como obtiene sus ingresos, por este motivo Nancy necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar mercadería en ropa, lo que Nancy aspira de su negocio es cada dia mejorar sus ventas y aumentar sus ingresos para velar por la educación y futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en: At 34 years old Nancy is married and has 2 children aged 9 and 19. Nancy's spouse works in construction. Nancy makes a living selling clothes itinerantly, offering to her friends, customers, and family. But with good service and quality products comes a need to obtain income. For this reason Nancy needs the capital to buy clothing merchandise. Nancy aspires every day to improve her business and her sales, and increase her income to ensure education and a future for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Hripsime

texts.en:
This young lady’s name is Hripsime, and she is 18 years old. Hripsime lives in the village Geghamavan of the Gegharkunik region. She lives there with her mother, brother and grandmother. Her father is in Russian Federation for work. He transfers money for his family's needs. Hripsime mentions that none of her family members are employed. They have a cute farm which is cared for by her mother and brother. 

Hripsime is a student at the Yerevan State University in the Historical Department. Hripsime studies at the paid division. Despite the delight that she manages to attain higher education, the problem of her tuition fees is very hard and serious for her family. This loan of 90,000 Armenian drams Hripsime asks, along with money saved by her mother, will be enough to pay her tuition fee for the second semester.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee for the second semester

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam, age 41, is a farmer. She sells some of her produce to earn an income, and she feeds her family with homemade meals made from the produce as well. She lives with her husband and their three children.

Hiyam has been engaged in this activity since 2012, and she has attained a good reputation in her hometown for offering the highest-quality produce for sale.  

She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. in order to improve and expand her production so that she can offer produce of top quality in larger amounts to her customers, thereby increasing her income. She reports that she is very sure that she will sell all her products and expand her business area. 

Her goal is to meet her family's needs and to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to improve the quality and quantity of her agricultural produce

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es:
Ana, de 23 años de edad, hace poco tiempo se graduó de técnico superior en logística, está casada y su esposo trabaja en un destacamento militar y tienen una hija.

Ana, tiene poco tiempo de trabajar en una oficina jurídica, decidió trabajar para adquirir experiencia y más adelante pueda conseguir otro trabajo mejor, en donde pueda obtener mejores ingresos, el horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.
 
Ana, es primera vez que está solicitando un préstamo para comprar una cocina de gas, porque la que tiene ya no le sirve.

El sueño de Ana, es encontrar un trabajo en el área de logística que fue lo que estudio.
texts.en:
Ana recently graduated from a technical college with a degree in logistics. She is 23 years old, married to a soldier serving in a military unit, and the couple has a young daughter. 

Shortly after graduation, Ana joined a legal office, and works from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. Ana took this job to gain experience and eventually find a better job with a higher salary.  

Ana is applying for her first loan to purchase a gas stove to replace an older one that no longer meets her family's needs. 

She hopes one day to find a job in the field of logistics.

loans.use: to purchase a gas stove.

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Víctor un hombre de 44 años, un padre de familia dedicado y luchador en el campo, él cuenta que gracias a los créditos a los que ha tenido acceso a logrado que su cultivo siga creciendo, porque antes de los créditos el sembraba en poca cantidad y ahora ha ido prosperando mucho, por lo que se encuentra profundamente agradecido por el apoyo que se le ha brindado, pero él es un hombre optimista que quiere seguir prosperando con esfuerzos por tal motivo solicita un crédito que lo invertirá nuevamente para comparar sus semillas y fertilizantes.
El sueño de Víctor es que pueda contar nuevamente con este crédito para seguir prosperando.
texts.en: Víctor is a 44 year old dedicated father of a family and a fighter in the fields. He says that thanks to the last loan that he was awarded his crops continued to expand. Before the loans he planted in small quantities and now he is prospering. So he is very grateful for the support he has been given. He is an optimistic man who wants to continue to prosper through his efforts. So he is requesting a loan which he will once again invest buying seeds and fertilizer. Victor's dream is to be able to count on this loan so he can continue to prosper.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar es estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería industrial, tiene varias metas y la principal es viajar al extranjero y capacitarse más para aumentar sus conocimientos.
Quiere convertirse en un buen profesional, que pueda ser útil a las demás personas y también a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Edgar is a student studying for a degree in Industrial Engineering.  He has various goals but the main one is to travel abroad and study further in order to expand his knowledge. 

He wants to become a good professional who will be useful to others as well as society.  He is applying for a loan in order to pay the fees for his degree  and to be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Kucup Mekar Group

texts.en:
After a six month loan period, Ni Ketut and Kucup Mekar Group managed to pay off the loan without any problems. From the sale of her pigs, Ni Ketut manages a profit of 250,000 IDR per month. This result is far from the previous expectation, when Ni Ketut was hoping to take advantage of 400,000 IDR per month. 

High feed prices and the lower selling price per kilo of pork are the main factors that caused the drop in profits obtained by Ni Ketut. However, it did not dampen the spirit of Ni Ketut in running the business. Ni Ketut, along with other members of the group, are returning to borrow capital to shore up their businesses. Ni Ketut has great hope for future benefit, so as to assist her in improving the welfare of her family.

As a housewife who lives in the village, Ni Ketut was highly qualified to pursue the pigs. In order to help her husband, who worked as a laborer and financed her children. Ni Ketut is back with MUK to borrow 1,300,000 IDR for her capital. Together with Kucup Mekar group, Ni Ketut plans to use this loan to buy three fattening piglets, each costing 400,000 IDR, to be maintains for six months.

Ni Ketut expects the price per kilo of pig to increase and feed prices to decrease in the next six months so that the benefits will be more than the previous period. The profits will be used to finance her children's schools fees and of course to raise the capital level of her pig business. 

One group member decide to resign after she had enough profit to use for capital to continue her pig business with her own money.

loans.use: to buy three fattening piglets

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 39 years old. He is married, with one child who is six years old and not yet in school. He is a farmer, and he has been growing soya beans for the past 15 years. His wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested soya beans. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and to buy a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested soya beans.

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over one year, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition around her place of business. 

With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Ismenia Delfina

texts.es:
Ismenia, vive con su familia y tiene dos hijos, que son dependientes, no cuenta con apoyo del familiares en el extranjero, ella elabora atol de elote para vender, el negocio se le enseñó su padre, realiza está labor de siete de la mañana  a cinco de la tarde, cuenta con un mercado favorable y es muy reconocida en la zona.
Invertirá en elotes, tendrá insumos para la elaboración de atol, de esta manera seguirá trabajando y sus ganancias serán mejores, espera atraer nuevos clientes, cancelar su deuda y cubrir las necesidades familiares.
Ismenia tiene como objetivo adquirir experiencia en el uso de créditos y mantener la continuidad de su negocio.
texts.en: Ismenia lives with her family and has 2 dependent children. She has no help from relatives abroad. She prepares atol (a cornflour drink) to sell. The business was taught to her by her father. She carries out this work from 7 in the morning to 5 at night. She has favourable sales and is well-recognized in her area. She will invest in corn, so she will have materials to make atol. In this way she will continue working and her profits will increase. She hopes to attract new customers, settle her debt, and cover the cost of household necessities. Ismenia aims to acquire experience in using credits and maintaining the continuity of her business.

loans.use: to invest in corn so she will have materials to make atol (cornflour drink)

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Maria es madre soltera  tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad que asiste a la escuela, Maria se dedica los fines de semana a la venta de comida, su negocio está ubicado en un lugar que es muy visitado por las personas de su localidad ya que existe un parque recreativo para toda la familia, los demás días de la semana se dedica al trabajo del campo, Maria va a invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de alimentos para preparar y vender en su puesto de comida. Maria  vive en la casa de sus padres, y su aspiración es seguir luchando en la vida todo para bienestar de su  hijo.
texts.en: Maria is a single mother. She has a 10 year old son who goes to school. Maria works on the weekends selling food. Her business is located in a place that is very frequented by the people of her community, as there is a recreational park for families. The rest of the week she works in the field. Maria will invest the loan money to purchase food items to prepare and sell in her food stall. Maria lives in the house of her parents, and her dream is to keep fighting all her life for the well-being of her son.

loans.use: to buy products to prepare food.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia esta en la etapa final de su carrera, trata de que pueda crecer cada día y es por ello que se esta esforzando cada día, ella es una persona muy luchadora y por sobre todo sacrificada. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Ella hoy pide nuevamente de este préstamo para poder invertirlo de vuelta en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, para que pueda seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Patricia is in the final stage of her degree. Every day she tries to grow and this is what she strives for every day. She is a strong person, especially given all her sacrifices.  

She says that her previous loan was used in order to pay the fees for her degree, which was of great help. She is applying for this loan today in order to invest again in the payment of her degree tuition in order to be able to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Shavarsh

texts.en:
Shavarsh is 30 years old and lives with his nice wife in the village Lchashen of the Gegharkunik region. Shavarsh is newly married, and they still have no children. This young man is master in different kinds construction work. In his region, he did a lot of building and construction work on schools, churches, markets and other buildings. 

Now, Shavarsh is a farmer on his cute and comfortable farm. There he has cows, heifers, pigs, piglets and chickens. He sells not a small range of farm products such as milk, macun (a national dairy product), meat and eggs. As he describes, he is happy with his small and nice family on his cute farm, which he greatly wants to make richer and bigger.

This loan amount he will use for the purchase of one more cow and also a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: for the purchase of one more cow and also a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is 37 years old. She is married, and she has one child who is two years old and not yet in school. She is a farmer, and she has been growing soya beans for the past seven years. Her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested soya beans. The profits from the business will be used to buy a goat.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested soya beans.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe, tiene una vente de ropa y calzado mucho más popular en el mercado, lo ha logrado con la ayuda del crédito anterior, sus nuevos ingresos son de utilidad para ir cubriendo las necesidades básicas de su familia además ha incorporado la elaboración y venta de juguetes de madera como carros, aviones, etc., con el fin de diversificar los productos y el tipo de cliente en su negocio.
Necesita de un nuevo crédito para  comprar ropa, calzado y madera, considera que al tener el inventario debidamente surtido continuara trabajando y evitara problemas para satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Guadalupe has a popular clothing and shoe sales business in the market, which he has succeeded in with the help of a previous loan. His new income is helpful in covering the basic necessities for his family. He has also incorporated the manufacture and sale of wooden toys like cars, airplanes, etc., in order to diversify products and types of customers in his business.

He needs a new loan to buy clothing, footwear and wood. He feels that a properly stocked inventory will allow him to continue working and avoid problems to satisfy his clients' needs.

loans.use: buy clothing, shoes and wood. He thinks properly stocked inventory will allow him to continue working and avoid problems to satisfy his clients' needs.

loans.name: Santos Oscar

texts.es:
Santos, vive con su compañera de vida, hijos y nietos, todos generan ingresos para solventar las necesidades de su hogar, él por su parte se dedica a brindar cortes de cabello, sus clientes son los vecinos de su comunidad, el oficio lo heredo de familia, tiene un empleado que le ayuda a atender el negocio, sus labores inician a las siete de la mañana y finalizan a las cinco de la tarde, su negocio  cuenta con 25 años de estar funcionando.
Solicita un crédito para comprar máquinas para cortar pelo y una silla especial para llevar a cabo su trabajo, su objetivo es renovar el equipo del negocio, atraer nuevos clientes y por supuesto tener nuevas ganancias.
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande y un corto plazo de 2 años contar con tres empleados.
texts.en:
Santos lives with his life partner, children and grandchildren. All work to help pay for living expenses. For his part, Santos works providing haircuts. His customers are neighbors in his community. He inherited the position from his family. He has an employee who helps him attend to the business. His work begins at seven in the morning and ends at five in the evening. His business has been in operation for 25 years. He is applying for a loan to buy materials to cut hair and a special chair to carry out his work. His goal is to renovate his business's equipment, attract new customers and of course, obtain greater earnings. 

His dream is to have a bigger business with three employees in the next 2 years.

loans.use: to buy materials to cut hair and a special chair to carry out his work

loans.name: Kendy María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Carita De Ángel se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Tarqui  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Kendy, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 9, 7 y 2 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es maestro soldador.
Doña Kendy es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para contribuir con los gastos que demandan la educación de sus hijos y los del hogar, ella al ver que a su marido no le alcanza con lo que el gana se decidió a emprender un negocio, ella  vende productos de Yanbal, Avon, (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y productos naturales de una marca china la cual tiene mucha demanda entre sus clientes. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa cuando sus clientes quieren algo. Lleva más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante en ocasiones que su marido no tiene trabajo.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y productos naturales. Esta desde el inicio en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Credit Group Carita De Ángel meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Tarqui in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented at all times of the year, and for being a city with unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Kendy lives in this place. She is 47 years old, married and from her marriage has three children, who are 9, 7 and 2 years old. The two older children study in school. Her husband is a welder. 

Kendy is a woman who likes to work to contribute to paying for the expenses demanded for the education of her children and home. Upon seeing that her husband does not have enough from what he earns she decided to start a business. She sells products from Yanbal, Avon (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women), and natural products from a Chinese brand that is in high demand from her customers. Her method of sale is to go door to door. She also sells from her house when she has customers that want something. She has spent more than 15 years working in this activity, with which she has been able to survive in times where her husband does not have work.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams and natural products. She has participated in the Credit Group since its establishment and she likes it because thanks to the loans, she is able to finance her business. Her dream is to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams and natural products

loans.name: Carolina Vladimir

texts.es:
Carolina, se encuentra acompañada y todavía no tiene hijos, su fuente de ingresos es la venta de comida en su localidad, su negocio está funcionando desde aproximadamente 15 años, no representa dificultades en desarrollar su trabajo ya que tiene mucha experiencia.
Comprará insumos para elaborar la comida tales como: verduras, aceite, carnes, pollo, condimentos, granos básicos, etc., con ello el inventario estará surtido, tendrá la facilidad de seguir trabajando y brindara a sus clientes un mejor servicio.
Carolina tiene  como visión administrar bien el crédito y tener un negocio más rentable para resarcir su deuda y tener un estilo de vida más digno junto a su pareja.
texts.en:
Carolina is in a relationship and does not yet have children. Her source of income is the sale of food in her area. Her business has been in operation for approximately 15 years. She has not had difficulty developing her work, as she has much experience.

With the loan, she will buy supplies to prepare food such as: vegetables, oil, meats, chicken, condiments, basic grains, etc. With these supplies, her inventory will be stocked and she will have the help to continue working and providing her clients with a better service.

Carolina has a vision of using the loan well and having a more profitable business to pay back her debt and have a more dignified way of life, together with her partner.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare food, such as vegetables, oil, meats, chicken, condiments, basic grains, etc. With these items, inventory will be stocked

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 46-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and five children. Four of her children are still attending school. 

In 2000, Ghada started working at her house in tailoring to help her family to meet the needs of life and to ameliorate their lifestyle. She is a very talented person and well-known in her region by her good work. 

To better develop her work, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to buy a new tailoring machine that will help her to serve more clients and improve her work by a large percentage.

loans.use: to buy a new tailoring machine

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida raises and sells poultry animals like ducks. She resides in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has seven children. Her eldest child is 22 and the youngest is 13. Her husband earns a living by being a carpenter. 

She has requested a loan to buy duck feed and purchase additional ducks. It will enable Aida to raise more ducks to be sold. It will slowly improve her earnings and start to expand her business. Thus, she could prepare nutritious food for the whole family. 

Aida hopes that she can handle her poultry business properly for the improvement of the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy duck feed and purchase additional ducks

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married with two children. Both of her children go to school. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. She also takes care of additional family members. Monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food. 

Rehema sells second-hand clothes in the market on a retail basis. She earns additional income by selling soft drinks and passion fruit. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for nine years, and her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. With the loan, she would like to buy bales of used clothes. In the future, she would like to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
From Jenin city, Ibrahim is a 24-year-old-married father for two sons and one daughter. He has been working in an auto paint workshop for the past few years and now wants to open his own shop after having gained valuable experience. 

Ibrahim has requested a USD loan from FATEN to help him buy tools and paints for his auto paint workshop. This will enable him to be independent and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy tools and paints for his auto paint workshop

loans.name: Redempta

texts.en:
Redempta is 48 years old. She is married with three children between 21 and 30 years. They all go to school. Redempta is a farmer ,and she has been growing soya beans for the past 30 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested soya beans. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow for rearing and to buy medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested soya beans.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married with one child who is still too young to attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has been operating a khanga (traditional women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas (traditional women's wrap cloth) for resale.

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en: Spartak is 55 years old and lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. Spartak has a higher education and is a highly qualified engineer who worked for many years in his area of special expertise. Now he has a new job as a butcher in a rented shop where he sells beef, pork, and mutton. He gets meat several times a week from farmers in nearby villages. He says that he does his best to keep his regular customers and also to gain new customers, thanks to the fresh and good meat he has in his shop, and the good prices he charges to his customers. Spartak is the only breadwinner in his family and sometimes faces really great financial hardships, especially when it is time to pay his older daughter’s tuition. She studies at the Yerevan State Economical University with the faculty of International Economic Relations. He needs this loan of 290.000 Armenian drams to pay her tuition for her second semester.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter’s tuition.

loans.name: Deysi Esmeralda

texts.es:
Deysi, con la ayuda del financiamiento anterior abasteció su venta de verduras y frutas con productos nuevos y frescos, sus clientes están satisfechos, la familia tiene mejores oportunidades de superación y ella manifiesta que durante este tiempo no ha tenido problemas para atender el negocio.
Requiere de un nuevo préstamo por la facilidad que le dan para reactivar su negocio, comprara mangos, pepinos, cebollas, melones, papayas, yuca, papas, etc., pretende mantener su negocio bien surtido para atender debidamente a sus clientes y tener su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: With the help of her previous loan, Deysi was able to stock up her vegetable and fruit business with new and fresh products. Her customers are satisfied and her family has better opportunities to progress. She says, that during this time she has not had problems taking care of her business. She needs a new loan because of the chance that she gets to reactivate her business. She will buy mangoes, cucumbers, onions, melons, papayas, cassavas, potatoes, etc.  She wants to have a better stocked business in order to properly serve her customers and have a source of income.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, cucumbers, onions, melons, papayas, cassava, potatoes, etc. in order to have a well stocked business to properly  serve her customers.

loans.name: Kira Tagni Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está integrado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (MARICELA, OLENCIA y VALERIA) pertenecen a la etnia miskita de la comunidad de Saupuka, municipio de Waspam-Rio Coco. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios Se organizaron hace 1 año como banco comunal, sin embargo debido a diversos problemas, se han reducido a la modalidad de grupo solidario. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario Kira Tagni, en vocablo miskito significa Flor del Árbol. 

Maricela: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, con cualidades de líder y deseos de superación, es una señora amable de 47 años de edad, casada con 5 hijos: 2 son mayores de edad y 3 son adolescentes que se encuentran estudiando. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la elaboración de pan artesanal, con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, contribuir a mejorar de las condiciones de vida de su familia. Solicita financiamiento para comprar sartenes, incrementar la cantidad de insumos para producir más pan. Ella sueña con tener vitrinas donde ofertará al público sus productos y mejorar su vivienda de tambo y madera.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of 3 entrepreneurial women (Maricela, Olencia and Valeria) who belong to the Miskito ethnic group in the community of Saupuka, a municipality of Waspam-Rio Coco. They are entrepreneurial women who struggle daily to grow their small businesses. They organized one year ago as a communal bank. However, due to a number of problems, they were reduced to functioning as a solidarity group. They decided to name their solidarity group Kira Tagni, which in the words of the Miskito means Tree Flower. 

Maricela is the coorindator of the group, with leadership qualities and desires for improvement. She is a friendly woman of 47 years, and she is married with 5 children: 2 are adults and 3 are children in school. For the past 2 years she has worked making artisanal bread, with the goal of having her own source of income and contributing to improve the living conditions of her family. She is applying for financing to buy pans to increase the quantity of supplies to make more bread. She dreams of having display cabinets where she will offer her products to the public and improve her dwelling with a barn and wood.

loans.use: to buy pans to increase the quantity of supplies to make more bread

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a married woman with five children. Her eldest child is in school and the family is having challenges paying tuition. Rebecca is therefore seeking UGAFODE's assistance to fund her daughter's studies with help from a Kiva loan. She is grateful that with the loan, her daughter will be able to complete her studies and get a job to help the family meet some of its financial obligations. Rebecca is hardworking and resilient.

loans.use: To pay tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for a new beauty salon.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items such as mineral water, sanitary napkins, biscuits, chips, noodles, soap, canned goods, soft drinks, and seasonings. She is a 62-year-old married woman with six grown children. She hails from Talibon, Bohol.

Antonia is asking for a loan to buy supplies like canned goods, soft drinks, chips, and rice. These will be of great help to improve the contents of her store and also enable buyers to shop. Her daily earnings will increase and she will be able to set aside some savings for emergency use.

Antonia is grateful for the capital she could avail that would definitely improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy supplies like canned goods, soft drinks, chips, and rice

loans.name: Crisna Leticia

texts.es: Crisna de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pollos frescos desde hace 5 años, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal en una zona muy transitada, tiene muchos clientes ya establecidos por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pollos enteros por mayor y así tener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Crisna, 33 years old, lives with her husband and three children in a house that she owns. She has been selling fresh chickens for 5 years. Her business is located in the municipal market in a busy area, and she has many regular customers because of her good prices. With what she makes from her work and with her husband’s help, she manages to keep up with the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy whole chickens at wholesale and thus have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy whole chickens at wholesale.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace varios años su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, adicional a eso también se dedica a la venta de ropa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, frijoles, chicharrón, quesillo, etc. todo por mayor para así tener mejores ingresos económicos y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Marlene is 33 years old and lives in the house she owns together with her family.  She has worked for many years selling pupusas [stuffed tortillas].  Her business is located in her home.  She also works selling clothing.  With the money she earns from her sales, she is able to meet some of her household expenses.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase corn, beans, pork rinds, cheese, and other items at wholesale prices so she can have better income and more financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, pork rinds, and cheese at wholesale prices.

loans.name: María Yesenia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Carita De Ángel se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Tarqui  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 3 hijos de 12, 8 y 4 años de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es mecánico, 
Doña María es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para ayudarle a  su marido con  los gastos que generan el hogar y los estudios de sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad la les sirve de mucho para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas y ropa de niños que es lo que más vende. Lleva 6 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito, le gusta porque con los créditos ella mejora su negocio y su vida. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Credit Group Carita De Ángel meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Tarqui in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented during all times of the year, and for being a city with unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Maria lives in this place. She is 32 years old and has a common-law relationship from which she has 3 children who are 12, 8 and 4 years old. The two older ones study in high school and primary school. Her husband is a mechanic.

Maria is a woman who has always liked to work to help her husband with expenses associated with the home and her children's education. She works in sales and sells clothing of all types. Her method of sales is door-to-door and she also sells from her home when her clients come and need clothes. She sells on credit and charges every 8 days. She has worked in this activity for 4 years and it has helped her greatly to succeed.
 
The loan will be used to buy pants, blouses and children's clothing which she will sell. She has participated in the Credit Group for 6 loan cycles, and likes it because with the loans, she has bettered her business and life. Her dream is to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses and children's clothing

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a farmer and also operates a retail shop in a rural area. He was forced to begin a retail shop so that he could earn daily income. He has been able to progress and supply the area with most of the daily household items needed. Alfred wants to thank UGAFODE and Kiva lenders for the support that they give to rural farmers. He is hardworking and honest according to residents.

loans.use: To buy retail stock items

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: This nice and charming lady’s name is Svetlana, and she lives with her family in Kapan city in Syunik region. Svetlana is 42 years old and is a mother of four children. Her two daughters are already married, and they live with their families. Her elder son is at the army passing his military service, and her younger son is school-aged. Svetlana and her husband established a nice and rich orchard and vegetable garden. Here Svetlana planted apple, apricot, pear, peach, mulberry, and fig trees. She also cultivates potato, cucumber, tomato, carrot, greens, cabbage, and radish. With the help of her husband, she sells the harvest from her house and at the city wholesale market. Their land is their way of living. It is also the source of income for their family, and they care for it properly and carefully. This loan will help Svetlana to repair the irrigation pipes, and to buy vegetable seedlings, diesel fuel and manure for her land.

loans.use: to repair the irrigation pipes and to buy vegetable seedlings, diesel fuel and manure for her land

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh, 49, is married, has two children and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn a living by running a business in which they laminate papers and objects with plastic. Oanh is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more laminating tools and plastic. Her goal is to better satisfy her customers. She very much wants her business to run smoothly and generate a higher income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy tools and plastic to better serve her customers.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y dar el servicio de transporte en camiones y en microbús por toda la zona oriental del país, lo está desarrollando desde hace 30 años, tiene un horario de cinco de la mañana a seis de la tarde o según sea la demandas, es casado, vive con su esposa y entre ambos realizan sus actividades económicas para subsistir.
Está solicitando un préstamo para comprar concentrado para el ganado y le dará mantenimiento a sus vehículos, le permitirá mantener el ganado gordo y dar un servicio de transporte con seguridad, cree que con la inversión mejorara su situación económica y así respaldara el pago de su deuda.
Su visión es cambiar su flota de unidades de transporte para que su negocio sea más popular y tener mejores utilidades para que su estilo de vida sea más confortable.
texts.en:
Tomas works raising livestock and providing transportation services in trucks and mini-buses over the eastern part of the country.  He has been doing this work for 30 years.  He works from 5:00am until 6:00pm or according to demand.  He is married and lives with his wife.  Between the two of them, they work to support themselves.

He is requesting this loan to purchase feed for his livestock so they stay fat and to do maintenance on his vehicles so that he can provide safe transportation for his passengers.  He believes that this investment will improve his financial situation and allow him to repay his debt.  

He hopes to change his fleet of vehicles so his business becomes more popular and to have better profits so his lifestyle is more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his livestock and to maintain his vehicles, which will allow him to keep his livestock fat and provide safe transportation services.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en: Marine is 37 years old and already a rather famous musician in Kapan city in the Syunik region, where she lives with her family. She graduated from the city’s musical college and worked for several years as a voice teacher. Now she works as a musician and teaches children how to play a national Armenian musical instrument called the canon. This is one of the nation's most important and popular instruments and is widely used during national and patriotic songs. This instrument sounds very loud, but the music is very soft and glamorous. It is especially nice when played by a girl or a woman. Marine now has a group of pupils who she teaches her house about the secrets and skills of playing this instrument. Marine’s husband works in a private workshop. Their two sons are school-aged. Marine is seeking this loan to buy a new musical instrument, since the one she is using now is already very old and not working well.

loans.use: to buy a new musical instrument.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Esperanza  está en su ciclo número 11° del programa de comité de mujeres, son de la Ciudad de Itá, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual les permitirá poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
 Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Susana quien gracias al programa de eliminación de la pobreza ha ido creciendo bastante y mejorado sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de carbón, que hoy por hoy es muy vendido ya que las personas lo prefieren pues es más económico. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo muy luchadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar carbón en cantidad, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, luchando por poder mejorar cada día para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group named “La Esperanza” (The Hope) is in its 11th loan cycle as part of the Women’s Committee Program. The members are from the city of Itá and all of them are working and helping one another so that they can get ahead. They have also taken the poverty elimination survey so that they can become familiar with their living situations and take whatever action is needed to improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Sra. Susana. Thanks to the poverty elimination program, she has grown significantly and has improved the living conditions for herself and her family. Susana sells charcoal and now that she has many people who prefer to buy from her, she has improved financially. She is a hardworking person, but most importantly, she is extremely determined.

Susana is requesting a loan in order to buy charcoal in quantity. This will enable her to continue her sales just as before. She strives to improve each day so that she can help her family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal in quantity to sell.

loans.name: Danis

texts.es: Danis de 26 años de edad es padre de 3 hijos en las edades de 1, 4 y 6 años, quienes son su motor para realizar día a día un trabajo consistente. Hace 4 años, inició su negocio de confección en compañía de su madre,  aunque su experiencia data de 10 años atrás, cuando  aprendió este oficio  en el taller de un familiar. En el taller de Danis, él realiza todas las operaciones de la confección para elabora vestidos  en las líneas femeninas e infantil principalmente, aunque también fabrica bermudas para caballeros, para venderlas en almacenes ubicados fuera de la ciudad, donde se encuentra ubicado su mercado principal. Su meta  actual es incrementar la producción y más adelante lograr un mejoramiento técnico de su taller y con ello generar más ganancias y comprar su propia vivienda. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un crédito en Kiva, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen tela, hilos e insumos varios, para producir mucho más y generar una oferta muy variada que impacte la decisión de compra de su clientela, haciendo de su crédito Kiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Danis, 26 years old, is the father of 3 children, ages 1, 4, and 6, who are his driving force to do consistent work day by day.
