Four years ago, he began a sewing business in the company of his mother, although his experience dates from 10 years before, when he learned this work in a family member's workshop. In Danis's shop, he does all sorts of sewing to make dresses in the women's and children's lines, primarily, although he also makes Bermuda shorts for men to sell them in the stores located outside the city, where his principal market is.  His current goal is to increase his production and in the future manage to make technical improvements to his workshop and, with it, generate more earnings to purchase his own house. This is the reason why he asks for a Kiva loan, with which he will purchase a greater volume of fabric, thread, and various supplies to make a lot more and generate a very varied offering which impacts her customers' decision to buy, making his Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase a greater volume of fabric, thread, and various supplies for sewing.

loans.name: Marta Isabel

texts.es:
Marta, vive con su esposo de 40 años de edad y sus cuatro hijos con edades de 10, 8, 7 y 5 años, como familia trabajan en su propia panadería, elaboran diferentes clases de pan y lo comercializan en el mercado municipal, trabajan todos los días, no se observan dificultades en el negocio ni de salud en los miembros de la familia.
Para mejorar su negocio necesita de capital para comprar harinas ($ 600. 00), manteca ($200. 00), leña ($100.00), latas ($300. 00) entre otros materiales que le ayudarán a tener mayor productividad de pan, espera atender nuevas demandas y mejorar sus ganancias.
Su visión es que su negocio se mantenga con vida para tener los recursos económicos con los que apoyara a sus hijos a culminar una carrera.
texts.en:
Marta lives with her 40-year-old husband and their four children (ages 10, 8, 7, and 5). As a family, they work in their own bakery where they make different types of bread to sell at the municipal market. They work every day. Marta and her family have not had any difficulties with their business and none of them have had any health problems.

In order to improve the business, Marta needs capital in order to buy flour ($600), shortening ($200), firewood ($100), baking tins ($300), and other supplies that her family needs to help them produce more bread. She expects that there will be more demand so that they can improve their earnings.

Her vision for her business is to be able to sustain her family with the financial resources it generates and to support her children until they finish a degree.

loans.use: to buy flour, shortening, firewood, baking tins, and other supplies.

loans.name: Ledy

texts.es: Ledy de 39 años de edad se dedica al comercio de artículos mediante guías especializadas, que ofrece a crédito y de contado a vecinos y referidos. Ledy inició su negocio hace 15 años, cuando, su amiga le propuso vender mercancía mediante catálogos y ella inició su propio generador de ingresos, que poco a poco ha ido creciendo. Hoy su meta es tener un local para abrir un punto comercial al público y más adelante remodelar su vivienda, aunque su mayor desafío sea ahorrar e incrementar sus ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cremas, colonias, cosméticos, ropa exterior e interior, con el fin  de aumentar sus ventas y sus utilidades, haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Ledy is 39 years old and earns her living by selling products through specialty catalogs. She offers her products on credit or for cash to her neighbors and referrals. Ledy started her business 15 years ago when a friend suggested that she sell merchandise through catalogs. She started the business so that she could generate an income and gradually she was able to grow. Today her goal is to open a shop in a commercial center where she can sell to the public. Going forward, she would like to remodel her home. Her greatest challenges are being able to save and to increase her sales.

Ledy is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the proceeds to buy crèmes, colognes, cosmetics, outerwear, and undergarments. In the end, she hopes to increase her sales and her profits. This would make her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy crèmes, colognes, cosmetics, outerwear, and undergarments.

loans.name: Zarine

texts.en:
Zarine lives with her husband and single daughter in Kapan, a city in the Syunik region. After graduating from the State Agricultural Institute's faculty of accountancy, she always managed to find work within her specialty, and she currently works as an accountant.

But this does not prevent her from being seriously engaged in land cultivation activities. Zarine has a lot of apple, cherry, fig and nut trees, and on her plot of land she cultivates potatoes, carrots, beans, pumpkins and greens. For all of these products, Zarine finds customers at the city’s wholesale market. 

Her husband is also employed; he works doing deliveries and simultaneously helps his wife on their farm. Zarine is asking for this loan as she needs to buy a lot of seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel for her agricultural activities.

loans.use: to buy a lot of seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel for her agricultural activities

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.es: Don Encarnación de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la venta de periódicos de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, el quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes y encementando el piso, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de arena, cemento, hierro y pago de mano de obra para que el y su esposa puedan vivir mas cómodos y en lo limpio.
texts.en:
Encarnación is 64 years old and lives in a house he owns together with his wife.  He works as a street vendor selling newspapers in different neighborhoods.  With the money he earns from his sales, he has been able to be successful.  

He wants to improve his home by plastering the walls and putting down cement on the floor.  The money he earns from his sales will not allow him to do the work, so he is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, iron, and to pay laborers.  This will allow his family to live more comfortably and cleanly.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, iron, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, su hijo y su nuera, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, etc. que vende de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza y a la ayuda de su esposo y su hijo han logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar, María esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de aceite, papas, yuca,  plátanos y todos los ingredientes para su elaboración y así poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica..
texts.en:
María is 47 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, her son and her daughter in law. She earns a living making and selling snacks like fried potatoes, fried cassava, empanadas etc. which she sells as a street vendor near to where she lives. Thanks to the sales that she makes and the help of her husband and her son they have managed to cover the household expenses. 

María is asking for a loan to buy oil, potatoes, cassava, bananas and all the ingredients she needs to make her snacks. She can thus continue to maintain her household and be able to have greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, cassava, bananas and all the ingredients she needs to make her snacks.

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ana, está siendo beneficiada con el uso de créditos Kiva, manifiesta que el comedor esta mejor equipado y que sus nuevos ingresos le periten aportar más en los gastos de su hogar.
Ella ve en los créditos una herramienta útil para progresar, nuevamente solicita un préstamo para comprar granos básicos, sal, condimentos, verduras, bebidas, etc., para seguir elaborando la comida y tener la estabilidad económica que hasta hoy mantiene.
texts.en:
Ana continues to benefit from her use of Kiva loans.  Her dining room is better equipped and her new income allows her to contribute more to the household expenses.

She sees loans as a useful tool to move forward.  She is requesting a new loan to purchase basic grains, salt, condiments, vegetables, drinks, and other items to continue making food and to have financial stability like she has maintained so far.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, salt, condiments, vegetables, drinks, and other items to continue making food and maintain her financial stability.

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le is 33 years old and married with one son. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver. Le has been running a cafe to earn a living for 12 years. 

She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different coffee products and beverages to sell to her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of different coffee products and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is 51 years old and married with one daughter. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a sculptor. Anh has been running a food stall for 10 years, where she sells coffee and sugarcane juice to earn a living. 

She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different beverages and sugarcane to sell to her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of different beverages and sugarcane to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lieu

texts.en:
Lieu is 53 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a delivery man. She  earns income running a food stall to serve people in her community. 

She started her business five years ago. She intends to use the loan to gradually expand her business by buying better quality food to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy better quality food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alaa Eddin

texts.en:
Alaa Eddin is a 33-year-old married man from Dier El Balah city. He lives with his wife and two kids. Four years ago, Alaa opened a store for selling kids’ toys and gifts. It is a good business and very profitable.

Alaa would like to improve his business and expand it, so he took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a collection of flowers and sell it in his store. This will improve his business and expand it.

Alaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a collection of flowers to sell in his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and raw food for his new restaurant.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a merchant from Talibon, Bohol. She sells kitchen wares and mineral water. She also raises and sells hogs. She is 38 years old, married and has five children, ages 7 to 17. Her husband's income helps defray the family's daily expenses. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more mineral water and feed to improve the way she raises pigs. Vilma could buy mineral water in bulk to avoid shortages. She could meet her customers' needs and generate higher earnings. Thus, she could prepare healthy diets and have better shelter.

 She is hoping that, with the additional capital, she will be able to manage it properly for the improvement of her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more mineral water and pig feed

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 32 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Amie has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish, sacks of salt and other materials for her dried fish making business.

Amie has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, sacks of salt and other materials for her dried fish making business

loans.name: Lua

texts.en: Lua is requesting a new loan to buy furniture and better quality food for selling. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall, increasing sales, and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture and better quality food for selling

loans.name: Jennifer Abigail

texts.es:
Jennifer, tiene como medio de subsistencia la venta de zapatos y sandalias, su producto lo sale a vender cada día, sin un horario fijo en el mercado municipal, ella tiene una familia compuesta por su esposo de 25 años de edad y un hijo de 2 años de edad.
El crédito le dará los recursos necesarios para poder comprar zapatos cerrados y sandalias para damas, así como también para  niños/as, incrementara el inventario para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, espera ir mejorando económicamente y crecer como microempresaria.
Sus sueños son mantenerse trabajando y brindar a su hijo lo mejor en educación.
texts.en:
As a means of earning her living, Jennifer sells shoes and sandals. She works every day but doesn't have a fixed schedule. Her place of work is the local market. Her husband is 25 years old and she has a 2-year old son.

A loan will provide Jennifer with the means to buy women's shoes and sandals as well as footwear for children. She will be able to increase inventory and respond to her customers' requests. She hopes to improve her financial situation and grow her business. Her dream is to stay working and provide her son with the best possible education.

loans.use: buy women's shoes and sandals as well as footwear for children
